campaign.story:
What is SPQR?
SPQR is a brand-new comic created, written, and lettered by Riley Hamilton with pencils from Samrat Das, inks from Rowel Roque, and colours by Lucas Aparicio. It is a historical fiction set in the Roman Empire in 69 CE, also known as the Year of the Four Emperors. The story is an action comic with a healthy dose of character drama and is inspired by true events. If you are a fan of history, cavalry charges, and legions of Romans then this comic is for you!

Synopsis
It is 69 CE; the death of Nero has thrown the Roman Empire into chaos. Several powerful generals have been proclaimed as Emperor by their legions and march on Rome to lay claim to the title Augustus. On the frontier of the Empire, a tribe of starving nomads, seeking food and supplies, have crossed into Roman territory. Ara, a young hunter and eager warrior, is among them and longs to fight against the famous steel men of Rome. He will receive his wish far sooner than he expects.

Preview
Here is a four page preview of the first issue.
Meet the Team
Riley Hamilton (Writer & Letterer):
Riley Hamilton has been writing stories as long as he can remember. As a kid he even drew his own comics, though none survive. After putting his pen down for a number of years he rediscovered his passion for writing through helping his university's comic club write and self-publish their own superhero comic book, Gael Force. SPQR is his solo creator debut.
Samrat Das (Penciller):
Samrat is a penciller from India. He is really passionate about what he does which makes everything he works exceptionally satisfying. He is really into comics and pencilling has always been the medium through which he contributes in this field. He is always looking for more opportunities to draw. You can find him at dsamrat7@gmail.com.

Rowel Roque (Inker):
Rowel Roque is both a penciller and inker based in the Philippines and has worked on a number of comic book projects. Rowel has also done animation work and worked on titles such as Les Enfants de Toromiro and Goofballs.
Lucas Aparicio (Colourist):
Lucas Aparicio is a comic colorist and flatter based in Argentina. He has mostly worked as a freelance artist since 2017 when he decided to take his career more seriously. He started with a lot of small projects, and learned that coloring comics is not about light and shadow or rendering but about storytelling and he hopes to continue to tell stories for many years to come.

Campaign Goals
The goal of this campaign is to secure funding for the printing and distribution of issue #1 of SPQR. We have a reliable printer based in Toronto, Ontario with a proven track record for delivering high-quality books in a timely manner. We will also be pursuing digital distribution on Gumroad for both electronic and print copies of issue #1.
https://gumroad.com/rileyhamiltoncomics

Budget
Printing: $650 (A print run of 150 books from our printer plus the physical prints)
Shipping: $850 (Estimated cost of packing and shipping to get the books out to backers)
Total: $1500

Rewards
$1 - Enemy of Rome: Our eternal gratitude for helping get this book to print. Your name will be added to Sulla's proscription list at the end of the book.
$5 - Tribune: You will receive a digital download copy of SPQR Issue 1 with standard cover when it's completed, along with a special thanks credit.
$15 - Quaestor: A physical copy of SPQR Issue 1 with the standard cover, signed. This tier includes all digital rewards.
$25 - Aedile: VARIANT COVER #1: Own a copy of SPQR Issue 1, signed, with the exclusive to Kickstarter variant cover. Includes all digital rewards plus a digital copy of the issue with the variant cover.
$35 - Praetor: A physical copy of SPQR Issue 1 with the standard cover, signed along with an 8.5X11 print of your choice from the options below. This tier includes all digital rewards.
$50 - Consul: A physical copy of SPQR Issue 1 with the standard cover, signed along with 3 8.5X11 prints of your choice from the options below. This tier includes all digital rewards.
$100 - Imperator: You are Augustus! You will be drawn in as a speaking character in the next issue! You will receive your physical copy of SPQR Issue 1 with your choice of the Kickstarter-exclusive variant cover or the standard cover. You will also receive all 4 prints and all digital rewards.
Art Prints Available
Below are the art prints available at the Praetor tier and above.
Print of the Standard Cover by Ralph Barrientos.
Print of the Kickstarter Variant Cover by Antônio Uchôa.
Gladiator Duel by LockheartSaly.

updates.update_userinfo: Books have all Shipped & Final Thank You
updates.update_content:
Happy Sunday everyone,

After a few setbacks and delays, the books have finally gone out! I just wanted to thank you all one last time for offering your generous support to a rookie creator who is very much still learning the ropes. I hope that we created a story that you enjoyed and came away satisfied with. If you know anyone who was interested in picking the book up but missed the Kickstarter, I have the extra copies along with the misprints available on my Gumroad store https://gumroad.com/rileyhamiltoncomics.

Hi everyone,

It's been about a week and a half since my last update and I wanted to let you all know that the first batch of books have been sent out. Hopefully, you will be getting them soon.

As for the printing error on the variant cover, I have arranged for a reprint, which should hopefully be here by the end of next week or the beginning of the week after. Once those come in and I have made certain that there are no issues, I will start getting those packages out to all of you.

Welcome to the START AGAIN Universe
START AGAIN is a Kickstarter-exclusive INDIE SUPERHERO UNIVERSE set in an alternate version of the United Kingdom.
In our ALL-NEW START AGAIN: Stories issue you'll be able to see what happens when social media doesn't like the re-design of a popular comic character, a one night stand gone right and the unmissable prelude to START AGAIN #4.
The final instalment of START AGAIN: Stories. Extremely limited print run.
START AGAIN Stories #1 Preview:
START AGAIN: Stories #2 Preview

 Alesha
 Jonny & Tina
Stretch Goals
After the funded we have six amazing A4 prints (8.27 x 11.69 inches) to unlock. Every backer will get these rewards if we meet our targets!
Featuring three ALL-NEW Victoria prints as she cosplays as "Trix", "Defender" and "Fifty"
Unlocking a goal listed in the graphic above will make it so that all orders with shipping get sent physical prints from the designs above.
We love digital backers too, so we'll also send digital copies to every tier backer. Nobody gets left behind!
Discover START AGAIN
Hungry for a new superhero series?
This campaign also features the entire START AGAIN comic series to date, a critically acclaimed indie superhero universe, that is exclusive to Kickstarter.
Featuring art by talent that have worked on projects for DC, Marvel, IDW and Dark Horse.
Preview:
START AGAIN is a story about Ajay Verma and his struggles with worsening mental health after his secret identity, details about his personal life and compromising images are leaked on social media.
Dive deep into a superhero universe fit for the new decade!
Note: ALL our comics will be delivered to you uncensored, but to comply with Kickstarter we've had to censor and/or not show some content.

campaign.story:
After unlocking the final stretch goal, the book is available in two different colours
GM level up!
We have all been there. You have introduced a background character, tavern interior, or maybe you briefly mentioned a chair in the corner… then your players ask you every conceivable detail about it. Even the most experienced game masters need a helping hand sometimes, and that is where Roll & Play comes in. This 84-PAGE* book is packed with generators, loot producers and setting inspiration which will help you master your game on the fly, and help to add richer detail to the world you create.  
 *94-PAGE after the More, More! stretch goal was unlocked 
Spread not final
Behind-the-screen friendly
One of the key features of this project is its wire binding – this helps to maximise space right where you need it, behind your games master screen. Space is at a premium behind there with your notepad, dice, tablet computers, pens, miniatures, maps etc. but with the wire binding you can easily fold the book in half without forcing it to stay open or worrying about it closing by itself like a normal book. Because of its A5 wire-bound format, it will fit snugly next to your essentials during your game. 
Roll & Play is also available as a digital eBook and a print-optimised PDF, for all of the DMs that use a combination of technology and paper during their games!  
Spread not final
Roll and play
The concept is simple. Either before a game or during a game flick to the generator of your choice, roll the indicated dice, and read out the result. By doing so, you have just easily produced detailed content that will satisfy your players with minimal effort or thought. Of course, you can adapt or add to anything in the book with your own imagination and campaign settings using the book as a helping hand on your way! 
Spread not final
Who is the creator?
My name is Sam Bartlett, I studied Visual Communication at the Arts University Bournemouth (UK) and since graduating six years ago I have worked as a graphic designer for one of the world's largest international publishers. I have plenty of experience in producing books and working to print specifications. Producing a quality product is my highest priority, and I won't let anything go to the printers unless I know it is exactly how I want it to look. I also have plenty of tabletop role-playing experience, I am a DM and Player within the London Wargaming Guild (the largest tabletop gaming club in the UK), and I am currently DMing 3 separate campaigns with friends – some of which have run for a number of years.
I will be designing, illustrating and writing the content of the book. However, I can’t make something like this alone and I will need your help, as a book like this needs to be something that works for everyone. Pledging at Beholder or Mind Flayer status will make you a Producer of this project and your name will be featured on the inside cover; you will be able to vote on elements of the content meaning the book will shaped by those who help bring it to life. 
Spread not final
What will the content be?
I am still working on the final synopsis. However, my plan so far includes the following:
Chapter 1: People (NPC names, NPC defining features/flaws, Tattoo generator, Travelling merchants and wares, Mysterious allies and motives, Bard songs, Instruments and band names, Fiendish contracts, Lingering injuries, Resurrection side effects + more)
Chapter 2: Items (Chest fillers, Quest rewards, Magical item generators, Single-use magic items, Magical drawbacks, Trinkets, Unlabelled potion reactions, Misfiring magic scrolls, Picked pocket loot, Body looting, Art pieces + more)
Chapter 3: Encounters (Critical hit and miss results, Arctic encounters, Coastal encounters, Desert encounters, Forest encounters, Mountain encounters, Swamp encounters, Cave encounters, Underwater encounters, Traps, Door mechanisms, Monster motives, Monster origins, Unusual plants + more)
Chapter 4: World Building (Quest ideas, Tavern generators, Festival generators, Shop generators, Local attractions, Street rumours, Bounty posters, Books names/authors, Dream/Nightmare generators, Blessings, Curses, Diseases, Hauntings + more)
More, More! Stretch Goal: 10 Additional Pages (Alchemical backfires, Potion tastes and descriptions, Strange otherworldly corruptions, How the party first meet, Magical encounters and phenomenon, Cave names and descriptions, Charlatan scams, Global developments, Conspiracies and rumours, Guild names, and Local economic/political make-up)
5 Exclusive Generator Cards (Puzzles and challenges, Tavern food and drink menu, Random weather forecasts, Vehicles and mounts, Side quests) – included with Hobgoblin pledge level and above. Read all about them in Update 12!
Cover subject to change
Post Campaign Add-Ons
If you back Roll & Play, at the end of the campaign you will be able to add a selection of EXTRA rewards to your pledge when filling out the backer surveys (these will be sent out by our pledge manager BackerKit up to 2 weeks after the campaign closes). See below for a list of things you can add, and read Update 16 for the full details.
The notebook cover is 100% customisable!
Backers will be able to add (max. 3 copies of each per backer):
Extra physical copies of Roll & Play, £14 each
Extra eBooks, £9 each
Extra sets of the 3 themed bookmarks, £3 per set
Extra sets of the 5 exclusive generator cards, £5 per set (Hobgoblin and above only)
Orange and blue Roll & Play themed pencils, £1 each
The newly announced Roll & Play: The Game Master's Notebook, £8 each
The notebook has been specially designed with GMs in mind. It contains 3 pages of character reference boxes, 62 pages of lined paper with purposeful margins for your session notes, 8 pages of quarter-inch hex paper for large-scale maps, 8 pages of half-inch hex paper for smaller-scale maps, 12 pages of squared paper for dungeon/room planning, and 1 page for quick reference notes at the back. The cover is printed on uncoated paper stock so it is 100% customisable! Paint it, colour it, or go crazy with glitter and sequins, it is totally up to you.
All extra add-ons will add a minor shipping charge, proportionate to the extra weight of the package.
Take session notes, create maps and plan out dungeons...
Bonus: Playable Races
After unlocking the Playable Races stretch goal, backers will be sent four NEW playable races absolutely free with every pledge level. The four races will be fully fleshed-out in a printable PDF (including lore, traits, name suggestions and features) and sent to all backers around a month after delivery of the books. All credit for the incredible commissioned artwork goes to Sketchgoblin. Read all about them in Update 20!
The races include:
Oozlings / innately magical slime humanoids, which must split every ten years.
Borsukk / somewhat tribal badger humanoids with a fierce sense of loyalty.
Hederans / ancient, solitary, plant-like protectors of the world around them.
Blackhorns / brutish and powerful beetle humanoids, with very thick carapaces.
Which race are you most looking forward to playing as?
What if I want even more?
Don't worry, I have you covered if you want more loot! If you pledge over £30 you'll not only receive a Roll & Play generator book, you'll also receive THREE bookmarks and FIVE extra generator cards which you can paperclip to your GM Screen. These will be exclusive generators, voted for by the producers (see above) of the book.
You want more than that? Well, if you pledge £50 to the rare and illusive Beholder level (there are only a limited amount of these) you will have your name immortalised forever as an NPC included within one of the generators! You will also be credited as a Producer of this book and get to vote on future content.
You want even more?! If you pledge £100 to one of the very limited Mind Flayer levels, I will personally DM a session of Dungeons & Dragons 5e for you and up to four friends (5 players max) digitally over the Roll20 platform. This will be based on a theme of your choice and at a level of your choice.
Contact me
Email: rollandplaybook@gmail.com
Instagram: @rollandplaybook
Twitter: @RollAndPlayBook
Facebook: /RollAndPlayBook

campaign.story:
DODGE! is a story in FOUR ISSUES. It features paranormal commandoes fighting a pack of Soviet werewolves!
Are you a fan of '80s and '90s action movies and comic books? Then, pal we have a comic book series for you!
Writer Matt Nixon (RETCON, Wolverine) and artist Mike Rooth (Conan/Red Sonja, TMNT, Little Bird) team up to bring you a high-adrenaline, supernatural SCI FI thriller with loads of high-stakes action and packed with story in each issue!
From the steamy jungles of Vietnam to the frozen wilderness of Siberia, para-human Green Berets take on a pack of Soviet werewolves in a race to secure a doomsday weapon before it can be used to kill millions.
“I set a new universe in motion with RETCON,” says Matt Nixon, a creator who has handled influential properties like Conan the Barbarian and Wolverine. “The physics of that story allow me to retcon my own creation and with that we get to tell more specific sorts of stories, like the werebear commando Chris ‘the Animal’ Dodge’s origin. I’ll give you some more of the details of the RETCON Universe but it’s a more simple story this time around with DODGE!.”
Drawn and inked by Mike Rooth, one of the most respected and beloved artists to emerge from the world of comic books. His work DODGE! is going to interject Rooth’s name into any discussion about handling the most hallowed licensed characters in the world.
“This is the best gig I’ve ever had,” said Mike Rooth. “It’s testing me, and pushing me, and humbling me at times but it’s pulling the best out of me. I’m getting better every day. DODGE! is helping me focus and making me healthier too, I’ve lost weight and I’m stronger.”
Featuring reward pin-ups by baller talent like Casey Parsons and Shay Hahn
We are making this book because we love Chris Dodge. If you didn't fall for him when you read RETCON, then this book will make you a believer.
Colored by Caroline Nolasco, each issue is a clinic in state of the art coloring techniques and technology. Caroline creates a visceral atmosphere, shifting from frozen forest to thick jungle in a crisp and clean way that orients the reader perfectly from page to page.
DODGE! RETCON Volume 2 is a throwback prequel with over-the-top characters, period settings and Cold War themes. We’re taking you back in time with a retcon of RETCON Volume 1. Mike Rooth was asked to emulate the bold lines, and square jaws that were so popular during the '80s and '90s but we’ve refined it with a more classic storytelling style with lots of detailed panels. Each issue is full of action and story.
This is an exploration of late ’80s heroism calling back “Predator”, “Platoon” and the glory days of Wolverine.
Set during the Cold War, DODGE! tells the modern origins of the Paranormal Ordnance Disposal team seen in RETCON Volume 1. Returning for DODGE! are Keith Swan, the bionic commando turned world-ending villain and of course Chris “the Animal” Dodge.
Meet Arnold Begay, the Rez Dog from Arizona. A man of few words, Arnold always seems to rise to the occasion, especially when he’s riding the wind.
Introducing a new cast of villains, including a real bad egg from Russian folklore, meet Koschei the Undying and find yourself in a globe-trotting tale of high-adventure!
Cover Tiers
Stretch Goal 1 - DODGE! Sticker A
Stretch Goal 2 - DODGE! Sticker B
Sample of the DODGE! unaltered and hand altered print pledge level
Who you’re supporting with your pledge:
**Matt Nixon has been writing comic books for over 20 years. From Conan: The Barbarian to Weapon-X and on to Wolverine, Nixon has worked with Marvel, Image and IDW (doing a comic book retcon of the horror classic Motel Hell). In 2017, through Image Comics, Nixon launched the first RETCON story with legendary artist Toby Cypress. This is his first Kickstarter.
Matt Nixon
**Mike Rooth is a Canadian Freelance Art Mercenary possessed of a life-long love of art and comics whose illustration career began in the mid 1990’s. Since then Rooth’s work has appeared in hundreds of magazines, RPGs, children's books and comic books, but he’s probably best known for his cover art for publishers such as Aftershock (Animosity, Pestilence, Dark Ark), Archie Comics (SuperDuck, Archie Meets Flash Gordon) Dark Horse/ Dynamite (Conan/Red Sonja, Pathfinder), Image Comics (DIE, Nailbiter), Valiant (Quantum & Woody, Shadowman), IDW (TMNT: Jennika) and many others. DODGE! is Mike’s first time drawing interiors for a comic series, inside and out, and he really hopes you’ll like it, eh?
Mike Rooth
**Caroline Nolasco is a native southern Californian, a hermit crab who spends her days coloring comics, she has both worked with ChapterHouse Publishing and as a freelancer. A Kubert School alumni, when she's not fiddling with comics in Photoshop and crying over video games she spends her time wrangling her horse sized dogs into behaving.
Caroline Nolasco
**Matt Krotzer gives voices to characters and adds sound to action. As a comic book letterer and graphic designer working for powerhouses like Image, Dark Horse, and many fine independent comics around the world, he’s collaborated with some of brightest artists in comics. He is an optimist and frequent champion of lost causes, including the mighty Bengals of Cincinnati. Matt lives in suburban Pennsylvania with his wife, daughter and faithful feline companion, Teddy.
Matt Krotzer
Thanks to fan support and Nixon’s compulsion to share this story with you, we are hoping you will be part of making second volume of RETCON, a reality in 2020.

updates.update_content:
Hi All,
We are going to launch at about 11:00 am. So a 10 minutes from now! Supes excited.
https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mattnixon/dodge-1-2-a-comic-mini-series-starring-a-surly-werebear?ref=3p9y1z&token=3555688d

Hi Everyone!
I’m still AMAZED by what we’ve all accomplished with DODGE! Issue #1. Again, you guys are the reason it happened, and I still can’t thank you enough.
Mike Rooth, Caroline Nolasco, Matt Krotzer, and I are back with DODGE! Issue #2 and we are bringing it! We are already at the coloring stage and we should be ready to go to print by the 1st of the year. That means that we should be getting Issue #2 to you all by March!

Hi Backers!
Good news, everyone! DODGE! #1 is fulfilling early. Today we sent out the PDF. If you didn’t see yours, let me know.
We are starting to send out your physical rewards in phases. We’ve already started with the simple rewards first, and are working our way up to the bigger packages.

Hi Backers!
The reward surveys just went out. If you haven’t received yours, please let me know and we will get you sorted out. If you have ANY questions or concerns, please message me and I will respond to you ASAP.
Thank you all so very much for making this happen. We will work hard to make sure that you get your rewards as soon as we possibly can.

Hi Backers!
DODGE! issue #1 has been printed. All three variants are in hand. The quality is well beyond expectations and we are very proud of what you helped us make here.
Mike is set to mark up the black and white version, and the werewolf prints. If you pledged at those levels, please be ready to come up with an idea for him to draw.

Good morning, Backers!
The colored version of DODGE! #1 is locked and set to go to the printers. It looks GREAT! If things continue to move at this pace, we will be able to fulfill a little early.
The black and white version is also nearly complete. Mike will start to mark those up as soon as he gets them in hand.

I have been a comic book professional since 1997. I have written for Marvel, IDW and Image Comics.
However, nothing can compare to the absolute joy and satisfaction you have given me as the creator of DODGE!
We didn’t just make our goal - we doubled it!!!

We broke $6,000 and that means each physical pledge will ship with an additional sticker. If you’re keeping count, that’s a total of three stickers sent as stretch goal rewards. Here are what the first three look like. The next one will be unlocked at $6,500!

Hi Backers!
We are pretty darn close to $6,000!
We are so happy and grateful! Now, if we break through that wall, we will be adding (to all physical pledges) this AWESOME sticker that Mike Rooth designed for us.

campaign.story:
Art is a journey, and I'd like to invite you to walk through mine.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is a 60-page softcover, perfect bound art book that celebrates the process of creating art, from the initial sketches and thumbnails to the final piece. 
This book collects the concept and marketing art from my first creator series, Sunmaker, through the last three years (2016-2019) of covers, pinups, and anthology submissions with insights to the creative process.
I believe books are works of art. Therefore, I've taken great consideration to make Bright Ideas, Dark Mind of the highest quality I can.
Of course!
Each physical book will receive a numbered and signed 3" x 4" bookplate, exclusive to Kickstarter! Pretty cool, right?
I mean, since you're helping me make this thing I wanna make sure you have something you can't get anywhere else.
Keep an eye out for an upcoming Kickstarter update where YOU can help choose the final art!
 
  Hey, there! I'm Ryan Kroboth, and I'm an illustrator, colorist, and writer from Pennsylvania. 
Most of my art education has been self-taught through books (and later blogs). However, in the last few years I've taken digital coloring, lettering, art, and digital inking courses through Comics Experience. 
Through these classes, I’ve experienced a large leap in my artistic growth in a short period of time. The biggest being learning to color digitally, and learning about color in general.
Perhaps one of the most exciting parts of Bright Ideas, Dark Mind is it contains just about all of my digital colors after the Comics Experience course. You’ll get to see my experimentation and growth across the course of the book!
I have a passion for teaching, and I love sharing the lessons I’ve learned with others. And I’ll be sharing a story or two throughout the campaign.
To bring you the best possible book, I teamed up with Dave Lentz to help me with the logo and the finalized design of the book. Dave has been a big help with Sunmaker, and you'll see some of his art in Bright Ideas, Dark Mind in our Cthulhu story!
Here's a bit more about Dave:
Dave Lentz is a family man, letterer, graphic designer, and sometimes artist. When he's not making comics he's usually reading them.
He is a fan of Star Wars, Batman, Ninja Turtles, and ninjas in general. 
Some of his credits include Metalshade, Spero: Breaker of Worlds (coming soon from Source Point Press), and Arabella Damage (coming soon from Action Lab).
You can find some of the things he do here
Few things get me as pumped as an awesome art book!
What's not to love?!
While some collectors are looking for a single image that resonates with them to hang on their wall, I prefer a book that collects the work of an artist.
I love seeing the growth across multiple projects. 
Not only that, but I feel like I get more value from an art book. I wanna see all the art!
And I wish more artists collected their work into books. I feel it's not a common thing in the comic artist space... I'm always looking when I find a new artist I dig! Seriously, every artist should make an art book!
(You can ask my friends. I'm always bugging them.)
With my passion for art books, I'd love the opportunity to offer one of my own.
Reaching the point in my artistic journey to consider this is a bit mind-blowing, honestly.
As there was a point that I almost gave up on art.
In high school I discovered Deviant Art. This was my first window into seeing art from other artists. The sheer talent of the work crushed my confidence. In retrospect I know this is silly, but at the time I felt like I'd never be "good enough". So I stopped drawing for a very long time.
Ask any artist and they will tell you drawing is a part of who you are.
Eventually I found my way back. And through the encouragement of my wife I finally took the steps of becoming the comic artist I'd always dreamed of being.
I'm still learning and growing. Over the last few years I've released two self-published creator owned comics, done several anthologies, and had the privilege of sharing the worlds of other creators by doing pinups and a few covers.
Bright Ideas, Dark Mind collects developmental material and sketches of those pieces.
And I'm hoping to raise money on Kickstarter to fund a print run of the book so I can share those with you.
At one point seeing great art crushed my confidence, now it inspires me.
I'd love the chance to inspire you and others.
The book is already 99% complete! The only page left to complete is the one bearing your name as a backer.
I'm looking to print 100 digital-press copies of the book through PrintLore.
Therefore, most of the funds will go to cover printing costs. Kickstarter and Stripe take a small fee off the top, with the rest of the money raised going to cover shipping.
 
   
  Here's what to expect for the campaign:
As an avid collector of books, I want to make sure you receive your book in excellent shape.
Not only will it be shipped in a Lil Packaging bukwrap cardboard mailer to keep your book protected, you will find it secured by cardboard inserts and wrapped in a plastic sleeve to shield it from the elements.
But the real secret?
Ninjas.
That's right. Your own personal package protector. These guys will keep your shipment safe, as no one wants to mess with a ninja.
No one.
While I've done my best to attempt to select shipping materials that will best keep your product safe, I'm aware that things do happen.
If for any reason you receive a package at fulfillment that doesn't meet your quality standards I will replace it at absolutely no cost to you.
I know there are collectors out there, and I want your book to make it to you in excellent condition.
 Thank you for the opportunity to share my project with you.
I'd like to ask for your support in bringing Bright Ideas, Dark Mind to life. Please back this campaign today and allow me to share my journey with you!
With gratitude,
Ryan
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I understand what it means to ask for your support. 

This is my third Kickstarter, so I (more-or-less) know what to expect.

The biggest challenge to the campaign is the outside vendors, namely our printer. I have nothing but confidence in our printer, PrintLore. I've worked with them on my previous Sunmaker campaign. If any problems arise, I have had great communication from the company and I don't think that will change.

All the shipping supplies have been purchased, meaning all shipping costs will be for postage.

I'm very familiar with Kickstarter platform having backed over 300 campaigns. This helps give me insight to what a backer looks for and expects. In addition, I am a part of the ComixLaunch course which specializes in crowdfunding comics. With this community I have an experienced group to turn to should the unexpected arise.

And above all, I pride in communication. So if we run into any problems you can be assured that I'll let you know.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
We are shipping the majority of our digital comics to backers two weeks after our campaign ends!
Social media is ruining our superheroes!
START AGAIN is a story about Ajay Verma and his struggles with worsening mental health after his secret identity, details about his personal life and compromising images are leaked on social media.
Dive deep into a superhero universe fit for the new decade!
Our latest campaign introduces the ALL-NEW issue three as well as giving fresh backers the chance to get the entire collection of START AGAIN comics we've produced to date.
Featuring art and colours by industry veterans Toni Doya (IDW), Roger Bonet (Marvel & DC), Zak Hartong (Dark Horse), Sean Callahan (Action Labs), hungry new talent like Neri Rearte (START AGAIN: Stories) and Maury Tanaka. 
NOTE: FINAL PRODUCT(S) WILL NOT FEATURE CENSORSHIP BARS
WORK-IN-PROGRESS IMAGES
START AGAIN: Stories is a standalone comic that expands on the main story you know and love while exploring the effects superheroism could have on normal lives!
Four explosive short stories featuring themes such as online harassment, drug addiction and male suicide. 
START AGAIN: Sketches 
The FINAL stretch goal is upon us. Get a behind-the-scenes look at START AGAIN issue #3 by seeing the initial sketches of pages, character designs and more all collected in a digital PDF.
Perfect for fans looking for a deeper look into the production of the START AGAIN Universe.
Digital stretch goal made available for all backers at £4 and above.
After seeing multiple requests we've decided to do a stretch goal where, if met, all the START AGAIN #3 physical copies will be signed by the creator.
We always make it our mission to give YOU our readers what you want!

For our LEVEL TWO stretch goal we knew we had to do something special to celebrate YOUR awesome support. We went away and asked Luke Summerscales, the artist of Fabled Four, to create a pixel version of our first ever cover!
All backers of physical tiers, that include shipping, will get an art print of the pixel version if we reach our new target. Digital backers will get a digital copy.
Thank you for believing in us.
We've got a KILLER set of stretch goals for our backers. Every time we reach one of the goals above we will reveal a new A4 art print for ALL of our tier backers.
All physical tier backers will get print copies. All digital tier backers will get digital copies.
We are leaving no-one behind! 
We've added the ability to add-on items to backer orders by popular demand. Below are crowdfunding exclusive rewards that are only available as add-ons!
All you have to do is add the amount listed below, beside the item(s) you want, and when your survey arrives you'll be able to select what add-ons you purchased.
Note: Add-ons are only available to those that have backed tiers that include shipping.
 A4 is 8.27 x 11.69 inches
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 14th Kickstarter. We've learned from every campaign and we have used those lessons to improve each project.

We ship using high quality materials that you would expect from the top online stores.

The only risks we face are if we run into issues with printing delays, injury to creative talent and other situations that are out of our control. If anything happens we will update you. We send out e-mails to backers every two weeks until the project is fulfilled.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The START AGAIN series is exclusive to crowdfunding! 
What is START AGAIN: Stories?
START AGAIN: Stories is a standalone comic set in Jamie Me's critically acclaimed superhero universe. Dive into four explosive works about the influence of the super-powered on our lives!
**TWO WEEK CAMPAIGN**
Featuring art by Roger Bonet (DC/Marvel) and Neri Rearte (START AGAIN: Jordan & Mouthy). Maury Tanaka on colours (START AGAIN: Jordan). Editing by Archie Dait. 
By popular demand our final stretch goal will be an A4 print version of START AGAIN: Victoria page 1 without text.  You can check out the art below in the preview section. 
Thank you for believing in the START AGAIN Universe, and I can't wait to share the finished campaign with you.
This stretch goal will be unlocked for backers of tiers that include shipping. 
START AGAIN: Stories Companion PDF
Due to your amazing support, we are now moving on to STRETCH GOALS LEVEL 2. These will be digital rewards, and will be unlocked for all backers at £4 and above.
The START AGAIN: Stories Companion PDF is now funded. You'll get insider knowledge into the creative process and much more!
The START AGAIN: Stories STRETCH GOALS LEVEL 1 unlocked a series of prints thought up by Jamie Me and Archie Dait. The art will be done by Neri Rearte.
All orders that include shipping will receive three additional A4 prints with their orders.
Meet Victoria, she's a passionate cosplayer who has recently seen a massive increase in her internet notoriety. The problem? She's struggling to deal with the impact social media comments are having on her personal life.
WANT MORE?
Find out how Victoria's story ends by backing this Kickstarter, and you'll also get THREE additional comics inside START AGAIN: Stories.
Sarah is trying for a baby
Jordan is struggling with life in the "Super City"
Mouthy deals with loss 
START AGAIN: Stories features FOUR unique comics totalling 24 STORY pages + EXTRAS!
Here are the page counts of EVERY comic featured in this Kickstarter:
START AGAIN 1 & 2 = 40 story pages combined
Queen 1 & 2 = 42 story pages combined
IRL: Complete Edition = 48 pages
Fabled Four 1 & 2 = 44 story pages combined 
 New to the START AGAIN superhero universe? 
Now is the perfect opportunity to get stuck into our critically acclaimed comic series. Get the entire collection of START AGAIN issues produced to date, and all of the behind-the-scenes content.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 12th Kickstarter, and we have learned a great deal over the years. We've used every single campaign to streamline the process. All of our campaigns feature high quality shipping materials. For example:

+ Every package that is shipped uses high quality mailers

+ All comics are bag and boarded

If anything, at all, happens to delay shipping we alert our backers straight away. We post fortnightly updates until completion, regardless, so you will know what stage we are at every step of the way!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Damage Inc. Issue 4! 
Damage Inc. Issue 4-20+ pages of explosive Grey-tone supernatural glory!
At the end of the last issue a portal opened spilling an army of hungry vampires into our world, and due to a bet between two of the characters Damage inc. left the guns in their van. Now we get to see them try to resolve one of their toughest challenges, facing an army of fangs with only each other to rely on. Hell now they even have to team up with the same crazy Femme Fatals that they were there to hunt in order to survive!
So here is the deal. It is time to return to bounty hunting for fun and profit by joining the Club and funding Damage Inc. issue 4, a 30 page grey-tone occult explosion in a saddle stitched high gloss comic book. The series evolves as I bring in the style that Damage Inc. was made for. An eerie grey-tone I developed long ago for my work. As one critic mentioned the action bursts through this change:
"Damage inc. is a book for those who crave an original story that pumps harder than the wild fists of the mosh pit."  4.5 out of 5
                                                                                                                      Shaun Barbour
Here is what you get when you join the club and receive the Kickstarter-exclusive edition: 
The 20 page main story concluding the Shadow Damage arc.
PDF's of the first three issues, and Damage inc. Bible. 
For the first time in Damage Inc. history, I use my horror developed award winning Grey-tone style. 
The Kickstarter only, Cera Screams cover as seen above!
A special addition of the short story comic Intermission by me James Burton! It is a 3 page story revolving around Gauge and what constitutes his dangerous and dysfunctional dating life.
Illustrated Poetry from Kira Burton 
3 Bounties one for each of the Shadow Hunters. See what details sparked the hunt in the first place!
Each Kickstarter exclusive will be hand numbered and signed. Back early for lower number!
My son James and I at Metropolis Comics.
My name is James Burton!
I am an Award winning Artist/Writer who draws inspiration from a lifetime of Role Playing Games, being raised in the crazy life of my Biker father, and growing up in the craziest chaotic places. Some of that gave me a lot of things to love, a lot of  challenges to deal with, and the strength to survive level four cancer.
As a professional illustrator I have knocked out multiple storyboard projects for independent film, illustrated for The News and Review magazines, Penciled and inked two issues of Vampire of the Lost Highway, I have done multiple covers for Knights of the Dinner Table, covers for Psychosis and I am best known for my artwork on the award winning book Inheritance, that I co created to the tune of 106 beautiful labor intensive pages in four issues. I was also successful funding Damage Inc. Issue 3 on Kickstarter!
This time out I have handled everything in this story down to the lettering and the shading, but I did have some help. Noel Serrato and Terry Shoemaker made an action packed alt cover as did Ryan Krolbroth.
Ryan Krollboth and the bad ass alt cover he made!
Noel Serrato and Terry Shoemaker's all cover!
This is an additional 3 page story I have in this issue purely to make people laugh and explore how out there Gauge actually is. You gotta love the big guy despite the crazy.

Here are some creators who were down to ride along with Damage inc. and a few words they had to say: 


-Tyler is a mentor to a movement.
Uniqueness gets you noticed: Clay Adams, master of Fried comics
Ryan Krollboth-creator of Sunmaker, master of his own path.
Adam Atkinson


Why did I bring Damage Inc. back to Kickstarter?
This book was a fight in certain ways...
But I like a good fight.
Bringing this together was not easy. This past year has been filled with life's challenges. Moving, changing jobs, desperately working to be a good enough father and husband. 
Life...but it's done.
My reason though, my motivation for the time spent on these pages has not changed. Each page, each book still helps me build the life I am trying to create as a legacy for my children. They go to cons with me, and Camille loves being at the table. Recently she and a cousin even outsold me while I was doing Panels. The legacy for my children began the moment I became their father, and getting these into print shows them a bit more that life is what you build. 
It makes it even easier though depending on who your building with, and for...
Now this is Kickstarter. I believe in this platform. My last book was run through Kickstarter, and the experience  while challenging made more possible for me at a time when I needed to believe in myself. That is why I am back. That is why Damage Inc. has returned with me. There is still a lot of legacy to build.
As this action bursting occult mosh-pit of a comic is finished, the funds will be used to pay for the printing of new issues for all the backers as well as for sales in the immediate future and costs for the backing rewards.

The preview of Badassery:
Now let me show you some pages from the book. Always open on action...
Damage Inc. was created when I was a kid trying desperately to stay out of the world of trouble I was born into. In a haze of Comic books and role playing games I managed to form a surrogate family with boyhood friends that forever changed who I was, and provided me with the basis for Damage inc. 
We mixed a combination of RPG ideas and elements into our own world creating Damage inc. and the comic evolved from there. It sped up dramatically when one of us discovered that the guns in our game were far more powerful than most super powers. All hell broke loose and they started hunting super-villains like they were trophies. 
Gauge is often a fan favorite. He's sarcastic and a bit of a misogynist. Lets face it he's a jerk, but a jerk who is more than willing to take hits to keep his friends safe. 
The friend of mine he's based on says the character is like that because he's tanking, and the more people hate him the more they target him instead of the people he cares about. Personally I find it therapeutic watching other characters put him in his place or throwing him through walls. 
When Cuda joined the club he was the most reserved person I had ever met. Half Chinese and half German, huge glasses and as dorky as I was at the time. I knew him for three months before I heard him speak. 
However once he let it out things changed quickly.
He earned the nickname Overkill as his love for action exceeds the limits of what he's usually fighting, but in truth the character is based on the most honest and true person I have ever met. He is one of the few people in my life who has ever helped me find peace within myself. Not bad for a guy obsessed with Kung Fu and Grenades. 
 We are Damage inc.
When I was 14 I got into a huge fight after school with a kid who had been tormenting me for over a year. I planned on walking out there and killing him or at least breaking an arm, but something happened. I asked him to hit me and get it out of his system, and he did. He let loose and tried to rock my head off at the shoulders, but instead, I shrugged it off, and started talking to him.
That day I settled the issue with him and it ended, and I didn't have to throw a punch. In today's hindsight I am very proud but then I hated myself for it. I wasn't as strong as I knew my dad wanted me to be. I didn't kill him...
The next day my dad took me to a little shop in Marysville he bought me a vest that matched his, placed an angel on one side to remind me I was never alone. Then he explained to me...
"This vest is your armor it will protect you. When you wear it you can't be hurt, and you are unstoppable. It will warn off people and tell them you are not to be messed with. Respect it, take care of it, and it will keep you safe."
For years I barely wore it thinking I was unworthy. It was a symbol in my mind of my failure. Until my dad went down hard in a canyon not far from my house. In what I thought was his deathbed he was laying there barely able to speak. It was time to say good bye. I told him I was so sorry I was never tough enough for him, never the man he was. He started to choke up and said...
"Do you remember when I gave you your vest son? You were so upset about that fight."
"Because I failed you dad."
"You didn't fail me son. I was proud."  Gasp.... cough,
"It takes more courage to talk then it does to hurt some one. Me, your brother, we woulda fought. We woulda hurt him. But you... You changed that kid. You did the right thing. You are the brave one, not me... I'm a coward."
I would later find out after he had died that he was regularly beaten as a child by my step grandfather, a bad man who thought his belt and his fist was the only way to teach his step son. My dad's words took on such a greater meaning then.
That's why we wear that patch, and most have vests and jackets on. To us  it carries the legacy of PITBULL JIM, a reminder that courage comes in all forms, and so do the fights that it is needed for.
I still have my vest, and that angel. Now it has my Damage patches on it thanks to my sister Kira. I won't give my vest up till I leave this world, but I can make anyone worthy of riding along side of us one.

The Inks fo Noel Serrato on top of Terry Shoemakers lines. Original bad ass artwork.
First Milestone: REACHED! 
When we reach our first 20 hackers I will do a speed drawing of Original art and use it as a brand new Backer level!
Second Milestone: REACHED! 
Reaching 30 backers and we add 8 more PDFs to the pool!
Third Milestone: REACHED!!! 
Forty backers is what I am looking for. The it is time for another piece of original art!- Dropped the Ghost rider original art and then unlocked a bad ass pinup form Eli Beaird which will now be in the books!
Eli Beaird Pinup
 Fourth Milestone:  
It is time to reach 50 backers. When we do there will be another pinup this time form Jason Dube the man behind Scattered comics!
Jason Dube

The Break Down:
Production: I don't have costs since I did the work myself but I do have to pay for the patches and the loot for the rewards. 
Printing: I work with the baddest POD guy on the planet and he has to be paid.
Shipping: Don't get me started...
KS Fees: Gotta give up their cut.
Plan B: S@#$ happens.
Da Plan:
The Kickstarter Campaign: ~30 Days (August 1-August 30) 
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~Mid September
Book Goes to Printer/Digital rewards: ~Same Goddamn day Kickstarter sends the Mulaa. (Book is done remember?)
Book Printed and shipped to me  ~November 15ish
"Goddamn it Brain" buffer - 2 weeks
Pack and ship ~(November 14-November 31) 
Expected delivery to US ~ 2 Weeks (Early December) 
Expected delivery to International ~ 4 Weeks (late December) 

 Getting it done: THE PACKAGING 
I hate the post office. They once mangled 80 copies of Inheritance right before my first big con. So I am taking precautions.
Backers trust the creators on Kickstarter, and you deserve the best in return. That's why I am shipping with comic mailers to protect your investment. Know this though. If they botch it and you get a book that looks like a guinea pig was chewing on it, you'll be getting another right after you reach out to me.
Thank you!
Each time I get to print these books it changes my life and I will be grateful forever to the people who have helped make that happen. The backers other creators who show support, the mentors and teachers we find. All of them are the invaluable part of the legacy I am building that I never thought would exist.
So please back this project. Help me keep building Damage inc. and the legacy for my family.
Thank you.

updates.update_content:
I went to bed seriously worried, but suport came in even in the middle of the night. and I woke up to find a message on my phone form Kender....
JAMES THE KS SUCCEEDED!!! Congratulations.
I was ecstatic, however I had so much to do. Camille got a cold, and today was a special day. I had a commitment fill for her, for my family.  There was only a small window today and yesterday for me to operate in without affecting our main business and so off I went.
There has been a lot of illness for me as of late, but books are bagged and boarded. Should be in boxes and ready to ship shortly.

Oh my goodness. books tracking to be here tomorrow...
Being very open I got into a massive funk when the books were printed all jacked up. It got worse as the printer tried to straighten things out and things took longer and longer. A more intelligent person would have not let this beat them down, but I did. Mix this with some truly troubling things at home and I landed into a sea of dysfunction.

updates.update_userinfo: O.o Delays seem to be nearing their end.
updates.update_content:
The printer has sent me another update my friends. I am being told mid December my books arrive. Patience and perseverance continues to be in need. I swear my unboxing video may include an Irish jig of glee at this point when they arrive.

In other news a quick peak of some roughs of the next part of Damage Inc. This one by Jeff Aragon.

Hello my friends,
I am not super happy at the moment. In business things go down, and its the mark of a professional in how you over come them. Right now the printer delayed the shipping due to personnel challenges.  They should ship Monday.
The good part is they are still coming, the bad part is I am telling people who believe in Damage Inc. That there is a delay again. That part I am not thrilled by.

So a plan has been forged to get the quality I am looking for from my printer. The good part is that he found a solution to the issue, the bad part is the eta is November 8th. This should coordinate with the 3 inch patches well though.
The Bandannas are being worked through, I will have some examples to show everyone soon.
PLAY

Its been a glorious Birthday weekend for me, there was firefights in an abandoned warehouse filled with abandoned cars, airplane fuselage, old buildings, and friends who had my back while I shot gunned people into airsoft oblivion, There was also backers surveys. All of which have been sent out. So PROGRESS!!!
Oh and the final editing pass is complete, I have a hand full of grammar issues to attend to as well as one visual adjustment and then off to the printers my friends!!!!! I would also like to point out I got Kudos from the editor regarding my wording, both spaces and grammar/spelling were drastically improved from the last two books. I am proud of the efforts I put into that over the course of the most recent 2 books. Someone I respect pointed out several things, and basically threw a gauntlet down on me, so I have been making efforts to up my game. Part one of which was getting a real editor. Part 2 was listening to said editor and making the time to get it done.

updates.update_userinfo: Yesterday I started sending Backer surveys
updates.update_content:
So I started sending out Backer surveys, and getting the PDF organized for printing. Its with my editor Lon Beyer now. unfortunately I got decently sick this weekend form my daughter. It was just a cold but it has slowed me down. It is one of the things I have had to learn over time is that when I get sick I have to slow down. If not the punishment for pushing it is usually far worse than the slow down effect.
I am feeling better, back at work today. tonight I will keep pushing out the surveys, but as a reminder to everyone if your payment data is not up to date please get in there and check it out. Kickstarter doesn't warn you when that happens, until a creator gets affected and messages you themselves, or the kickstarter finishes and payment rolls due.

Fabled Four is the ground-breaking comic made entirely out of pixel art. Every single illustration in the series is made of tiny squares like a retro video game.
For fans of Final Fantasy, Chrono Trigger and Legend of Zelda: A Link to the Past the style will bring about a comforting dose of nostalgia married with dark comedy writing.
What is Fabled Four about? 
Ten years ago a group of friends were the top achieving students during the Adventure Exam. They were the talk of the town and seemingly destined for greatness. Fast forward to the present day and they are doing fuck all. Sam's wife has left him, David still lives with his parents and Jonah is wasting his extraordinary talents in magic.
Exclusive art print!
That's all about to change...

THE FABLED FOUR PRINT SET
Our level two stretch goals are going to deliver a dose of Fabled Four as you've never seen it before. We've got four special A3 art prints of concept art.

The Fabled Four team is made up of Luke Summerscales (ARTIST), Jonathan Carter (LETTERER), Archie Dait (EDITOR) and Jamie Me (WRITER).
We all live in the same area, West Yorkshire, and we are passionate gamers with a love of telling stories. That's how this project was born when we decided to take all of our unique skill sets and merge them to go on this pixel adventure!
We are truly grateful to anyone and everyone that is taking the time to check out our project. Thank you so much, and we hope you enjoy our comic book.

Risks and challenges
This will be our 11th Kickstarter. We learn from every single campaign, and then apply those lessons to the next one.

The artwork is 100% completed, and we will be sending the product to print soon after the end of crowdfunding.

The only risk we have is delays to shipping due to the courier which are outside of our control. In this extremely unlikely situation, one we've never encountered yet, we would keep our backers up to date every step of the way.

We send out updates every two weeks like clockwork until we ship the end product.

campaign.story:
WE DID IT! MAN OF SIN IS 100% FUNDED!!!
THANK YOU TO EVERYONE THAT'S BACKED THIS PROJECT!


Man of Sin 90-Page soft cover graphic novel
Man of Sin is a surreal thriller combining tragic human drama with blood thinning horror.  Man of Sin takes readers on an emotional journey that's sure to stick with them long after they've finished reading. 
Damien Nero's life spirals out of control as he searches for the truth surrounding his only son's death.  
Who will love Man of Sin?
Fans of The Exorcist, The Omen, The Conjuring, and other psychological horror.
Fans of gritty, adult graphic novels like Hellblazer and The Sandman.
Collectors of high-quality independent graphic novels who enjoy top-notch storytelling coupled with beautiful art.
 What do you get when you back Man of Sin?  
 Man of Sin soft cover graphic novel collects the complete Man of Sin series including the previously unreleased 3rd and 4th issues!
 90 full-color pages of beautiful sequential storytelling printed on high-quality paper. Perfect for any bookshelf or coffee table.
 All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content taking you behind the scenes into the making of Man of Sin.
Fans and Collectors this is for you!
At higher pledge levels, writer Andrew Guilde collaborated with some of his favorite artists to contribute campaign exclusive prints and a limited edition variant cover, 
To celebrate our fans and collectors, we've created exclusive rewards that are loaded with limited edition merchandise including exclusive prints, buttons, much more!
At highest levels, limited opportunities to be drawn into the world of Man of Sin! 
limited edition poly bag
Fan Box

Variant Cover
Variant cover by John Bivens (Image Spread and Dark Engine, Heavy Metal Magazine)
Exclusive Prints 


Exclusive Mr. Lived print by Walter Ostlie (Metal Shark, Bro. Shiver Bureau) 
 Exclusive print by artist Alex Riegel
 Critics, Pros, and Fans are blown away by Man of Sin. Here's what they're saying...  
"Ferociously jagged, Man of Sin's boldness is unflinching"--A Place to Hang Your Cape 
"Andrew Guilde and Camilo Ponce’s Man of Sin is a book that had me hooked before I even cracked its front cover"--Comic bastards 
"Andrew Guilde and Camilo Ponce deliver a book that will captivate, mesmerize and enthrall you!  This is the best thing you aren't reading so why not fix that? --Reading with a flight Ring  
"You're pulled so deep into Damien's life that you need to find out where he goes next."--Horror DNA 
"It is honestly one of the most stunning comics I have ever seen, Camilo Ponce's artwork being gorgeous in a way that makes me feel incredibly jealous, and Andrew Guilde knows exactly how to craft a tale that keeps a reader hooked"--Luke Cooper, Creator of Hollow Girl 
Need more? Check out the full reviews here: 
Comic Bastards
Reading with a flight ring
 Horror DNA 
 A Place to Hang Your Cape 
Writer Andrew Guilde with Oggie Boogie at C2E2!
Previous backer of Man of Sin issue 1!
Man of Sin as a featured library book
 Check out this amazing Unboxing video of Man of Sin #1  
 Who are the Creators Behind the Man of Sin? 
ANDREW WRITES: I've always loved creating.  Some of my earliest memories are of me locked away in my bedroom with my action figures and creating entire worlds to play in.  As an adult, I love the fact that I get to share these worlds, and these stories, with everyone.  Nothing brings a bigger smile to my face than someone telling me that they've enjoyed my work.  
CAMILO WRITES: Yes, I live in Chile. Yes, I am Latino, but I do not dance Salsa or Reggaeton  (well, maybe with a few extra drinks).  I live with my two daughters (both cats) and my girlfriend (another cat).  I love the arts in general as music, paintings and drawings are my main passions. I like to play drums, I do not do it very often, but when I do it is very intense (sometimes, it gets me in trouble).   With respect to my work, I like everything about the introspection and the emotinal processes, I think that darkness is not a wall that limits us, but rather, the darkness is like a riddle and when we decipher it, we can heal and keep growing, sometimes the dark hides true personal treasures. FOLLOW CAMILO ON INSTAGRAM TO WATCH HIM WORK ON MAN OF SIN  @SITHRALIS
WES WRITES: Wes Locher's lettering work has appeared in countless titles (I mean, I guess you COULD count them, but honestly, who has the time?) from Alterna Comics, ComixTribe, Titan Comics, Markosia Enterprises, and Arcana Studios, along with myriad self-published projects. 
Why this story?  Why Man of Sin?
Creator Andrew Guilde writes:
I remember holding my sobbing grandmother as they lowered my grandfather’s casket into his grave. I don’t remember much more from that day. 
A few months later, I was back at the cemetery, this time holding my own mother as her husband, my stepfather, had just passed. 
Within a year, I lost the two most important men in my life. 
As time went on, I watched as my family tirelessly navigated their deaths. Anger, tears, fear, self- doubt and blame all manifested for everyone. Tragedy, I learned, sows deep roots. 
It was here, watching my family struggle, that I felt I needed to tell a story. One part personal catharsis, one part meditation on the dangers we all must confront when we’re met face-to-face with tragedy. 
As I began to think on how I’d tackle this subject, I knew instantly that I was going to write a horror story. Not because horror allowed me to deal with death and dying, but rather, the horror genre allowed me to explore the depths of the human condition when faced with death and dying, which is often times much more terrifying than any creature of the night. 
Luckily for me, as this idea was swirling around in my head, I happened to be watching a documentary about the history of the anti-Christ. And like that, Man of Sin was born.
Want to learn more about creator Andrew Guilde and the Man of Sin project?  Check out the Jock and Nerd Podcast!
WHY KICKSTARTER?
Man of Sin has been a success due to the fans, and Kickstarter is the most recognized platform for fans and collectors to pre-order what they want directly from the creators.  
Kickstarter allows us to create cost effective, exclusive content that’s geared specifically for our fan base and allows us to get physical books into as many hands as possible.
Man of Sin is over 60% finished.  Creator Andrew Guilde has self-funded the project to near-completion, and now needs the help of the Kickstarter community to bring the Man of Sin soft-cover graphic novel to life. 
Kickstarter will allow us to:
Connect to fans directly 
Complete production on the final 35 pages of the graphic novel
Keep costs of production as low as possible
Print high quality, beautiful books 
Produce limited edition material 
What will the funds be used for?
The $4000 raised will go to:
Here's a glimpse of Man of Sin:
Want more? Click the image below to download the entire first issue FREE!





May-June: Campaign 
End of June: Kickstarter release funds
June-August: complete production on the remaining pages of Man of Sin. 
August: Send Man of Sin to the printer
September: Books arrive and packaged with rewards
October: Books shipped just in time to get the pants scared off you for Halloween!
HERE'S HOW WE'LL PROTECT IT IN TRANSIT! 
As Kickstarter fans and collector's ourselves, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. 
After consulting with our backers, we've revamped our shipping practices to ensure your comics and collectibles arrive in great condition. 
All comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We would be absolutely thrilled if you're ready to take the next step and join this campaign! 
On behalf of the entire Man of Sin team, thank you so much for your support!

campaign.story:
Welcome (back) to Morgan's Organs, a comedy comic book series like Pixar's Inside Out but for grown-ups. We're back to bring you the next installment in the 'sitcomic' adventures of Morgan and the crazy organauts living inside his body. Are you ready to see what might really be going on inside our insides?
In 2016, we introduced Kickstarter and the world to Book 1 of our quirky concept, and in 2017, we returned with Book 2. Thanks to the love and support of our incredible fans, we're able to return for Book 3 of Morgan's Organs. The great thing about this series is each story is standalone - you can read it in any order and still enjoy the heck out of it!
In Book 1 (click to preview), we witnessed Morgan's two "heads" of the body clash for control of Morgan's decision-making, all while Morgan battled the pressure to end a dry spell.
In Book 2 (click to preview), we cringed as Morgan dealt with the pains of swallowing something he shouldn't, and the consequences it would have for the organauts as it moved through his digestive system.
This time, we're bringing you a story riddled with alcohol, phallic artwork and a secret Morgan wish he never knew. And what I am most excited about is that we're using an unconventional narrative style for this book with a structure similar to that of Christopher Nolan's hit movie, Memento.
Take a look at the Book 3 preview pages below!
 Dick drawings, black eyes and amnesia, oh my!
Morgan's Organs is the brain spawn of me - Daniel Brodie. After a couple years of pursuing the idea as a television series, I realized that the best way to bring my idea to the world would be to make it happen myself. So I partnered with the incredibly talented artist, Robert Jennex, to create the world of Morgan's Organs. Rob brings an incredible vision and spark to the series, and none of this would be possible without my Canadian partner-in-crime.
We're also excited to continue to have Tyler Kelting from Oklahoma, USA, on our team as the series colourist. Tyler joined us for Book 2 to handle the full colours, and he has brought an incredible sense of discipline and creativity to build on the Morgan's Organs style.
(From left to right): Daniel, Rob, Tyler
This series focuses on Morgan as he navigates everyday college life, which is made difficult by the fact that he isn't completely "human". Inside his body lives a variety of organ-like characters (called organauts) who control his various body systems and ultimately, are keeping him alive. The problem is these organauts don't always operate with the best interests of their host in mind.   
The stories take place on two levels. Outside, we follow Morgan and his group of friends as they navigate college life. Zoom in to his insides and we see how Morgan's struggles are made worse by a group of organauts who bicker, lie, cheat, argue, act selfish, and generally, don't work together as one.
Stretch Goals Unlocked!

Click to learn more about this stretch goal
Click to learn more about this stretch goal
Make sure to read the below highlights about our rewards. 
Below is a summary of the various reward tiers. Most rewards tiers build on their previous tier.
All of the below tiers include physical rewards. Shipping is incremental to the dollar amount indicated.
I have always tried to be transparent about the budget for my Kickstarter's and what the funds will be used for. I don't see this as a business - not yet, at least. These campaigns are part of my long-term vision to have Morgan's Organs picked up by a publisher, and eventually made as a television series. All of my rewards are priced appropriately to cover exactly what I need to support this vision. That means covering artist salary, production (including printing), and packaging/shipping. 
I pay my artist team what I am able, but we have a mutual understanding this is a partnership and we're investing in a long-term vision. Between Book 1 and Book 2, I was able to increase my per-page-rate for the art team. I hope to be able to do so again for this campaign by exceeding our campaign goal.
Our Kickstarter goal of $4,000 CAD supports the below:
60% = artist salary
30% = the 4P's - printing / production / packaging / parceling (shipping)
10% = Kickstarter fees
Everything raised above this goal will go to a combination of:
Additional printing (further driving down per-unit-cost and creating opportunity to invest in our stretch goal rewards)
Increasing artist salary
Convention booths at future events
Future stories in the series!
Book 3 is already more than 75% complete - we only have about 10 pages left to ink and 20 pages to colour. Our goal is to deliver all campaign rewards by end-July/early-August.
Read some of the past coverage we've received on Book 1 and Book 2 of the series!
Starburst - Book 1: 8/10 stars - "Smutty, slapstick yet spectacularly striking in its approach and relatability, this is a battle of the heads that’s an absolute riot to watch unravel."
Starburst- Book 2: 8/10 stars - "Even more charming and funny than its predecessor... a hell of a fun ride."
Comic Crusaders -"Daniel lays out a wonderful story that I, no WE, need to read more of! The art is great, Robert brings to life the world of Morgan’s organs with a clean, animated style."
ComixBrew - "Morgan’s Organs is the kind of comic that is good to show your buddies for the laughs but also contains a deceptive amount of depth."
Comic Unknown - "If you ever wondered how Inside Out would have worked through the eyes of a male college student, look no more. Morgan's Organs is a gut-busting comedy that while the idea has been seen before, it is the fresh take we need and want."
Bleeding Cool - "Morgan’s Organs #2 hits a rhythm that the first issue only brushed up against. With this issue, each character has its place, and the situation is so ludicrous that it really lines up with the surreal premise of the comic."
The Outhousers - "The delightfully cartoonish art and exploration of maturity help [Morgan's Organs] defy expectations. It's a satisfying read for those that love thoughtful comedy."
If you've gotten this far, might as well read the rest of it! I'm honestly humbled that Morgan's Organs is even a thing in this world. I remember six years ago, I was embarrassed to even spill my idea to friends. Now, I am on my feet at Conventions, shouting at people walking by my booth to check out a comic that features a talking penis.
The reception to the series on Kickstarter, online, and at events has been incredible. I am not in this industry to make comics - I'm here to make Morgan's Organs! With each book, I get closer to my goal of getting picked up by a publisher so that I am able to make books more frequently, and who knows, maybe one day I can go back to my original dream of making this into a television series.
Only more books and more time will tell what the future of Morgan's Organs holds... oh, and your support for the series!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Risks, schmisks! We've done this twice before already and know exactly how to execute a Kickstarter campaign. In our previous two campaigns, we delivered within one to two months of the original promised date, with delays simply because we wouldn't sacrifice time for quality! This campaign, we have even more of Book 3 complete than ever before to ensure we can deliver that much sooner.

Short of Rob and Tyler getting enlisted to be the first humans to land on Mars, there is nothing stopping this project from happening. And even if they do end up on Mars, I'm sure there will be decent Wi-Fi connection for them to keep working between their less important, interstellar missions.

Hey Morganauts! It's been a crazy year, hasn't it? Though the quarantine does give inspiration for a future story... Anyways, let's get to it, I have four big updates to share. Let's start with the biggest!
#1: Morgan's Organs has been optioned for development as a television series!

Hey Morganauts! Here with a quick, exciting update (at least for me). We recently switched our website host to Shopify and I'm excited to launch the new website! Take a peek and let me know what you think!
https://morgansorgans.com/
Our books are available for purchase through the website - so if you're still looking for last minute holiday gifts, Morgan's Organs makes for a great stocking stuffer!

Hey Morganauts - just wanted to give a quick update on shipping.
95% of packages have shipped, and most of these have already delivered. The remaining packages are mainly local drop-offs. Thank you everyone for being patient through the shipping process.
I had previously mentioned to reach out if you have not received your package by October 1. Some packages (especially International backers) may arrive after this date, but feel free to reach out on October 1 if you haven't received your package yet and would like a status update.

That's right, Morganauts, Book 3 is finally in print! It's been a stressful past two days as I carefully combed every page with Tyler and Rob, looking for any typos, mistakes, and whatever other doubts came into my mind. It got to the point that I was Googling if I spelled the word "actually" correctly (luckily, I was).
What's Next

Hey Morganauts!
Just popping in for a (hopefully) brief update.
Surveys
About 99% of backers receiving print packages have completed their survey (thank you). There are 4 folks to complete their survey still, so if you are receiving a print package and have not completed a survey, please check your email (or contact me so I can re-send you the link).

Hello Morganauts on this fine Sunday! I'm excited to say that we achieved our first stretch goal, thanks to 169 of you! That means character stickers will be added for all backers receiving physical rewards! They are all cute and fun, and hopefully we'll have a couple more options for you to choose from when the campaign ends.
Now, we can set our sights on the second stretch goal, detailed below.

campaign.story:
START AGAIN is a critically acclaimed superhero boy meets girl comic. We are now returning to print, and bringing out the ALL-NEW issue two. Last year the first issue had 350+ backers, and since then has gained critical acclaim in the comic industry.
Our story follows British superhero "Jump" as he struggles to cope with his government appointed role as the nation's saviour. 
On a wild night out he meets Natalie Brown, and their chance encounter becomes the foundations of a scandal that will have far reaching consequences for the unlikely duo.
START AGAIN combines my love of super-powered stories and influences of my real-life struggles with OCD, intrusive thoughts and anxiety. I wanted to create a story that displayed difficulties dealing with mental health while also trying to work under pressure.
Many men like myself find it extremely hard to ask for help, to even admit we need help, and I wanted to explore this in a fictional setting.
The comic is created and written by Jamie Me. Art by Toni Doya (IDW's Back to the Future). Colours are by Sean Callahan (Action Lab's Stray). Editing by Archie Dait (Queen, START AGAIN, Ani Wild).

As the artwork is all 100% completed we don't have any risks in terms of delays producing the pages. All that is left to do is the lettering, and that's what I do for a living.

You can expect a high end product, shipped using quality packaging and for it to be on time. 

Regardless, we will keep you informed every step of the way. In the unlikely event of a delay you will be notified immediately. We message our backers every two weeks until we have shipped the finished product.

Thank you for any support.

campaign.story:
SWEET EUPHORIA is a 4 issue slice of life comedic drama miniseries. The purpose of this campaign is to fund the printing of the first issue. 
Everyone has flaws. Things we wish we could change or improve about ourselves. Sometimes these flaws cause major issues in our lives. SWEET EUPHORIA is four issue series about flawed people doing their best to work out their issues. This campaign is to fund the printing of the first issue. If you’re a fan of Edward Burns and Kevin Smith movies, you should check this out! 
A little background? Okay... 
This is my first real attempt at a comic book. I wrote the initial draft ages ago and ended up sitting on it for a while. It was influenced by the early movies of Kevin Smith and Edward Burns. 
After reading many indie comic (mainly the books of Terry Moore), I revisited, revised and completed the story. It developed it into something else. The first issue introduces the characters, and delves a little deeper into one of the main protagonists, Will, while setting up the second issue (currently being illustrated).
ABOUT THE BOOK
SWEET EUPHORIA is a black and white comic book, coming to a total of 28 pages (24 of story). The digital copies will be hi-res pdfs sent once the campaign has completed. 
The other books offered as rewards are as follows:
SHORTS - a collection of short stories that I created or collaborated with creators Lea J. Zimmit, Dan Amareiles, JR Loflin, Nikki Sherman and Justin Birch. 
POWER-UPS: VILIFIED & ONE COMIC TO RULE THEM ALL - short tales created by the #ComicBookHour community. I worked on two stories with Erik Bitmanis (creator of the HARD WYRED series).
NEWLY ADDED! 
There's a sketch reward where you can get a 5x7 sketch included with your pledge. Also, an exclusive print of Chris Cornell, who the title of the book was named after one of his songs (there's a thematic connection).
