REPLICATOR IS NOT a story for kids, it's violent, gory and has adult themes, people die often and horrifically.  If you are looking for a comic for your kids this is not it.
Replicator is a post apocalyptic sci-fi comic series set in England 10 years from now after a virus has killed tens of millions and as the country crumbles two companies fight for power using futuristic mechs and soldiers battle against super powered mutants...
This series has been created from someone who has been raised on Judge Dredd, Japanese anime and X-men cartoons and with Replicator we blend them all together in a violent and unforgiving and twisted way.
Not For Kids-Sorry :(
Check out the art quality in the following pages...
"All out war erupts after a virus kills tens of millions, one company is inspired by Ghost in the Shell and the other is a like an evil version of the X-men while the main character is basically the Punisher with super powers." Rob Arnold-writer/creator   
 REPLICATOR 1 AND 2 ARE A COMBINED 60 PAGES.-You will get both copies with this project. We currently have 4 different covers - five when this Kickstarter is successful.
 REPLICATOR #1 IS A GIGANTIC 32 PAGES. Printed on high quality paper.
 REPLICATOR #2 IS A MASSIVE 28 PAGES. Printed on high quality paper.
REPLICATOR 1 AND 2 HAVE BEEN PRINTED AND SHIPPED which means that when this project gets funded we will be able to send out your limited edition copy as soon as they are printed. In the case of digital and non limited edition print copies they can be sent straight away. 
The Mech version redrawn cover printed and in the flesh
People who enjoy post apocalyptic or science fiction genres.
People that love stories and battles involving futuristic technology and mechs, superpowers and the military.
Fans of movies, series or comics such as Ghost in the Shell, Punisher, Lazarus, Akira, X-men, Venom, Judge Dredd and the Terminator. 
People who like high quality Indie comics as REPLICATOR has some of the best talent the industry has seen and some it hasn't. 
Fans of action and violence, with mind blowing visuals. 
People that can't relate to mainstream superheroes and want better powers and more original story lines. 
If you like anything you have read above then THIS IS THE BOOK FOR YOU!
Mind Blowing Visuals!
Set in England over the course of the next ten years, a virus called the RED DEATH is released into the population resulting in a death toll in the tens of millions. 
The government invokes martial law but even then it's not enough with the military only able to protect a small portion of the population.
The government collapses and the country is shutdown, unable to function as it once did. Fearing a global outbreak the rest of world denies aid leaving the majority of England's citizens to fend for themselves.
A private military company called Blackgate builds a city - "Sanctuary" free from the disease separating the infected from the not, creating a paradise for those who are inside it's walls. While the people outside starve and die from disease.
When one scientist, Sarah Jones, is on the verge of a cure, a chance for the country to potentially return to its former glory, she disappears in unusual circumstances. 
The story centres around Ryker, the missing scientist's husband and shows the lengths he will go to in order to find his wife and the two companies who feel it's in their and the country's best interests for them to take control by any means necessary.
Who wants to see an all out war between the military, futuristic tech and super powered humans? With some of the best action and art available.
So...Will you help save humanity or help destroy it?
Black Gate engaging the Military...it's not going to end well for one of them.
"A Dystopic Nightmare and that’s why we love it"-Soda and Telepaths 
"There is at least one character that you want to hate and whether or not that will continue remains to be seen but he’s written so deliciously". -Reading with a Flight Ring
"Overall: 5/5, Art: 5/5, Story: 5/5"- Outright Geekery
"Grim in places as it needs to be and edge of your seat elsewhere, this first issue is the type of debut that shows the potential of both its creative team and the title itself and with it all ending on a cliffhanger it sets things up so that you are desperate to know when we’ll see more." - 9/10 Comics Anonymous
Like many great thrillers, this book lays down the tension on the small personal scale and on the large citywide level, and then cranks on it for good measure. Go check it out. -Fellowship of the Geek
My prediction is this series has the ability to be the next Saga in terms of success. Being sci-fi related has the chance to hold it back slightly but give it time to garner a cult following and give it the right marketing campaign and anything is possible. Let’s wait and see what happens next.-Rogues Portal






There are quite a few different reasons. Since we successfully funded issue 2 a lot has changed, Aaron Alfeche was originally just going to finish the second issue as we had the first few pages already completed by another artist, but as Aaron's style is so distinctive and amazing having pages from the previous artist wouldn't work for me.  So we redrew them and we also added more pages.
We hired a new colourist, by the name of DC Alonso whose own talent needs to be witnessed.
We hired the Legendary Marshall Dillon to do the letters, all of this was post Kickstarter and has taken the book to an entirely new level.
It took a fair chunk of time, from when we funded to when we shipped due to a multitude of reasons (I got hospital level sick, we changed colourist after a significant delay, we added more pages and added a new cover etc.)
I want to avoid delays as much as possible in the future, the only way to do that is to finish as much as possible before heading to Kickstarter, I don't want to make backers have to wait for their rewards in the future.
Any funding we raise here will go towards producing issue 3 and to do another print run as we are almost sold out, and probably the biggest reason is that I would love to attract more readers because whether you like the story or not (you will!) the level of artistic talent within these comics deserves to be seen.
I'm proud of what we achieved with REPLICATOR 1. With REPLICATOR 2 we have improved in every facet, producing something absolutely amazing.
We are specifically funding a limited edition cover for REPLICATOR 2 which you can see at the start of this Kickstarter.
Depression and mental health are important to me. I have depression and I have written a long post about it which you can find Here.  I wrote Replicator because I was unable to relate to a lot of the mainstream superheroes with their "do the right thing and everything will be ok" mantra.
I found as a teenager with depression that kind of thought process alienated me. It made me feel more isolated and that there must be something wrong with me because I would do the right thing and things still wouldn't be ok. Life isn't like that, and pretending it's all sunshine and rainbows is counterproductive.
I related more to the "evil" villains as they often had a compelling reason why they had to do what they had to do and a lot of them were mentally unstable. If I had known there were others like me then maybe I wouldn't have felt so alone.
I also got frustrated that one of the superheroes' biggest concerns was juggling their superhero life with their secret identity. People deal with much bigger issues.
With REPLICATOR there won't be heroes wondering if they are doing the right thing, there will be people doing what they feel they need to, it's up to you to decide if they are good or bad.
Our main character Ryker turns from a stable loving husband into something else... Someone we wish we couldn't relate to, the worst version of ourselves who embraces the darkness that we all have felt at some stage in our lives.
Like Mech's? I do!
By supporting Replicator you are employing people from Bosnia and Herzegovina, The Philippines, Scotland, England, America, Spain and Australia. 
Issue 1
Written by ROBERT ARNOLD There is a detailed description on me in the about section if you want to deep dive on me.  I am Australian, I lived in the UK for 3 years which I loved, I'm married and have a daughter named Phoenix.
Pencils and Inks by ARMIN OZDIC Armin  won The Nikola Mitrovi Kokan Award for the Best Young Balkans Comic Book Artist.  Armin hails from Bosnia and Herzegovina, he attended the secondary school of Applied Arts as well as attending Art Academy he currently works for French publishers Solei. 
Colours by ROSS A CAMPBELL Ross is an outstanding person in general not to mention a fantastic artist. Based out of Scotland  his list of clients include Image, Top Cow, Action Lab, Dynamite, Zenescope, Aspen and Udon.  Currently best known for his work on Stray, Pathfinder, Skullkickers and cover work for Wayward and is currently working for DC Comics!
Letters by JAMIE ME Jamie Me is a British comic letterer. His work includes titles like Wretches, After The Gold Rush and Espers. He is also a prolific comic creator in his own right having successfully Kickstarted multiple titles. 
Issue 2
Written by ROBERT ARNOLD Me again!
Pencils and Inks by AARON ALFECHE I first discovered Aaron on Facebook where I saw an outstanding Jack Kirby tribute piece that he did.  I initially thought this guy can't be real as he had no real history but was producing work of a quality similar or better than the big two. He is real and he is the real deal. This is Aaron's first full book which is absolutely insane..He is from the Philippines, it wont be long before he is picked up by one of the big companies.
Colours by DC ALONSO DC Alonso or David is a colourist hailing from Spain. David has had the opportunity to work for companies like Blizzard, Dark Horse, IDW, Lion Forge ...but where he has done the most work is with Indie comics. To date today he has coloured about fifty comics since starting 3 years ago. 
Letters by MARSHALL DILLON Marshall is a legend of the industry, I first learnt about him when Jim Zub of Wayward fame would not stop talking about him and how good he was, so I thought why not reach out and see if he was available. Marshall has worked on everything from GI Joe to Voltron and Street Fighter.
Zig Bingham is a top bloke, I was looking to improve the cover font and the title pages Zig offered to help and the improvement is dramatic.
Members Of The Team Have Worked On Comics From...
CHECK OUT SOME MORE OF THEIR WORK on REPLICATOR below.

campaign.story:
🔓 SEVEN STRETCH GOALS UNLOCKED SO FAR! Less than $1,000 away from unlocking another! 🔓
Wailing Blade is high-adrenaline fantasy adventure, set in the dark future of mankind. 
When his father is sentenced to death at the hands of the legendary Headtaker, bandit prince Tychon must find a way to save him, or fall to the Wailing Blade himself.
THANK YOU FOR FUNDING US ON DAY ONE! LET'S UNLOCK SOME STRETCH GOALS! 


Who will love Wailing Blade?
Fans of Conan, Elric, Masters of the Universe and other sword & sorcery epics.
People who like Mad Max, The Dying Earth, and other tales of dark futures.
Collectors of high quality modern independent comic books from a world-class team of up-and-comers and industry veterans!
If you like your comics with tons of action, over-the-top weaponry, and mind-blowing visuals, THIS IS YOUR BOOK!
What Exactly Do You Get When You Take the Blade and Back This Campaign?
 Wailing Blade #1 is a 32-page comic in standard American comic size, on printed on high-quality paper.
All physical product backers will get TWO premium standard edition FOIL STAMPED covers -- Wailing Blade #1A: NIGHT (SILVER FOIL) & Wailing Blade #1B: DAY (GOLD FOIL).
The extra sized first issue includes 30 sequential pages of action and mayhem, plus additional back matter taking you into the world of the Wailing Blade!
All backers will also receive loads of additional bonus content in the Tyrant's Cut Digital Deluxe PDF and the Wailing Blade Original Theme Heavy Metal Anthem MP3 by "Making Metal With" George O'Connor!  
At higher pledge levels, backers will access campaign exclusive bags and boxes loaded with limited edition variants, and killer merchandise including metallic mini-prints, enamel pins, custom toys, and more!
At highest levels, limited opportunities to get custom sketches, stories, signed materials, and the chance to be drawn into the world of the series as someone on the execution block!
The Comics Industry is Already Buzzing About Wailing Blade. Here's What Critics & Pros are Saying... 
CHECK OUT THE ADVANCED REVIEWS OF WAILING BLADE #1!
"Wailing Blade is the Executioner Sci-Fi Fantasy You Didn’t Know You Needed..." - Geek.com
"Loved it! 5 out of 5 stars..." - TheNewestRant.com
 "A Bloody, Brutal Blend Of Fantasy & Sci-Fi..." - Comicon.com
"Wailing Blade #1 has a swagger to it... a lot of fun and a strong start." - Omnicomic.com
 Who are the Creators Behind the Wailing Blade? 
Wailing Blade is an action-packed, blood-soaked dystopian fever dream created by Rich Douek (Gutter Magic) and Joe Mulvey (SCAM). 
Rich Douek
Rich is an award-winning copywriter, and the creator of the independent comic series, Gutter Magic. He has worked on the Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Universe comics for IDW, and has published short stories in the New York Times-featured All We Ever Wanted anthology, for A Wave Blue World, as well as anthologies for Comixtribe and Red Stylo press. Additonally, he is a moderator of the Comics Experience Creator's Workshop, where he strives to help newer creators learn how to create their own comics and navigate the industry.  
Joe Mulvey
Joe made his comics debut as the writer and illustrator of the electrifying super-powered Vegas heist series Scam, from Comixtribe. He is also the writer, artist and creator of the acclaimed children's book Mummy's Always Right, and was pubished in the Where We Live Anthology from Image Comics, to benefit the victims of the 2017 Las Vegas shooting. 
Christopher Sotomayor
Chris has been a mainstay at Marvel and DC Comics since 1996 working on titles like Captain America, Black Panther, Captain Marvel, Nightwing, Detective Comics, SuperGirl and pretty much everything else at one point or another.  In addition to working for every major comic publisher in the business, Chris also teaches a course on digital coloring for comics at http://www.comicsexperience.com.  Stay in school. Don't do drugs.
Taylor Esposito
Taylor is a comic book lettering professional and owner of Ghost Glyph Studios. As a staff letterer at DC, he lettered titles such as Red Hood and The Outlaws, Constantine, Bodies, CMYK, and New Suicide Squad. Prior to this, Taylor was credited on numerous titles for Marvel as a production artist. He is currently working on a new batch of creator-owned titles, such as Interceptor: Reactor and Friendo (Vault Comics), Exorsisters and Jook Joint (Image), and Babyteeth (Aftershock). Other publishers he has worked with include Line Webtoon (Acursian, Finality) Dynamite (Battlestar Galactica, Rainbow Brite, Army of Darkness/Bubba Ho-Tep), and IDW (Scarlett’s Strike Force).
Why Wailing Blade is a Story We Had to Tell....
Rich writes: 
For me, growing up, my favorite books were the ones that transported me to different lands. Wild adventures I could get lost in as I followed the heroes along on their journey. Middle Earth, Hyboria, The Young Kingdoms, The Dying Earth. To me, it's not escapism to want to dwell in worlds like that for a little while. The wonderful thing about fiction, especially genre fiction is that it gives you a taste of the impossible - a window into another world. And that feeling, that exhilarating feeling of cracking open a book and getting lost in it, even for a moment, is something that I've always wanted to create for someone else. And I believe that Wailing Blade is a book that will. 
It's often said that you should make the comics that you want to see in the world. In that respect, Wailing Blade is everything we've ever wanted to see in a comic. It's got action, it's got adventure. Compelling characters, and a lush, vibrant world for them to inhabit. We couldn't be happier to share it with you.
What Exactly Is This Kickstarter For?
The team has already invested thousands of dollars and hundreds of man-hours into the development of this first WAILING BLADE series. 
The first issue is 100% complete and ready to print.
Soon, our book will compete for attention on the shelves of comic shops world-wide. 
With your support here on Kickstarter, we can fund a larger initial print run for the book and expand the TAKE THE BLADE TOUR, bringing our new series to more comic conventions and in-store signings around the country. 
It will also help fund cool new Wailing Blade merchandise and Kickstarter-Exclusive collectibles for our biggest fans. A successful launch will also help make even more Wailing Blade stories than initial series possible. 
Funds raised above and beyond our modest goal will go into project stretch goal enhancements for our backers as well as be invested back into the series. 
 ComixTribe was launched with the help of Kickstarter fans and we know the only place some of our biggest fans can get our books is here on Kickstarter. So we’re back with another awesome campaign to help make more killer comics! 
Feast Your Eyes on These Pages Inside the Book...
 Want to See Even More Before You Take the Blade? 
If you'd like to read even more of Wailing Blade before you back this campaign, we invite you to download a generous 19 page preview. 
 ⚔️ CLICK HERE TO ACCESS ACCESS THE PREVIEW ⚔️  
What Awesome Rewards Are Available?
 Want a Closer Look at Those Killer Covers? 
NOTE: YOU CAN ADD the KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE Cover to ANY PHYSICAL PLEDGE LEVEL for +$25!
WAILING BLADE PROJECT TIMELINE
The Kickstarter Campaign: Jan 15 - Jan 31
Kickstarter Funds Received: Feb 14
Wailing Blade #1 to Print: Early February
Merchandise in Production: February
Book Manufacturing and Freight: (Late February) 
Extra Buffer Time for Unexpected Issues: (March)
Expected Deliver to US Backers: (Early April) 
Expected Deliver for INT Backers: (Late April)  
THIS BLADE IS SHARP, SO HERE'S HOW WE'LL PROTECT IT IN TRANSIT! 
As Kickstarter fans and collector's ourselves, we know there's nothing worse than backing a comic project and then having your rewards arrive damaged. 
After consulting with our backers, we've revamped our shipping practices to ensure your comics and collectibles arrive in great condition. 
All comics shipped will be individually bagged with boards, and will be secured in Gemini Comic Supply Comic Flash Mailers, which provides impact-resistant protection.
Orders with multiple comics will be sandwich packed and secured for additional protection.
And our Wailing Boxes will be BUBBLE WRAPPED before being inserted into a second shipping box, so that it arrives in great condition. 
Furthermore, for this campaign, we're handling fulfillment 100% in-house. In the past, we've worked with some external fulfillment companies who specialize in packing and shipping so that we can stay focused on creating the books. 
However, for this campaign, we want to make sure that everything arrives to our backers as quickly as possible and limit the possibility of unforeseen delays, which is why we are rolling up our sleeves and personally overseeing fulfillment for every backer.  
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out our project. We would be absolutely thrilled if you're ready to take the next step and join this campaign! 
Will YOU Be the Next to Take the Blade?
If you've made it this far, you may be ready to be the very next person to TAKE THE BLADE! 
If so, we'd like to ask you to scroll back up this page, choose an awesome reward, and pledge to be a part of this campaign today. 
On behalf of the entire Wailing Blade team, thank you so much for your support!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The support of backers on Kickstarter has been instrumental to the success of ComixTribe since our very first project back in 2012, so we take the trust of our backers very seriously.

We've taken a number of actions to mitigate risk associated with this campaign, including completing the creation of the book prior to launching and establishing a strong relationship with a quality printer who has done great work for us in the past and is established in North America, which means faster printing and delivery times for our backers than overseas off-set print.

Every Kickstarter campaign comes with risks, unforeseen hiccups, and lessons learned...and we've certainly learned valuable lessons from every past campaign. 

We're committed to delivering a superior reward delivery experience for our backers, so we're investing in the best protective shipping materials for comics and collectibles, and handling fulfillment 100% in-house, to eliminate the risk of delivery delays and to make sure your pledges arrive in great condition.

ComixTribe and the WAILING BLADE team have a long track record of delivering the goods, and the fact that we enjoy so much support from returning backers is testament to that.

So we invite you to back with confidence, as we want to be entertaining you for years to come.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
A great cataclysm has left the world concealed in snow and ice. To protect what was left of their culture, the Sunmakers sealed themselves away from the doomed world. Now their numbers have dwindled, and Tibhan, the last of the Sunmakers, must risk everything by returning to the desolate wastes to fuel the fire that preserves his people's essence.
Even if the cost is great and unthinkable.
This is the second chapter of a three issue mini-series. 
Sunmaker is for those who like their fantasy dark, with thematic undertones, and who want some color in their apocalypse!  
A fantasy story that takes place in a vivid apocalyptic world.
Strong theme of legacy and what happens when your values come into conflict with morality.
The struggle of understanding that for something to thrive, something else may have to be sacrificed.
22 pages of full-color sequentials plus 6 pages of extras which include a pinup gallery. That's a whole 28 pages total!
6.625 x 10.25 on 85b gloss paper with a 105lb gloss cover, just like issue #1!
Off-set printed for the highest quality.
A limited variant cover by John Edingfield II. 
Free digital issue #1 standard version with every pledge
And, you know, a glove that shoots fire...
Tibhan and his father are the last remaining Sunmakers. Their legacy, the great fire of the Second Sun, must be preserved by any means.
With the fire of the Second Sun nearly extinguished, Tibhan must leave the safety of the vault and find more energy to fuel it. During his travels of the frozen wastes he runs into opposition; a race of ice people known as Sunbloods.
Did I mention those Sunbloods are hostile? Very hostile? 
Lucky for Tibhan, his Combustion Glove makes him no pushover.
However, with their greater numbers, Tibhan is over-come... sweet flame thrower glove or not.
Tibhan awakes to find himself saved by Meirin, another Sunmaker!
To save her own people, Meirin agrees to travel along with Tibhan to the Sunbloods tower and retrieve the source of the Second Sun.
And just when it seemed like it was going to be easy... well, let's not spoil that.
How far will Tibhan go to preserve the legacy of his people? We find out in issue #2!
“When are you going to stop talking about making a comic and actually make a comic?!”
Not exactly the words you want to hear from your significant other, but for me they rang true and struck deep. They pushed me to take action.
And then? 
Not having the first clue about what exactly making a comic entailed, I stumbled upon a website called ComixTribe which, for the first time, broke down all the steps. Included on the ComixTribe website was a column called The Proving Grounds, a weekly public script edit by two professional comic editors.
This is where I found the script for Sunmaker. There was something that captivated me about the world and the characters. Especially the line "All things return to the cold!"
  After the first time I read the script I'd feed my cats and I'd be shouting "All things return to the cold!" at them (which was met with "just freakin' feed me already" stares). 
Damn cats.
I had to tell Liam how much I loved the script, which ended up kicking off Sunmaker  coming to life. My hope is to capture as much energy and excitement  that I felt the when I initially read the story and bring that to  each page. 
But the reason I reached out to Liam beyond all the other submissions to TPG is how he kept coming back to TPG. He submitted more than anyone else. His desire to grow and learn made him someone that I would love to work with.
  Because of that, I've grown as a storyteller.
I think Liam is a fantastic writer, and if this project means a book Liam has that he can give to people to see his skills and use it to get more work in the future, that would mean more to me than anything for this series.
Stories are meant to be shared.
 "I wanted to write Sunmaker to tell a story about tradition and the lengths people are willing to go to preserve it. 
Fantasy works best, in my view, when it examines a particular facet of the human condition (albeit through the lens of magical fires and ice-people) and there's something inside all of us that speaks to the need to preserve; it's a basic human instinct. 
In that way, we are all Sunmakers looking to keep our respective fires aflame. But as is the nature of reality, all things return to the cold, and clinging our dying legacies pulls us further from the warmth and the light. 
Letting go is then what keeps us human, and that's really what I wanted to convey with Sunmaker." 
"It feels like a video game when you're reading it."
          -Kat Calamia, Comic Frontline 
"Sunmaker has an art style that will melt your heart and a story that will freeze it back together!"
          -Chris Orndoff, Headmetal Press
" Sunmaker is a fantastical romp through a frozen hell of snow and ice monsters that only the bonds of friendship and family can keep at bay and ultimately overcome. All things return to the cold, but some things are greater than the cold." 
          -Will Allred, writer of Diary of Night
"A dying sun, a tormented warrior, and a glove that shoots fire! Sunmaker carries you into heated battles, tortured pasts and mournful music, before returning you longingly - where all things belong - to the cold..."
          -Andy Perry, writer of Undetermined
Indeed. And a giant one, at that.
Check out the first few pages of issue two that picks up where the battle left off!
The book is 100% complete! The only thing left to do is print, and that is why we are coming to Kickstarter.
We are looking to fund an offset print run of 1,500 books through KrakenPrint that Liam and I will split for product to sell at conventions and other channels.
 Most of the funds raised in the campaign will go towards printing costs.  Kickstarter and Stripe take a small fee off the top of the campaign,  with the rest of the money raised going to cover shipping.   
Oh, we're bringing the BOOM to a whole other level.
If this hasn't been enough and you still want to see more, then how does an 10 page full-color preview sound? 
By signing up to to my email list, you'll receive it right now, and I'll even throw in the full issue #1 if you're new to the series and want to be sure this is for you!
Show me more!
John Edingfield II, creator of Rancidville, contributed this AMAZING variant cover for Sunmaker #2! 
For you collectors out there, this is limited to 150 copies!
Oh, yea, did I mentioned it would be signed by John? How cool is that?!
If you want a print copy of Sunmaker Chapter #1 and it's not included in your pledge, don't worry!
All you have to do is click "Manage your Pledge", then "Change my pledge." Add $6 to any print level reward and you're set!
I love comics. The larger majority of books I get are from creators  themselves, so I appreciate when someone takes that little something extra to be sure that my package gets there in excellent shape.
Here is a look at the packaging mock-ups you can expect to receive your reward in.
For tiers that include the physical book, sketch-in, and aluminum prints this is what your shipment will look like. All comics are bagged and boarded, then packed inside a rigid cardboard envelope.
Original art mock-up packaging looks like this:
The comic is still protected inside of a bag with a board. Aluminum prints have their own bag to protect them from being scratched. The original art will be placed inside a rigid plastic protector, then inserted into a priority mail box to make the package even more rigid.  Finally, that box will be placed into a large bubble mailer to protect your reward even further.
But the real secret?
Ninjas.
That's right. Your own personal package protector. These guys will keep your shipment safe, as no one wants to mess with a ninja.
No one.
While I've done my best to attempt to select shipping materials that will best keep your product safe, I'm aware that things do happen.
If for any reason you receive a package at fulfillment with a book that doesn't meet your quality standards I will replace it at absolutely no cost to you.
I know there are collectors out there, and I want your book to make it to you in excellent condition.
If you've played video games, you know collectibles are a big part of the experience.
Since Sunmaker has huge influences from gaming, I thought it would be cool to take that part of the gaming world and bring it to this project. 
The only way Sunmaker is possible is because of your support, and I'm ever grateful for that.
And as a Kickstarter supporter, I feel that you should have something unique, only available through the campaign. 
Whenever you support the book through a physical tier (because of shipping) you will receive a Sunshard for that corresponding issue. These Sunshards can be collected together to form an image that will be used to attach to a future bookplate.
No one from a convention will get these pieces. 
No one from an online store.
Only the people who help make this project a reality.
Just a little something to make it extra cool and as a thank you.
This is not the final art, but it should give you an idea of what to expect!
The campaign will run throughout January and Febuary. Since KrakenPrint does all their offset printing overseas, there is approximately a two month wait for books to arrive. Books are expected about the middle of May, and will ship immediately upon arrival.
Backers should expect to receive their rewards by July.
A big, blue caption box can't express nearly how grateful I am for allowing me to share my project with you. Thank you for your time and attention.
I'd like to ask for your support in bringing Sunmaker to life. Please back this campaign today and join us for the fun we have in store for our backers!
With gratitude,
Ryan

updates.update_userinfo: Come and join us for my art book Kickstarter launch!
updates.update_content:
Hey, there!
Hope you are staying safe and healthy out there.
I wanted to reach out and give you an extra special thanks. Because of the support you've given Sunmaker I've been able to find more opportunities to work with other creators and share their worlds. There is no doubt that without you this book wouldn't exist.
Working with others has given me a chance to grow and experiment, push myself beyond what I could do.

Hey, there!
Have you have been enjoying your winter months? No sign of the snowpacalypse here in the Northeast (yet) and I'm not complaining. I like to keep my snow limited to the pages of Sunmaker if I can!
I wanted to let you know I have an art book launching on Kickstarter March 18!

Let’s start with the good news...
The Sunmaker #2 Kickstarter has been completely fulfilled!
All packages have been shipped out in August. If by chance you have NOT received your package, please feel free to contact me at any time and I'll make sure it's replaced.

How’s it going?!
As you have seen, either from your inbox or the title, surveys have been sent out! Woohoo! Just about everyone has already responded, and for that I’m ever grateful.

Let’s catch you up on where we’re at, shall we?

Hey, everyone!
Hope you had an enjoyable weekend. 
As promised, I wanted to roll out the next pinup gallery piece and do the last random backer bonus!
Let’s start with the pinup, shall we?!

updates.update_userinfo: First bonus pinup and last backer drawings
updates.update_content:
This has been an incredible weekend.
Why, you ask? Well, I’m sure you have a pretty good idea.
Because I am still blown away at the outpouring of support to bring Sunmaker to life. Grateful only touches on how moved I am.
If you tuned in for our Kickstarter Live, you know that every backer was monumental in our success. In the final days so many of you increased pledges to help us get closer, shared the campaign like crazy, and did everything you could to get us to the goal.

updates.update_userinfo: Unveiling the milestones... and a little something extra
updates.update_content:
You did it.
We funded!
I am blown away by everyone's support. Seriously.
Getting to the goal we did cross some milestones, which we will come back to because I'm getting ready for the Live session in half an hour (hope you make it!).

Hey, everyone!
Wow! We’re here at the last 24 hours! What a ride, huh?
Since yesterday we have crossed the 70% mark, passed our milestone of 75% (!), and are currently sitting just below 80%.
We got this.

campaign.story:
Rancidville: The Rotten Truth is the second act of a three-part story. Thanks to our amazing backers and fans, we were able to produce the first volume in 2017 through a successful Kickstarter and now the story continues in Book 2.
If you're returning to Rancidville, Thank you so much! None of this could have been done without you. If you're new to the story, Welcome! You've picked the perfect point to start your journey into the town of Rancidville.
This campaign is to raise funds to print the 52-page graphic novel Rancidville: The Rotten Truth. There is also a Kickstarter Exclusive Variant Cover by Ryan Kroboth.
A kid-centric mystery comic that is all-ages appropriate. 
A central theme of not judging people by their appearances.
48 pages of full-color sequential art.
6.625 x 10.25 Graphic Novel with a 12pt Matte Cover that has a Spot UV and 105lbs Matte interior pages - identical to Book 1.
Highest Quality Printing
A limited variant cover by Ryan Kroboth.
Fourteen year old Nathaniel Wicket had to move to a junkyard in a small unfamiliar Pennsylvanian town with his estranged Uncle.
He meets Shane Hines and Alice Martin, and the trio became quick friends.
Meanwhile, in the City Council, the acts of nefarious men go unchecked.
 And Nathaniel finds a clue to a deeper mystery.
So they rush off to question the Guardian of the city.
And get arrested.
But, after speaking with the Guardian...
Their fears are dismissed as the fantasies of children.
Which only fuels their desires to find the truth.
Rancidville is imaginative, funny, and is sure to engage the kid in all of us.
I enjoy reading fiction novels.
I like movies.
I really, really enjoy television.
But, I love comics, and I absolutely LOVE to draw.


Since I was eight years old, I have wanted to make comics. But I didn't have a clue where to start or what story to tell.
I was never really into the superhero genre of comics, I always gravitated to comics like Usagi Yojimbo, Cerebus, TMNT, Elfquest, and Bone. 
Independent, different, and with humor.

Off and on for over 20 years, I have worked on some aspect of the Rancidville story as it has become a passion and a labor of love.

In 2011, sometime after it started, I discovered a webcomic called reMind by Jason Brubaker, and that opened my thoughts up to webcomic publication.
Then, in 2014 I took an online course on how to get your comic project started. It focused on the organization of ideas surrounding comic creation.

All those things led to me getting my comic off the shelf of ideas and into the world of reality.

I am incredibly excited to bring the second chapter of Rancidville to you.  I hope you enjoy reading it as much as I have in creating it.
If you like mysteries you will love Rancidville.
There are over 50 Pages of Content
If you like mysteries solved by kids you will love Rancidville.
If you're a fan of Goonies or Scooby-Doo then guess what, you will love Rancidville
If you think the government is corrupt and wish someone could prove it (well I can't fix that) but you may still love Rancidville.
Book  2 is even better than Book 1! While the first book primarily set up the characters, Book 2 is where the action really gets going!
You will love Rancidville if you are looking for a fresh story that challenges the preconceived notions of appearances and how we judge others based on those things.
The Rotten Truth is both Chapters 3 and 4 of Rancdiville making up the second act of a three-part story.
The book is 100% Complete
A Digital Deluxe PDF is included with every book.
All the money raised will go toward printing the second book, backer rewards, Stripe/Kickstarter fees and shipping.  There is a small Miscellaneous amount set aside for contiengencies. If we're lucky enough to surpass our goal, any additional funding will go towards creating new rewards or be put directly back into the book, and production of the next volume. 
Free Shipping in the U.S.
Rancidville will be packed with care by experts who have years of shipping experience. No one enjoys getting a mangled comic as a reward from a Kickstarter Campaign.
From the individually wrapped book to the shipping carton, the same attention and love goes into each shipment as it did in creating the actual books. 
                          >>>Click here to get the Preview of Chapter 3<<< 
If you dig what you see, I hope you'll choose to join the campaign and select one of the rewards to help make Rancidville: The Rotten Truth a reality.
Ryan Kroboth, the artist of Sunmaker, whose credits include having published works by Fried Comics, Dren Productions, and Wannabe Press, contributed this AMAZING variant cover for Rancidville: The Rotten Truth! 
This is a limited print run for the Kickstarter only. Once the campaign is over, this will not be available anywhere else. As an added bonus Ryan is going to autograph each backers copy, how sweet is that!
I want you to back my project with confidence. If you're not 100% satisfied with your pledge, I'll do whatever it takes to resolve your issue. And, if that's not possible, simply return your reward and you'll be refunded your full pledge amount.
It means a lot to me that you have taken the time to read through my campaign. Thank you for your support and your willingness to consider being part of the adventure!
If you'd like to make Rancidville: The Rotten Truth a part of your library please select one of the great reward tiers and click the green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button. 
With gratitude,
John Edingfield II

As I put the finishing touches on the Final Chapter of Rancidville, Rancidville: An Odious End, I'd like to let you know about a new anthology of mine coming out at the end of the month on 31 May 2021.
Not So Fair Tales  is a 172 page hardcover fairy tale anthology collecting some of the best professional indie creators and new creators in comics. Many of these creators are seasoned veterans who have been on my wish list of collaborators for many years, and some are brand new to the field.

Greetings from the Land of Comics!
I love making comics, and I love sharing great projects, and when I can do both it is an incredible blessing.
With Rancidville: The Rotten Truth campaign being officially 100% done and complete you may be wondering, what's next?

Greetings from the land of comics!
All rewards have shipped and most have been delivered as of this morning.
If you have any issues, please let me know.
I gotta tell you all, this has been a joyous campaign to run and fulfill. The first Rancidville campaign was a huge learning curve, but with the help of Ryan Kroboth, we both gained a ton of knowledge (especially on the fulfillment side), and this campaign ran so smoothly. I am sure Ryan can attest the same for Sunmaker :)

Thank you so much for checking out the kickstarter campaign for the fifth issue of my series ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey!
This campaign has a bunch of great reward levels:
Original artwork!
You can be drawn in the book!
Get a variant cover by Ben Bishop!
Original commission drawings by Joseph Schmalke, Ian Chase Nichols, Bill Walko and Rich Woodall! 
THE WARHOOD 
The black sky, snow, death and burning cities of New Selenia are a constant war zone. New Selenia is ruled by the brutal warlord Selenic. Patrolled by H.A.R.M.S. (Hazardous Armored Robot Machine Scouts), overrun with monsters, mercenaries, and mutates. Era Nalyd doesn’t remember much of his past. Somehow he has been bonded with the most powerful weapon Selenic has ever created, The WarHood. Era is fighting through New Selenia and running from Selenic and his hired guns. He’s met Tachi, a mute ninja warrior woman, who has kept him alive this long. Era trusts Tachi with his life, but should he? 
ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey is the story of an unwilling and unlikely hero who is forced to use a futuristic weapon against its creator to save a dying planet. It’s an over the top chromium age 90’s action comic.
Starring a group of flawed refugees, hired killers, assassins, tyrants, zombies, and robots all fighting for survival on the planet of New Selenia.
Together they fight to reclaim the WarHood and survive on a hostile planet. This kickstarter campaign is YOUR opportunity to help ME bring this comic book to life!
 This is a Make 100 kickstarter project, so one of the pledge levels is limited to 100!
BEN BISHOP VARIANT COVER!

campaign.story:
OVERVIEW
North Bend is a limited comic series by Ryan Ellsworth, Pablo De Bonis, Paul Little, and Thomas Mauer. Our goal for this Kickstarter is to fund the creation and printing of issues 3 and 4, completing the first arc of the series. 
"Gritty, plausible, and highly entertaining." -- Comics Anonymous
"An intense crime story...the tip of a great, big, storytelling iceberg." -- Monkeys vs. Robots
"An ambitious first issue that exceeds on all accounts." -- Rogue's Portal
"Fantastic...trippy and uber plausible." -- Comic Crusaders
"Spectacular." -- RWAFR
THE STORY
The U.S. is at war--against Russia, and its own people. With the country on the verge of economic collapse and political revolution, the CIA recruits Seattle DEA Agent Brendan Kruge to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting citizens.
North Bend is inspired by the true events of project MKULTRA - a secret CIA program that took place during the cold war, where experimental drugs and mind control methods were tested on people without their knowledge. 
PREVIOUSLY IN NORTH BEND
After a workplace accident, Sam, a CIA chemist, wanders the streets in a drug-fueled haze, and is conned into giving away his savings. 
Issues #1-2 art by Robert Carey, Dee Cunniffe, and Ellie Wright
Brendan, a Seattle DEA agent, is visited by CIA Officers Braxton Church and Hal Holbrook, who want him to join a secret program to test a mind control drug on unknowing subjects.
Annie will do almost anything to get things back the way they were...before Sam's accident.
Brendan, Braxton, and Hal set up a safehouse in a quiet, suburban neighborhood.
NEXT IN NORTH BEND #3-4
Issue #3 cover by Pablo De Bonis
In the next issues, Brendan and his wife, Jamie, find themselves on opposite sides as they track down Sam's money. And Brendan begins his first MKULTRA experiments - with unforeseen consequences.
By the way, there will be violence, language, and sexual situations...so this is recommended for mature readers.
Here's a 6 page preview of issue #3. It comes in at 31 pages and issue 4 will be around there as well. So there's plenty more story and we're keeping some of the best stuff a secret!
TEAM 
Ryan Ellsworth - That's me! I'm the writer of North Bend. I also write Thought Experiment, an online crime/sci-fi comic anthology. @RyanEllsworth_
Pablo De Bonis - Pablo is from Rosario, Argentina, and began drawing at the age of 6. He is currently a student of the renowned comic book artist Marcelo Frusin. He has published in some editorials in Argentina, and drew the cover for Skies of Fire: Book 1. pablodebonisart
Paul Little - Paul is a colorist from southern Ontario, Canada. He's contributed to the New York Times bestselling Image Comics series Morning Glories, as well as licensed properties including Sons of Anarchy and Shrek. He lives for Americana and post-punk music, and he'd probably die if he had to go more than a month without seeing a live show. Behance
Thomas Mauer - Thomas has lent his lettering and design talent to numerous critically acclaimed and award-winning projects. Among his recent work are CRUDE, ELSEWHERE, HARDCORE, THE BEAUTY, and THE REALM, as well as DEAD KINGS, LARK'S KILLER, and the World Food Programme's LIVING LEVEL-3 educational comics. @thomasmauer
REWARDS
Previous issues/prints (all covers available as an 8x12" print - issue #4 cover to be revealed):  
Issue #1 cover art - standard by Robert Carey / variant by Tula Lotay
Issue #2 cover art - standard by Robert Carey / variant by Caspar Wijngaard
Original art
Tarot cards by Benjamin Mackey
Comics are bagged & boarded, and shipped in sturdy cardboard mailers. Prints are on nice semi-gloss paper, just like you'd hope it would be. Original art will be shipped separately in a poster tube. Rewards will be shipped all together when both issues are complete, because shipping is insanely expensive, especially international.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I've now successfully fulfilled two Kickstarters and am feeling pretty good about this one. We're about 70% done with production on issue #3, and writing on #4 is underway. I've already assumed most of the risk for creation of issue 3 since it's nearly complete. And you can be sure issue 4 will be getting made if this is funded! 

Delays in production/printing are probably the main risk, but chapter 3 has been moving along quite nicely. So I really think 5 months should be enough to have everything ready to go.

I can usually be relied on to answer any questions/make sure you guys are happy. After all, you guys are the reason we're doing this. We love you guys! We're really grateful for your support and appreciate ya!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hey guys! One final Kickstarter update for you all. From now on I'll be updating everyone through my email list, so if you want to keep hearing from me, be sure to subscribe!
North Bend is back, and in a less abstract way. We've signed with Scout Comics to publish North Bend and bring it to your local comic shops! This is really exciting for all of us, since we now have a solid path to finish this story that we're so passionate about.

 North Bend is a 10 issue limited series, and will be available on March 11, with a new issue coming out each month. It's available for preorder until January 18 (that's 4 days). So if you want to pick it up, it's highly suggested you order at your local comic shop.

 There's two covers available:

 Standard cover by Robert Carey - preorder with code JAN201959

Well guys, unfortunately we didn't make it. I apologize if I've let anyone down. Especially those of you following us since the beginning, I imagine it must be frustrating that this keeps happening. But still, thank you so much for your support and your comments. We love seeing your enthusiasm for North Bend.
This series is really important to us and we want to see it succeed...but it's time to take a step back and think about how possible that is. Since the beginning, we've had our share of ups and downs, with this being the third unsuccessful attempt at North Bend.

Hey folks!
Thanks to your support for North Bend, we're off to a great start - we're a third of the way there already, and we've got the Kickstarter stamp of approval! Sweet! I wish I had time to thank you all individually. This is a labor of love for us and something we're really passionate about making.
But we're not out of the woods yet, so please help us by getting the word out as much as possible so we can reach the finish line!

We proudly present a new kind of comic made entirely of pixels...
They will tell tales, sing songs and paint pictures of the FOUR who dared to risk it all... FOR MONEY & FAME!
Welcome to a magical world made completely out of pixels. In this world, adventure is more than just a hobby. It's a profession, and a lucrative one at that to those with the right skill set.
The Fabled Four are a group of thirty-something adventurers. They spend their time grinding low-risk areas, mostly earning minimum wage and just about making ends meet.
That all changes after Sam's living arrangements unexpectedly change...
The artwork is 100% completed, and we will go straight to print as soon as the campaign ends.
Back today and continue the adventure this December!

This A4 art poster is crafted using the pixel-art style, and features story content. Mage Monthly is a magazine in the Fabled Four universe!

Please note that some images are blurred and also censored with black bars below. Your rewards will be delivered uncensored.

campaign.story:
Tart 7 is fully-funded and working on stretch goals to make it the most beautiful edition of the comic as we can! 
Our favorite stretch goal - replacing the second regular edition of Tart 7 with a Kickstarter Exclusive Variant Cover for anyone pledging at the $21 tier or higher - is well within reach:
This is our most wanted stretch goal, because without our backers, we wouldn't have anything. So we want to have something for them that is only for them.
We've already achieved our first stretch goal to add a Gold Foil Embossment to the regular cover to make itas elegant as possible.
We're ecstatic to be back on Kickstarter to bring another installment of our fantasy comic Tart into existence. Tart is the story of a group of soldiers who risk their souls fighting to protect our world's history from being torn asunder.
Tart Acid and her friends have the courage to go anywhere in the world, or any time in history, to face down demonic threats...
... But are they brave enough to confront the demons of their own past?
Tart 7 digs deep into the hells that can make you a hero. And, it visits the literal Hell where the Biggest Bad of them all dwells.
The Toxic Fruit must fight off the nemesis behind the demon incursions, The King of Hell himself.
At his right hand; The First Lady of Lust. She is the matriarch of every disgusting thought you wish you could stop obsessing over: The Queen of Hell.
The very definition of Sexy as Hell
Half the fun of our series has been offering up questions to our readers. It's time to start giving some answers!
Though the funds from this campaign will be used to print issue 7, don't fear if you're new to our series. All seven chapters of our series (most easily described as a Supernatural Quantum Leap) are easily obtainable in either the $25 or $45 catch up tiers.
But you don't even have to wait until the campaign ends to dip your feet in our story. Back any catch up tier, and we'll send you a pdf of issues 1-3 as soon as we see your pledge.
 What We're Making Together:
A full color floppy comic printed on the highest quality paper available.

24 pages of story.

The transition from the introduction of our world, to our big story.

Perhaps the most exciting for the creative team: the return of series creator Ludovic Sallè.
THE TOXIC TEAM
WHAT PEOPLE ARE SAYING ABOUT TART?
We've been privileged to meet Ming Chen from AMC's Comic Book Men on the con circuit. Besides being as nice in real life as he is on the show, he's also generous with his time.
Ming agreed to read Tart Vol 1 and offered this review:
"Tart is fucking awesome!"
Since then, we've delivered each issue of Tart to him as they've come out. The result was Ming giving us one of the greatest reviews we've ever heard:

"If I could date a comic, I'd date Tart."
As amazing as it is to hear that from a guy whose entire business revolves around comics, it is just as incredible to hear from returning backers what they think. Here are just a few reviews of Tart 7 from backers we gave a sneak peek.

Tart would not exist if it were not for the incredible support of the Kickstarter Community in general, and our Kickstarter backers specifically.

The passion our backers show our book drives us to continue to make each issue of our series as strong as we possibly can. Returning to the original platform to deliver the next book is just natural. 


The funds we are raising in this campaign will be used to pay for printing of the comic, production of all rewards, and shipping to our backers. 
Anything above and beyond the initial reward will be used to make the best quality printed comic we can, and then recoup the the costs of the already completed art. If we go beyond that, extra funds will pay for the labor on Tart 8.
OUR REWARDS
We can not thank you enough for taking the time to consider our Kickstarter Campaign to bring Tart 7 into the world. We hope you find the perfect reward for you to... 
Kickstart My Tart!

Ani Wild is an all-ages comic about a young girl with the ability to transform into animals. Join in the fun as she discovers all kinds of ways to use her new power!
Dive into a magical world from the mind of Archie Dait, the critically acclaimed editor of START AGAIN and Queen, with breathtaking art by highly-rated children's book illustrator P.S. Brooks for their debut comic book.
This will be our eighth Kickstarter, and we've had seven successful ones before it. We pride ourselves on delivering a high standard.
We've got our ENTIRE comic library available for Ani Wild backers. You can read every book produced by Archie Dait and Jamie so far. We also have a hardback guest book by P.S. Brooks.
Hugs For Mummy is a heartwarming book about a mother dear and her child. It features illustration by P.S. Brooks and was written by Louise Coulthard.
Here is our entire collection of crowdfunded comics, and others that have featured in previous campaigns, which you can also get with your copy of Ani Wild. These titles are aimed at an adult audience, and are perfect for people aged 16 and above.
START AGAIN is a superhero boy meets girl story. It deals with themes such as anxiety, online harassment and finding new love.
Queen is a British political thriller about hactivism, and the consequences of corruption. It was once referred to as "like Game of Thrones, but in pant suits" in a 10/10 review by Comic Plug.
POWER-UPS is a comic anthology which tested creators with telling stories based on the writing prompt "I'm not who they think I am."
One Comic To Rule Them All is a collection of short stories inspired by the word "fantasy", and how creators interpreted it.
Here are the five tiers we have for the Ani Wild Kickstarter. All of the physical tiers include our ENTIRE digital content library. That's every comic produced by the Archie Dait and Jamie Me duo!
Archie Dait is a critically acclaimed editor on Queen and START AGAIN, and is now debuting her first comic book right here exclusively on Kickstarter. In her spare time she enjoys video games such as Overwatch, and playing with her two super-adorable nephews.
P.S. Brooks is a UK based illustrator with a BA in Fine Art who has worked with publishers in the UK, USA and Australia. He has had illustrations published in eleven children’s books. He is currently working on his seventh picture book and also writes, having had a young-adult novel published.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goals!
Hey, Hooligans! To be honest, I didn't expect to have to come up with stretch goals for this campaign. I'm flattered that you all got us to within striking distance of our funding goal on day 12! :D
So here are our current stretch goals:
$650 DONE! (Jun 7) - Rosie Riveter - all backers at $12 and up will receive this 2nd exclusive print
$700 DONE! (Jun 12) - Captain America Tribute - all backers at $12 and up will receive this 3rd exclusive print 
$750 - Seize the Memes of Production! - All backers at $4 Digital Dandies will receive 1 exclusive print of the Laugh It Forward cover.
I'm still not sure what else to offer for further stretch goals. There seems to have been some interest in magnets, stickers or buttons. If you have suggestions, let me know in the project updates! :D
Our Story!
Hi, I'm Sam and I'm on a mission to tell everyone why laughter is a moral imperative!
Also, I tell DICK JOKES FOR JUSTICE!
Seriously, that's my thing, comedy and activism. Some people call it laughtivism.
I've created cartoons and comedy on Woohooligan since 2006, and more recently satirical blogs and roast-like webcomic reviews on Tumblr. Today I'm creating Woohooligan Vol 2: Laugh It Forward, a new 64-page, full-color book of my comedy and laughtivist cartoons for you to enjoy! The funds from this campaign will print both the new volume as well as reprinting copies of my first book, Woohooligan vol 1: Into Dorkness.
If you'd told me a few years ago that I would be making "political comedy", I'd have told you you were crazy! Despite being a big fan of the Daily Show and many spin-offs, I didn't want to be known as a "political cartoonist".
Occasionally, something would stick in my craw until I had to make a cartoon about something like the mythical "death panels". After several years, I realized those cartoons I resisted making were often my most popular works.
It wasn't until after the election of President Spanky McBoneSpurs that I gave in and embraced social activism as part of my work. :P I still tell pop-culture and dick jokes, but I do it knowing that they're in service of a greater calling to make the world a better place.
"I love what you’re doing... like Swift meets a calm Bill Hicks, you use your comedy to expose the animal trappings of human nature. Ego, fear, ignorance, etc... You have a unique voice and perspective." - Eric Hailey
On just about any issue, the odds are you and I have some common ground, and I probably advocate for something you support, whether that's racial or gender equity, GLBT rights, common sense gun laws, or economic justice. And I love hearing from you and working with you on new laughtivist projects! :D
If you'd like to see more of my work before you back, get a copy of my first book with bonus comics when you subscribe to our newsletter here. If you decide it's not your thing, you can unsubscribe any time.
Why Kickstarter
To spread our message of hope and hilarity in a more practical sense, this Kickstarter will fund my second trade paperback, Woohooligan Vol. 2: Laugh It Forward!
Woohooligan Vol. 2, like the first volume, will be 64 full-color pages of mostly random comic strips -- some pop culture, some slice of life, some activist-oriented, like my strips on Black History Month or Trickle Down Economics.
The art is complete, previously published on our webcomic (or Patreon). All that remains is some pre-press cleanup and fulfillment. I'll finish the Kickstarter exclusive wallpaper and art prints in the first week after the campaign and expect 3-5 weeks to get the finished books back from the printer. So I expect to mail the books out to backers in late July.
I'm also getting a ton of advice from seasoned Kickstarter creators like Tyler James and Russell Nohelty to make sure I can handle the fulfillment challenges.
Rewards
In addition to the books themselves, I'm also offering some other great rewards for your pledge, from art cards and custom comedy ringtones, to caricatures and custom comedy videos, all the way up to a party at your house or the opportunity to rename the book!
Shipping is free for anyone in the US, or backing at $20 or under, or backing at $80 or more.
At the higher levels, you can get me for a day! For $799, I'll fly to your house and party with you and your friends! I'll perform standup, make caricatures, whatever you want, it's your day! Too much? For $299, you can be a character in the book (or just put whatever you want on a full-page spread), or for $119 get a custom comedy video!
But if you can't afford very much, there are also awesome rewards at the lower levels. At the $1.00 level, you get the Woohooligan vol 2 ebook (or substitute one of the other books), for the same price you would normally pay, plus you get your name in the credits and an an exclusive desktop wallpaper!
Also, as part of the digital dandies rewards at the $4.00 level, you get all four of my ebooks at their regular price, plus your name in the credits, the exclusive desktop wallpaper, and we've arranged a PDF ebook copy of Wes Locher's Unit 44! This is the first of a four-issue series about two Area 51 agents scrambling to recover the top-secret contents of a storage locker that was accidentally auctioned off to rednecks. Reminiscent of Men In Black, it's a hilarious ride! :D It's described as the X-Files as a sitcom!
New to Kickstarter?
It's easy! Just pick your rewards on the right and enter your payment information. You'll only be charged if we meet our goal, and after the campaign ends. If we fail to meet out funding target, no money will be collected, and we'll talk about how we want to move forward, whether that's with a second campaign or some other way. Hellbent Hellbent
Where's the Money Going?
Most of the campaign funds will go to printing and shipping. This campaign is a reboot of a much more ambitious campaign that included a third book that didn't attract much interest, so I've shelved it for a later campaign. I also removed from the goal funds I hoped to use to attend conventions this year, and to hire fulfillment help (I'll be shipping the books myself). If I have some extra for those things at the end, great, but they're no longer part of the fundraising goal.
Each book costs $182.50 for a minimal print run of 25 copies. So dropping one book brings our printing cost down to $365. The hand-signed prints will cost about $10-30 (it depends how many backers get them), and Kickstarter will take about $60, leaving $145 for shipping, miscalculations, or emergencies. (Shipping costs for the 42 backers from the previous campaign came out to ~$60.)
I'm confident the previous campaign gave me a clear understanding of what to expect, and I've fixed the many hilarious mistakes I made, like totally botching the campaign graphic. :P
I'm sure this campaign will fund and then we can talk about unlocking some cool stretch goals! :D
- Sam
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is the first time I've Kickstarted for a print volume that needs to be shipped, so I've done a lot of research on the fulfillment side of running a Kickstarter campaign and getting advice from people like Tyler James (Oxymoron, the Red Ten) and Russell Nohelty (Pixie Dust, Monsters and Other Scary Shit), so I think I have the bases covered. 

Some of the other non-book rewards for this Kickstarter may require a little creative thinking -- the party at your house for example. I'm convinced that with a little effort and my willingness to fly in the luggage compartment, we can work out the rough spots. ;)

I'm also aware that there are sometimes declined cards and disputed charges on Kickstarter. In the unlikely worst-case scenario that the final amount is less than needed for printing and shipping, I'm sure we can figure out a way to cover the difference. I'll discuss options with backers obviously if it becomes an issue.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Unlocked at: 300 backers.
The original digital copy of START AGAIN #1 featuring a different cover, lettering and graphical style. See where it all began, and compare it with the new edition!
The full issue will include a front cover and interior design to the same standard as START AGAIN #1, and it will also be given a unique title.
Unlocked at: £3,300 (UNLOCKED).
NEW stories will be unlocked at: £1100 (UNLOCKED), £1700 (UNLOCKED), £2300 (UNLOCKED) and £2900 (UNLOCKED).
These stories feature the perspectives of characters that live in the area where START AGAIN is set, and the impact that a superhero existing has on their lives.
Each story is six-pages long, and will have a unique protagonist(s) in each comic.
The EXPANDED UNIVERSE is graphic in every sense of the word, and is not suitable for people below the age of 18.
Additional funds after our stretch goals will be used to pay higher page rates to the remastering team.
START AGAIN is a superhero boy meets girls story that tackles themes such as mental health, the cost of fame, and online harassment in the modern social media driven world.
What was remastered, and why?
The first issue is COMPLETELY sold out, so we decided instead of just a basic reprint we'd make some adjustments.
What we did:
We’ve remastered every single page to feature new and improved lettering. This and future issues will now have a professionally designed graphics identity. Including new logo design and interiors. We redesigned everything so that the project can be the highest quality possible, and to match the standards of mainstream comics.
START AGAIN #1 Remastered is fully completed digitally, and is ready to print if we make our goal. All other rewards are also ready. We will start printing immediately, and we will ship as soon as the issues arrive.
Jamie Me is the British creator, writer, letterer and designer for START AGAIN #1 Remastered. He's also the creator of Queen, the award-winning IRL and hosted #ComicBookHour on Twitter for three years. Now he's a full time comic creator and letterist with a love of anime and manga.
Toni Doya is the Spanish artist on this project, and recently inked IDW's BACK TO THE FUTURE. A lover of all things Marvel, Toni spend many years drawing alternate endings to stories he enjoyed reading featuring iconic characters. Now he pursues his lifelong dream of drawing for the company!
Sean Callahan is the American colourist on our team. His colours can be found on the shelves of comic stores worldwide via Action Lab's STRAY. He's also won awards for his colouring on Reddit.
Archie Dait is the British editor of our latest work. Her attention to detail, and relentless dedication to making sure the script is as authentic as possible, is the reason the project has rated so highly. She's also an avid Overwatch player.

campaign.story:
Saga of the Kittens #1
From the deck of The Retribution, comes a brand new breathtaking 36 page adventure comic for all ages. Set over 5 issues with twists and turns worthy of any Hollywood blockbuster, the Saga of the Kittens follows the Pirate Kittens Zed, Jay and Tee.
Will the kittens succeed in their attempt to prove they are worthy to call themselves Pirate Cats? Or will the evil Barracuda thwart their efforts and scupper the ship?
The Pirate Cats is based on my love of cats and pirates, it is the end of the beginning of a dream I've had for many years. However, more importantly, I'm not writing this comic for myself. It is being written for my family, friends and everyone who may lack a bit of confidence in their own ability or who are told they can't do what they love.
It is my aim through this comic, to show everyone that it's okay to be afraid of doing something new, of giving it a go. It's okay to be scared of making big decisions, being scared shows you how important it is to you.
And it's okay to fail. 
You just have to get back up and try again. And those feelings of pain are perfectly natural. All you need to do is when you try again, use those feelings to remind yourself of how important this is to you. Use those feelings to try harder with more passion and more heart and eventually, you will succeed.
And that's what The Pirate Cats - Saga of the Kittens is all about.
Captain Horatio 'The Mouse' Hunter - Captain of The Retribution, one of the fastest ships in the world. Captain Horatio is steadfast and cautious as a Captain preferring to look after his crew rather than risk their lives.
MacTavish - Horatio's right hand cat. MacTavish is the rock Horatio leans on when things get tough. Whilst being hard on the crew, MacTavish see's them as his family. Often the first to the bar and the last to leave, MacTavish likes nothing better than having a drink and a large plate of fish n chips.
Tee, Zed and Jay - The Tegan Sisters. AKA the Kittens. Growing up on the island of Ellyn in the town of Shaywynn, the Tegan sisters grew up around ships and boats of all shapes and sizes. As soon as they could walk the Kittens took to the sea determined to prove that they could not only talk the talk, but walk the walk and become famous pirates themselves.
Barracuda - An evil pirate who takes pride in stealing and causing pain and suffering. His crew is full of the worst scum and villany this side of the Mos Eisley Cantina.
Comic is 100% complete
Ready to go to print with comic
Rewards designed and templated
Issue 2  already written
 The Lounge Kittens with their stickers and a copy of the 10 page preview.
Horatio 'The Mouse' Hunter “I'm delighted this story is finally being published. People will see how great I really am!”
Barracuda “I can't believe this #fakenews is being made into a story. When I get my book deal you'll learn the real truth.”
MacTavish “You know I actually do a lot more for Captain Hunter that you think. I'm very important.”
Jay “This is AWESOME!!! I knew that I'd be famous one day. Do you want my autograph?”
Tee “This is so cool. I'm excited to see how this artist guy draws me. He best get my fur right.”
Zed “Yeah, it's cool and everything, but are we getting paid for this?”

To further reduce the risks I have my collaborator/artist/friend to refer to, Andrew has run 12 crowdfunding campaigns and has never failed to fulfill the very best quality items on any of his campaigns.

campaign.story:
"Gritty, plausible, and highly entertaining." -- Comics Anonymous
"An ambitious first issue that exceeds on all accounts." -- Rogue's Portal
"Fantastic...trippy and uber plausible." -- Comic Crusaders
"Spectacular." -- RWAFR
OVERVIEW
In the not too distant future, a Seattle DEA agent and veteran of the War in Russia joins a secret CIA program - where an experimental mind control drug is tested on unwitting Americans.
This Kickstarter is to fund the completion of issue #2 of the ten issue sci-fi / crime saga.
THE STORY
The U.S. is at war -- against Russia, and the American people. The country is on the verge of economic collapse and political revolution. Desperate to regain control, the CIA recruits Seattle DEA Agent Brendan Kruge to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting Americans.
Compelled by his sense of duty to his country, Brendan struggles to keep his life from falling apart as he tries to reconcile his personal beliefs with the security of the nation.
The story is loosely inspired by the true events of MKULTRA - a secret CIA project that took place during the cold war, where experimental drugs (like LSD) and mind control methods were tested on people without their knowledge.
Variant cover by Caspar Wijngaard
PREVIOUSLY IN NORTH BEND 
In chapter one, Brendan Kruge, an undercover Seattle DEA agent, questions Andrew Park, a drug dealer, about an experimental drug stolen from a research lab.
Sam and Annie, chemists contracted by the CIA to synthesize drugs from exotic plants, run tests on their latest sample. During one test, Sam accidentally slices his hand open, causing the drug to spill into his bloodstream.
The U.S. is under siege by the Crusaders, a revolutionary communist party, who are steadily gaining popularity with the public.
Sam wanders the streets in a drug-fueled haze, and crosses paths with Fred, who sees an opportunity to take advantage of Sam's impaired state.
Brendan is visited by CIA Officers Church and Holbrook, who want him to join a secret program to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting citizens.
Covers for #1 by Robert Carey and Tula Lotay
COMING UP NEXT IN NORTH BEND #2  
Here you can check out a six page preview for North Bend #2. This is just a small look at what's to come in this chapter, which comes in at 32 pages.
          CHARACTERS  
Here's a few of the characters we've met so far. There are plenty more to meet -- cops, criminals, victims, and everything in between.
REWARDS
For our rewards, everything will be shipped in sturdy mailers to minimize damage as much as possible. Comics will be bagged and boarded. Prints will be printed on glossy, quality cardstock.
  A4 art prints
  Tarot cards by Benjamin Mackey
THE TEAM
Ryan Ellsworth (writer), Robert Carey (illustrator), Ellie Wright (colorist), and Thomas Mauer (letterer)
Ryan Ellsworth - That's me! I'm the writer of North Bend. I also write Thought Experiment, an online crime/sci-fi comic anthology. @RyanEllsworth_
Robert Carey - Rob is an illustrator from Dublin, Ireland. He's known for The Phantom: Scarlet Sapphire, Power Rangers: Aftershock, Super Crooks, and storyboards Transformers.  @Mansloth
Ellie Wright - Ellie is a freelance comic colorist, also from Ireland. She has recently done work on The Shadow/Batman from Dynamite Comics and won the ICN award for best colorist published in Ireland. @elliewrightm
Thomas Mauer - Thomas has lent his lettering and design talent to numerous critically acclaimed and award-winning projects. Among his recent work are COPPERHEAD, CRUDE, ELSEWHERE, THE BEAUTY, and THE REALM, as well as 4 KIDS WALK INTO A BANK, and the World Food Programme's LIVING LEVEL-3 educational comics. @thomasmauer
MONEY  
We are looking to raise $2,000, which will all go to finishing the book - coloring, lettering, print costs, and shipping. I personally won't be getting any of the money. 
If this campaign really starts slammin', we'll bust out some stretch goals.

campaign.story:
Prospects is a new sci-fi comic from writer Max Majernik and artist Jean Franco. The Kickstarter is for a print run of #2 (and #1!) of the mini-series. The comic is a perfect balance of 50's sci-fi, 80's action, and everyday life.
The first Kickstarter for Prospects #issue 1 was a Kickstarter staff pick and funded in just 100 hours.
Story:  
The town of Ridgeville has been stuck in the middle of a 150-year-old battle between two mad scientists, and former colleagues, Edwin Grabowski and Victor Farsimov. Both claim to have figured out the secret of immortality and created armies of zombies and cyborgs using their respective methods. The scientists have waged a war for so long within the town that the townspeople now consider it an honor to be abducted by one of the mad scientists in their quest for glory. Anyone who shows any bit of potential, be it brains, brawn, or anything in between, will be captured by one of the scientists by the time they are 25 years old. 
On the outside looking in is 30-year old Colin Bates, who isn’t one of the prospects. He has been selected by no one, not by scientists, girls, or even friends. He spends most of his days watching TV in his basement where he avoids doing odd jobs for his Grandma and her friends. Everything changes when a notorious terrorist, intent on destroying both scientists, appears in Colin’s basement begging Colin to take over his legacy. 
On the inside looking out is 18-year old Andrew Russell. Andrew has it all, the brains, brawn, and looks to be whatever he wants: the ultimate 5 tool prospect. The problem is that the whole community wants him to be a soldier for one of the scientists, while he just wants a normal 18-year-old life. He has to deal with the pressure of the town, especially his mom, about every aspect of his day AND the thought that he can be abducted by one of the scientists at any moment.
Accolades
Preview
            Meet the Team
Max Majernik (Writer) @SnowballMax I currently reside in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. I have a passion for writing and took classes such as dramatic and theater writing in college in hopes of getting a dramatic writing degree. Over the past few years, I have written reviews, articles, and interviews for various comic blogs. The blog I have dedicated most of my time to is comicosity.com, where I had the pleasure of reviewing a wide range of comics and interviewing many industry regulars. This past year, I felt compelled to go back to my creative writing background and to focus my free time on writing an original idea. As my first venture into the world of comic writing, I put together a small miniseries that I hope people who love comics, or people who enjoy a fun story, can enjoy. Thank you for the opportunity and for taking time out of your day to read what I have begun to put together!
Jean Franco (Pencils, inks, colors, lettering...aka the whole art department) Jean is an Argentinian comic artist and a graphic designer. He started drawing as a kid inspired by the work of John Kricfalusi and Genndy Tartakovsky,among others. He works as a teacher of both professions and his recent work projects include “Monty the Dinosaur” by Action Lab Comics, as a letterer in the spanish edition of “27” by Image Comics, and “Prospects", of course. He's always working on personal projects, mostly humor comics. Jean loves beer, pizza, animated movies, and all kind of comics.

Hard Wyred (W: Erik Bitmanis A: Ross Zucco) Welcome to the world of Hard Wyred, where everything moves at a speed of light pace. Yet, for those finding themselves living in the past, it’s a tough place to be.  
Sam Wyerznowski seeks to redeem himself in the eyes of his long-time crush, but the costs for this shot at redemption could be his undoing.
