campaign.story:
STRETCH GOAL
We are going to use the stretch goal to attempt to go debt-free on the project. To make the goal achievable we had to take on £600 ourselves. Anything after our funding goal will go towards paying off that debt.
Thank you again for supporting the project, and we can't wait until everyone gets to read Queen #1 and #2.
We have THREE digital guest comics that are creator-owned to unlock. Once we hit the percentages above they will be made available! (BACKERS-ONLY)
60% UNLOCK:
Replicator Issue #1 available to all backers now (click here).
An action thriller that intertwines enhanced humans and cutting edge technology set in a plague ravaged England.
80% UNLOCK:  
Hard Wyred Issue #1 available to all backers now (click here).
A virus attack hits in an online world as one man seeks to redeem himself in this sci-fi adventure.
100% UNLOCK:  
R:ILPERSONA Episode One available to all backers now (click here).
In a post apocalyptic future, a young assassin with extraordinary abilities awakens with amnesia, finding himself in the middle of a global conflict.
Why am I creating Queen?
"In 2013 I began therapy for an anxiety disorder called Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. One of my coping mechanisms was to come up with stories about confronting some of the things I was afraid of like corruption, inequality and the consequences of actions.
Could these be your next comics?
After gaining confidence, making steps towards stability in my life, I began to want to develop what I had daydreamed about for so long. I taught myself how to letter comics, and saved up money from gigs to pay Bernard Gita and Sean Callahan to work on a script I'd written. This comic is the result of my journey from struggling to leave my home, washing my hands up to 25 times a day, to attempting to live out a life long goal of creating stories."

- Jamie Me
With your backing we can continue making Queen. Every back will help give us momentum towards reaching our goal!
What is the comic about?
Emily Green is a struggling politician. She is the second-in-command of the British government, but her personal life is falling apart, she doesn't believe in the political system anymore and she is preparing to quietly step down from her position after the upcoming General Election.
Hactivist group 'Nidus', known for releasing leaked documents to the general public, have greater plans for the Deputy Prime Minister.
What the comic critics are saying about Queen.
Jump into the Queen universe that Graphic Policy's Brett Schenker, who works in politics, describes as "about as authentic as you can get."
Why do we need Kickstarter?
We successfully crowdfunded issue one of Queen, and we sent out physical copies to our backers. What we have returned to Kickstarter for is to raise funds to finish colouring issue two, and to send the first two parts to print.
Bernard Gita's art will look even better in rich colours by Sean Callahan!
Your back will:

Pay comic artists.

Allow us to print both comics, the rewards and ship them to you.
Help us continue making Queen. We can't do it without YOU!
Issue #1 Preview:
            Want to continue reading? All backers get a digital copy of issue #1 straight-away. Just back, and check the backers-only update here.
Issue #2 Artwork & Cover Designs
  START AGAIN Preview:
START AGAIN is a superhero boy meets girl story that deals with themes such as anxiety, online bullying and the price of fame status.
    Please note that the artwork is censored only on Kickstarter. The comic, physical and digital, will not feature any sort of censorship when delivered. You view an uncensored preview here.
The Team
      The Art Prints:
The first art print is called "PROTEST" and is by IDW's inker on Back to the Future, Toni Doya. It also features colours by Sean Callahan.
The second print is the "CHESS BOARD" limited edition by Bernard Gita and Sean Callahan. This special is hand lettered and signed by the creator in the "COLLECTORS" bundle.
Bundles:
Digital copies of Queen #1 Extended, Queen #2, START AGAIN #1, "IRL: YEAR ONE", START AGAIN “STRIPPED”, Queen DEV Diary, START AGAIN "UNMASKED" and a six-page preview of the START AGAIN #2 inks.
ALL OUR DIGITAL COMICS ARE DRM-FREE PDF'S.
Physical copies of Queen #1 Extended, Queen #2, START AGAIN #1 and EVERYTHING in The Jamie Me Digital Deluxe Bundle.
Physical copies of Queen #1 Extended, Queen #2, START AGAIN #1. A Queen "PROTEST" poster, four IRL postcards, a Queen postcard and bookmark, and EVERYTHING in The Jamie Me Digital Deluxe Bundle.
Everything in The Jamie Me Print Bundle, but signed by the creator. Also features the limited edition hand numbered Queen "CHESS BOARD" art print. Also features everything from The Jamie Me Digital Deluxe Bundle.
Unique Art Pieces Featuring... YOU!
          NOTE: You will be drawn in replacing the full body of the character highlighted with a dot. We will require a photograph to draw your likeness for all custom drawing tiers.
Kickstarter Cost Breakdown
Above is a breakdown of the costs for this Kickstarter campaign. Thank you so much for checking out our campaign, and any and all support you, the Kickstarter community, give us is much appreciated.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
One of the risks that any comic Kickstarter has is delays in production. We have taken major steps to avoid this by completing the drawing phase (pencils and inks) before crowdfunding begins. We now only have to complete the colouring stage, and Sean Callahan is already in the process of completing this step.

I have also ran five successful Kickstarters now, and I will use my experiences to make this campaign as smooth as possible. I have a local comic shop, Inter-Comics, helping with the shipping phase, and all of the goods go out bagged, boarded and in durable packing you would expect from a top-end online retailer. I take shipping seriously, and getting your goods to you in mint condition is something I pride myself on.

You can also ASK ME ANYTHING about the campaign by messaging me on here. I will get back to you ASAP.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
YOU DID IT!!! Thank you so much. Time to start stretching.
Stretch Goals
The Book
Death Sin Book
Tormented by demons and visions of torture, Connor fights to stay sane and learn why he was cursed.
Death Sin Collection Volume 1 is an American manga story for fans of horror, manga, and the fantastic.
Currently available for viewing on the PDP website. They have begun releasing scenes from the book every other Monday.
PDP Digital Link
  Death Sin is also one of the few manga currently be translated into Japanese for publishing over in Japan. 
Death Sin Pages
Death Sin Collection Volume 1 is a 176-page black and white printed manga book. 
Printed on thick 85# uncoated paper. 
With a 14-pt thick color/laminated cover. 
A beautiful quality book you would be proud to have on your shelf.
 We are lucky to have Kraken Printing as our printer for this book! They have a history of delivering great Kickstarter products.
Kraken Printing
  Work on this book has already been completed. The only thing we have left is to get it printed and into your hands. In fact, we have not been sitting around either. Work on the next volume has already started and will be appearing on the PDP website by the end of the year. So while the story doesn't end with this book. There is more to come.
Why Kickstarter?
We have come to Kickstarter to get funds to print a new edition of Death Sin. It is a belief of both Fallen Manga Studio and Phoenix Dreams Publishing that manga can come from anywhere and Death Sin, is an excellent example of that. Fallen Manga Studios partnered with PDP because we believe in the vision they have for the future of creator controlled comics, allowing them speed and the ability to make a living from their work.
The funds for this project are to be used for the print run and backer rewards.
   What's in for you? We don't expect you to do this just out of the goodness of your heart. So we are preparing rewards for those who back us.
Rewards List
Thank you ALL for take the time to look over this Kickstarter. If you would do us just one more favor. Please, find a reward you feel comfortable selecting and help us make these dreams a reality. Please, become one of our Backers and let your friends know what we are doing.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The only true challenge this project has is making sure it comes back from the printer and since we are going with Kraken Printing we trust that isn't going to be an issue. The book is completed and ready to be sent out as soon as the funds become available.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
I have some stock of the book that I want to mail out to whoever wants one. Can you email me your current address? 
Send mailing address here:
jordan@fallenmangastudios.com

Hello everyone, this is Jordan. Noel has vanished, I have no idea where he is or what happened to the money you all donated. I am taking it upon myself to print the books on my own using my own money and will be mailing them out early 2019 to everyone who donated 25 or more. The book will be volume 1 and 2 of Death Sin. I will sign each copy as a thank you and apology for this happening. I am truly sorry that I trusted the wrong person in making my dream of printing my comic and selling it and turned it into a nightmare. I feel terrible that he stole all of this money and my good name.

updates.update_userinfo: Where we are and what is going on.
updates.update_content:
Evening All.
I am sorry things are taking as long as they are. I am posting here to let you know that is entirely on me that the books aren't shipping as they should have. Jordan has been nothing but supportive and concerned that you all get the books, well months ago. This year has been very difficult for me and every time I think things are going to clear, something new and worse seems to be dumped in my lap. This is in large part because I can't say "No" when I really should or the Universe just being out to get me. It has been so bad that I have been run down every week for months. I know you all deserve more than you received and I wish things were different.

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
In previous projects we took on the dispatching ourselves. This time around, we plan to outsource this to a company who will efficiently handle, process and ship all the books for us. We began working with them in our last project, and they've provided an excellent service.

The files are at the printers, way ahead of time, and the printer's finger is poised, ready to smash the 'Start' button on the conveyor belt and get these rolling off the presses as soon as the campaign finishes. As a result, delays are very unlikely, unless the printers are attacked by sea-bandits. Unfortunately, as the printers are based in Cornwall, pirate attacks remain an inescapable possibility.

Each country's postage has been calculated ahead of time to avoid any hiccups there. To the very pound, this is the cost to ship to our lovely but rather heavy book to each individual country. We've also decided only to ship to countries that we know handle the parcels well. We want this to arrive in the best possible condition. If we do not ship to certain countries, it is because we have faced difficulties with those destinations in the past. Well, not quite. I mean, we've never shipped to Antarctica, the reason why countries such as Antarctica, Andorra etc are missing is because we suspect we might not be able to deliver to these areas.

This is our third project now, so we consider ourselves pretty experienced with this stuff. After projects end, we take it upon ourselves to make sure that if any outstanding problems are resolved. You can always contact us for support. You are in good hands.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
The world of MERAKI is a futuristic realm infused with Greek Mythology.
Follow Psi's dark journey as our epic 12-issue adventure begins! Get your hands on MERAKI #1!  
**A high-quality, full-color, limited-edition comic book**
The lands of Balen have turned dry, suffering from an extreme drought.
Desperate for water Psi and her team are forced to travel to Jupinar.
When the village Elder refuses to help and marauders attack, will Psi order her team to fight or let the village burn?
        Created by mighty Gods, Balen teems with sea-creatures, dragons, and genetic-hybrids. Echoes of the Gods’ own characteristics infuse the races of this land. The goddess Athena introduced genetically enhanced humans into this realm nearly two centuries ago. These second generation humans had to learn their place in this world or were soon parted from it.
  The story follows our lesbian hero, Psi, as she travels through the barren lands of Balen desperate to reach the capital. 
Born into the land of Wrathic Warriors, Psi ascended swiftly through the savage ranks. Her path forged in blood, she now commands the deadliest military team on Balen.
                                                                                                                       Do you want a MERAKI keychain? Or a glow-in-the-dark MERAKI patch? What about a copy of MERAKI: Descent to the Underworld? Well, you're in luck! 
Please follow the directions below to claim your Add-On:  
1. Click the “manage your pledge” button on the project's page.  
2. Increase your pledge by the amount needed to claim the add-on(s).  
3. Save your pledge. 
**Do not change the tier that you originally pledged at.**  
At the end of the campaign, we will send you a survey so you can let us know which Add-On you selected.
      I created MERAKI because we need more gay heroes! It is important to represent the LGBT+ community in fiction. My characters are gay, but that is only one part of them. Each and every single one of them has positive and negative traits that make them human. They are loyal, selfish, forgiving, and vengeful. It is my hope that the theme and characters resonate with all! After all, a good story is a good story! 
Today, more than ever, I think it is important for all people to come together and find strength in unity. If you believe the same, please take a moment and write Strength in Unity in the comment section of this Kickstarter! As a bonus, if you add the comment above along with a pledge of $7 or more, you'll be entered to win a limited variant comic from MERAKI: Descent to the Underworld!
     Minh Hằng creating the Variant cover for MERAKI #1
Minh Hằng creating MERAKI #1 page 12
       A former Molecular Biologist turned comic book writer, letterer, web developer, graphic designer, and video editor. I’ve worn many hats to create this book! 
Three years ago I had an opportunity to follow my dream of writing a comic, and so I began creating MERAKI. I grew up reading comic books in the late 90's, but there was always a little disconnect. They lacked characters that represented me. No one was gay. When I created MERAKI, it was important to have a diverse world with intelligent, brave and cunning female characters. I have learned a lot over the last three years about storytelling, and now I am excited to take the next step of funding my book! I hope you will join me on this journey and help bring MERAKI to life!
  I studied fine art under celebrated Vietnamese artist Nguyên Đình. In 2008 I graduated from Ho Chi Minh City’s University of Architecture with a degree in Industrial Art. I quit my fashion design career to become a digital artist. This work has led me to MERAKI, and I'm really happy with my choice!
  The greatest cost of creating MERAKI is the high quality artwork. I've already paid for six pages, concept artwork, shipping materials (labels, stay-flat shippers, boards & bags). As you can see, even with my out of pocket contribution, it's expensive to produce this comic and that's why I need your help!

As Seen On
  Big Nick #2 Cover Art by Martin Deschatelets
Following the success of Expired Comics' Big Nick #1, it looks like Canada wants more Big Nick! Putting our lives on hold for a few months, we put together a sequel for the ages! Get ready to laugh, cry and be moved by this literary and artistic slugfest! (Emotional outbursts not guaranteed)   
Big Nick #1 & #2
Catch up and Synopsis 
After the events of emergence day, when a gigantic robotic moose burst from the depths of the earth, Big Nick has been busy keeping Canada safe. Issue #2 starts off with the Sudbury based hero receiving an honorary monument to commemorate his heroic deeds. Little does he know, things are about to hit the fan in epic proportions. Join Big Nick as he faces off against his biggest foe yet, the colossal Bedrock Titan! Where did he come from? Why is he so darn mad? How can Big Nick possibly defeat a living mountain? Find out in issue #2!
Sample pages of issue #2 (WIP)
  Can Big Nick defeat the Bedrock Titan?
About Big Nick  
Nick Murray, a mine rescue worker, disappeared during a mine cave in. Thirty years later, he emerged without having aged a single day, and with amazing new powers. Thus far Nick has discovered that he can manipulate the ground and minerals as well as grow to enormous proportions. Big Nick uses Sudbury Ontario's iconic landmark, The Big Nickel, as his weapon of choice!
Pages from Big Nick issue #1
Thank you to the Big Nick community!
As a thank you to our community, we've included pages of fan art in Big Nick #2. Make sure to let us know what you think of these great drawings and keep creating!
Big Nick Fan Art pages will include artworks by Illustrator Paul Limgenco, famed zombie artist Rob Sacchetto and many more!
Rewards
Please support us in bringing this comic book to life! Your pledges will go a long way in helping us with the printing and distribution costs. Have a look at our list of exciting rewards. Any and all pledges are greatly appreciated.

campaign.story:
INK ISLAND is an adventurous all ages one shot comic about a lighthouse that keeps away the monsters in the dark. This Kickstarter campaign is also creating a complete teaching guide to be used with the comic, which provides a range of lessons and ideas suitable for use in the class or at home, as created by the writer who is also a teacher.
This full colour 22 page one-shot comic from the Australian partnership of artist Craig Bruyn and writer Ryan K Lindsay tells the story of Parker and Elliot [Ryan’s children] who live in a lighthouse and have the duty of keeping the disgusting monsters in the dark away.
When an attack during a blown globe results in Elliot being kidnapped, Parker must conquer his trepidation and travel out with his fearless stuffed frog companion, Williams, to mount a rescue mission to Ink Island.
The book is a personal study in how we overcome our worries, and how siblings rely on each other. It examines perceived gender roles, the power of inner strength, and the beauty of teamwork and partnership. It is also wildly imaginative and stupidly funny, so is sure to engage the children we know, and the ones we hide we still are.
Craig Bryun’s art in the comic is a phenomenal blend of the absurd and the amazing. Whether it’s delivering an emotional beat through a child’s face, or defining the pert yet hairy glutes of a dirty Inky monster, Craig can do it all with style, as he also colours all his own work here.
Craig has spent years working on his own awesome creator owned comic, FROM ABOVE, and more recently he’s shot to Instagram fame through his brilliant and infectiously fun pin ups and illustrations delivered daily to his 15k+ followers.
The creative team is ably rounded out by Ryan Ferrier who letters the comic with character and storytelling prowess which brings the whole package together.
As for me, I'm Ryan K Lindsay - I've previously run a great Kickstarter campaign for an all ages one shot titled EIR and co-created with Alfie Gallagher, as well as 3 massively successful campaigns for my DEER EDITOR series with Sami Kivelä. 
I've also written NEGATIVE SPACE @ Dark Horse [with Owen Gieni on art], BEAUTIFUL CANVAS @ Black Mask in June this year [with Sami Kivelä and Triona Farrell on art/colours], HEADSPACE @ IDW/Monkeybrain [with Eric Zawadzki on art, joined by Sebastian Piriz, Marissa Lousie, and Dee Cunniffe on art/colours], CHUM @ ComixTribe [with Sami Kivelä and Mark Dale on art/colours], and I am an alumni from the DC Writers Workshop [under the instruction of Scott Snyder].
I am also a multi-award nominated teacher in the elementary system, with 14 years experience instructing young students, and teaching comics, which brings us to our next very important aspect of this campaign.
LET’S MAKE A COMIC TEACHING GUIDE! 
cover image not final
Teaching comics is amazing. Kids love it, the teacher loves it, and the ability for educational growth through engagement of a rich text which is something new, and actual fun, is a glorious opportunity to behold. As such, I try my best to teach through comics whenever the opportunity arises.
It made sense that if I was writing an all ages comic, I’d probably want to teach it in class. If I was teaching it, I’d probably plan for it. So the idea of sharing a planning resources for teachers to use felt like the right idea. Underpinned by educational understanding of curriculum, engagement, and fun, this ~35 page PDF resource of 15 unique and in-depth lessons can be manipulated to fit most upper primary/elementary classes, and can also be used within by eager parents [like myself] who love to interrogate and discuss literature with their kids in the home.
I went for a PDF for this resource because then it’s instantly printable, it can be shown to classes via smart tvs/interactive whiteboards so it'll pop large in the front of the room, and it can be easily shared between colleagues [because teachers share, and rightfully so]. I'm happy for the resource to be handed around teaching teams, taken to new schools and districts.
I've also assembled an All Ages Script PDF for the scripts that are child friendly so they can be shared in the classroom as examples of what goes on behind the page.
1ST 48 HOUR BACKER REWARDS
Every backer in the first 48 hours will receive an extra free comic as I will send you a free PDF of FIND, a fantastic one-shot comic from Alex Cormack and Sam Read!
ALL DONE NOW, AND SENT OUT TO THOSE TO WHOM THIS APPLIES.
PLEDGE LEVELS
Okay, here’s what to get, and what it’ll set you back! Remembering that everything is in Australian dollars.
$1 INK ISLAND PDF - the INK ISLAND story all wrapped up and ready to roll on your computer,/tablet/device.
$9 INK ISLAND DELUXE PDF + LESSON GUIDE PDF + RKL All Ages Script PDF - the mammoth INK ISLAND file, this has the story, the script, back matter, sketches, process material, everything, AND also a great Lesson Guide pdf resource to enable teaching/discussion in the home and classroom. AND a script PDF of the all ages books I've written [INK ISLAND, EIR, CAPTAIN HUMAN THE ROBOT]
Also serves as a perfect tax write off for those buying resources for the classroom :]
$15 INK ISLAND PRINT COPY, PIN UP PRINT, and all digital files - get your hands on a rare print copy of the comic, as well as a gorgeous A4 pin up print from Craig Bruyn, and all the above digital files - with shipping included anywhere in the world!
$20 INK ISLAND AUDIO COMMENTARY, and PRINT COPY, PIN UP PRINT, and all digital files - crank up some knowledge as Ryan discusses the comic in detail in a read-a-long audio commentary that’s good for the commute to work as much as it is good for the kids in your class - plus, get your hands on a pretty rare print copy of the comic, as well as a gorgeous pin up print from Craig Bruyn, and all the above digital files - with shipping included anywhere in the world!
$60 TYPE PLATE EDITION - 1 of 3 Annotated Ink Island Scripts by Ryan K Lindsay - covered in writing thoughts, coffee stains, process asides, red wine circles, and mindless tv-watching doodles - also comes with all print and digital rewards above.
$130 - KID V INKY ARTWORK - Bespoke black&white pin up of your kid/s fighting an Inky monster by Craig Bruyn - A4 artwork posted to you, as well as all above print and digital rewards from $20 on down - limited to 6
$150 - OPEN PIN UP ARTWORK - Bespoke black&white pin up of any character of your choosing, rendered in Craig Bruyn’s chibi style - A4 artwork posted to you, as well as all above print and digital rewards from $20 on down - limited to 6
$250 - BESPOKE CHIBI VARIANT COVER - Craig Bruyn will design a chibi variant cover, fully inked traditionally and digitally coloured, with the original art posted to you, and final file emailed to you for use in your own comic project - as well as all above print and digital rewards from $20 on down - limited to 1
STRETCH GOALS
$3500 Stretch Goal
Unlock a pdf download of the WHIZ BANG AND AMELIA THE ADVENTURE BEAR in THE JADE DRAGON - for everyone
$4000 Stretch Goal
6 Word Lighthouse Stories - all backers will have the chance to write a 6 word story based around the prompt of the 'lighthouse'
Unlock The Extra Script PDF Vaults - I'll give downloads to the scripts for the WHIZ BANG comic, as well as the breakout success, CAPTAIN ULTIMATE. That's a lot of script pages, and will be available only to those pledging $9 and above
$4500 Stretch Goal
Unlock a pdf download of GOLDEN AGE, a fantastic one shot by Cecilia Latella and Giulie Speziani and Robert Harrington - available to all backers
$5000 Stretch Goal
Unlock a pdf download of EIR, the one shot I Kickstarted last year with Alfie Gallagher - available to all backers at $9 and above
The only way we're going to hit these goals, and get more into your hands, is by sharing the link, talking it up, send it to your kids' teachers, talk about it over a family dinner. Share the love.
MY FIRST TIME OFFERING PRINT COMICS
All of my previous Kickstarter campaigns have been for digital-only rewards and this is the first time I'm offering a print copy of the book.
The reason I didn't do it before is because postage from my convict rock down here is prohibitive to making a profit, or delivering a price that's fair. And I don't like overcharging my readers - you should pay what I would be willing to pay.
This is why in order to make the entire package more worthwhile for posting, we are including an A4 pin up print that Craig Bruyn has put together just for this campaign.
Pin Up Art with every comic bought
We'll be using Kraken Print to print and fulfil our book, and we're glad to have them on board.
In the end, the biggest question i always get is if the book will be available in print. This time, I'm offering it for those people who've been wanting it for so long and deserve a chance for me to offer it. Enjoy. 
PAGE SAMPLES
Page 1
  Page 2
  Page 3
  Page 4
  Page 5
MEET THE CREATORS
Craig Bruyn - Artistic Demigod
Craig likes to draw little pictures inside squares and rectangles and have words in balloons come out of them. He first cut his teeth seriously in comics with seven issues of his own series From Above (that he did both the art for, and more worrisomely the words) and then scored a break working on Skylanders for IDW. He is currently working on several new projects. He lives with his dog Oreo and exhibits questionable social skills.
Ryan K Lindsay - Lowly Writer
Ryan is an Australian writer who has written the EIR all ages one-shot he Kickstarted with Alfie Gallagher, the critically acclaimed NEGATIVE SPACE miniseries at Dark Horse with Owen Gieni on art, the upcoming BEAUTIFUL CANVAS from Black Mask with Sami Kivelä, the CHUM mini with Sami Kiveä, and he also made HEADSPACE at Monkeybrain Comics/IDW with Eric Zawadzki + Sebastian Piriz/Marissa Louise/Dee Cunniffe on art. He wrote a short story for the Vertigo CMYK anthology and was blessed to see Tommy Lee Edwards illustrate it, his FATHERHOOD one-shot was once one of the top selling ComiXology Submit titles, and he once sold out to write a MY LITTLE PONY RAINBOW DASH one-shot.

campaign.story:
Cover for SPACE CASE #1
Hi, we're Drew and Hazen. We just finished creating an original comic book, SPACE CASE! 
It's a 36-page journey that's action-packed, heartwarming, and full of laughs. The first issue sets in motion an ongoing, all-ages adventure that will take you to the farthest ends of the universe! We're creating the comic book of our dreams and we want to get it into your hands... so YOU can be a part of our story!
  The hero of our series is a young boy named Ronnie, a kid who grew up on Mars! He's the son of a butt-kicking, intergalactic space hero; a crusader for peace and justice in a treacherous universe. In our first issue, when Ronnie's mom is kidnapped by his father's greatest foe, an evil alien mastermind, it falls to Ronnie to become the hero and save the day!
Over the course of our series, we will go to many new worlds, meet many different types of creatures (some friendly, some not), and ultimately see if Ronnie can live up to his father's storied legacy. With guidance from unlikely allies, like a strange robot named NAN0 (who you see on our cover), Ronnie must learn to adjust to his new, dangerous reality.
Our goal with this Kickstarter is to raise the necessary funds to print several hundred copies of issue #1. With the cost of printing so high, it is challenging to self-fund both the production and distribution of the book. With your help, we can handle the cost of printing and make our comic available at an affordable price in our online store, at conventions, and at select retailers. 
Ronnie hopes to LAUNCH a successful kickstarter!
While the bulk of our projected goal will go toward the printing cost, a small portion will also fund shipping costs, the Kickstarter fee, and our fantastic rewards. Any excess funds will go towards the making of issue #2, which we are illustrating at this very moment!
  Drew Dorenfest (Writer/Creator) + Hazen Becker (Illustrator/Colorist) at Comic Con 2016!
Drew Dorenfest (Writer/Creator) is a film editor in Los Angeles, CA. He edits movie trailers and commercials, which is fun and challenging! He's been a lifelong fan of comics and graphic novels, so creating Space Case from start to finish was truly a dream come true. This project marks the beginning of what he hopes to be a long-running series that continues to expand and develop into a vivid, imaginative universe.
Hazen Becker (Illustrator/Colorist) is multi-talented artist in San Diego, CA who designs for J!NX apparel. He’s been into comic books for most of his existence, so he couldn’t pass up the awesome opportunity to help bring one to life. Together with Drew, he’s helping to create something special, which he hopes will inspire a new generation of artists and creatives alike.
Oh boy, we have some super cool rewards for our Kickstarter backers! 
We truly appreciate any amount you can pledge. These rewards were designed with the goal of building a fanbase and getting our colorful comic brand out there. We hope you love what we have to offer!

campaign.story:
About Anti-Christ:
Sam has been genetically engineered by terrorists to be the Anti-Christ and destroy the western world, but she wants out of the game and decides to kill herself instead. The problem is she can't die, because a higher power has special plans for her. Sam desperately wants to use the evil powers within her for good, but she is afraid of becoming the monster everyone believes she is.   

"...what I loved was that the audience is learning alongside Samantha. We don’t know entirely what led to her creation or how she was able to survive..." - @kleffnotes from The Nerdy Girl Express
The book is done and ready to go. The entire story has been drawn and colored. The only thing we are waiting on is the funding to go to print. So as soon as funding is achieved, we are off to the printers!
About the physical book:  
Project: Anti-Christ Graphic Novel  
Pages: 120 (approx)  
Book Type: Trade Paperback  
Book Size: 6.625 x 10.25 inches  
Interior: Color pages, gloss  
Exclusives: Variant Kickstarter Only Cover by Mike Crome and colored by Ula Mos.
All pledges for print editions will get signed copies of the book.  
   About the Book -    
Many people fear the end of the world—I personally am not one of them, but I have always been fascinated by it. Every religion, dating back even to Ancient Egypt and the Aztecs have some form of an End of Days story. It usually involves some sort of evil or darkness sweeping across the world, annihilating everything in its path. The most famous, modern day story, comes in the form of the Anti-Christ who will help to bring about the Rapture and fight a losing battle against the second coming of God. But in thinking about it, I wondered, what if the Anti-Christ was just a pawn in someone else’s plans? What if the Anti-Christ actually wanted no part in this great battle or prophecy? Everyone thinks of the Anti-Christ as a being of pure evil. But what if the Anti-Christ was a good person who happens to have a crappy fate? So, the question I want to ask is this, can a good person be a monster? This is an idea I explore in my comic, Anti-Christ.   
  Why Am I Doing This? - 
I am going to launch a Kickstarter in order to create Anti-Christ because all these evil ideas in my head need someplace to escape and if I don’t let them out I will literally go insane.
It's all about following your dream. We've always wanted to create comics, and so we are. All of us have to pursue those dreams that we want to pursue, no matter what they are. It's the way we find happiness in our own lives. 
Who's Involved - 
Writer - James Mascia
Artist/Colorist - Osiris Junior
Cover - Daniel Leister
Variant Cover 1 - Mike Krome
Variant Cover by Mike Krome and Ula Mos
    Variant Cover Mini-Print by David Lima
 Rewards - 
Now, we have a great lineup of rewards for you. Everything from digital PDFs of the completed book to variant covers to me giving you a hand in writing your own comic script.
We also have some little extras planned as the campaign goes on. But those are hush hush now, so we can't talk about them yet. So, take a look below at some of the great rewards we have for you.
          What the Funds Will be Used for - 
The bulk of the funds raised for this Kickstarter will be used for printing and shipping. Of course, Kickstarter will be taking their fee out of what we raise. There will be some money used to cover the expenses of our artist fees, and whatever is left will be used to cover promotions and conventions to get the book out there and keep it in circulation. 
Thanks for taking a look at our project. Take a look through all the rewards and pledge for the Kickstarter. Or if you can't do that, if you could at least share the project on your social networks, that would be excellent! Thanks again. I look forward to bringing this project to life with your help.

Hey guys! Thanks again for backing Anti-Christ. We've just pushed the button on our new comic! So the countdown begins!

So, here's the deal. I just got back 23 packages due to insufficient postage. 
I don't know why. I cannot explain it. But apparently some books were an ounce or two heavier I guess and therefore needed some extra postage????? Like I said, I don't know. I also don't know why it took a month to get returned to me. All I'm hoping is that I don't go and get a bunch more back tomorrow.

Just wanted to let you know that the first group of books are going out today! 
I know you've been waiting patiently for them. And now they're finally going out. I'll be shipping them out in groups over the next couple weeks. And that first group is going out today! I hope you guys enjoy them!
Thanks a bunch!

The books have finally arrived! I received notification yesterday that they are now at Krakenprint's warehouse. So the books are one step closer to getting into your hands! The next step now is for them to ship the 20 boxes (so they have told me) of books to me. Once I get them I will be packing them up and shipping them out. So, we are not far off from that happening. 
We are excited here! And we hope you are too! All this hard work is coming to fruition! I'll get you another update soon!

Just a quick update for everyone. I just got word from Krakenprint that the books are still en route. The estimated arrival for them now are August 17th (so a couple more days). I wish I had something more exciting to update you all with, but unfortunately on the Anti-Christ front that is the extent. 
I will let you know when I have updates. Again, I never thought it would take this long to get these books. For this I apologize. In the future I will plan extra time for these books to arrive.

Well, I am going to preface this by saying I did not think it was going to take this long to get the books... especially considering that the book was complete when the Kickstarter finished. This is something that I will know for next time when I choose an estimated delivery date for rewards. I am just glad they are on their way because I've been on pins and needles these last couple of weeks waiting for word.  
Anyway, the books are officially on their way from across the Pacific. They should be in the warehouse by the beginning of August (so KrakenPrint tells me). So, we are one step closer to getting these books into your hands. A very exciting time here.

While I have no new updates on the status of the Anti-Christ books (which is why I haven't posted an update in a couple of weeks), I do have something new for you. Rest assured, as soon as I get an update from Kraken about the status of the books, you will be the first to know (well, after me of course). 
Since our success with Anti-Christ, we have been working on another title called "Under a Blood-Red Moon" which will go up on Kickstarter once it's complete (I predict September). But we have some initial artwork (not yet colored) that I'd like to share with you. I'm not going to go into details about what it's about just yet. But I think you might get an inkling from these first couple pages.

It's official! The proof has been sent off to the printer!
Now it's just waiting for it to get here. And as my 4-year old son tells me, "Waiting is hard." But do not fret, I have plenty to keep my occupied. We're already busy on another comic project (I'll send you a preview in one of my next updates), and as many of you know it is con-season. This weekend we'll be at Wizard World Philly. So if any of you are in the area, come by Artist Alley and find me. I'm sharing a table with Michael Dolce, and we're at table 1714! If not, there will be plenty of other shows!

The books are officially paid for!
Payment was sent last night. So now it's a waiting game. We are still waiting on final approval for the files we sent over to Kraken, and then we will be waiting as they are printed and shipped to us. I know that waiting is hard. Trust me, I'm on edge with this just as much as you are. But for all good things, we must wait.

campaign.story:
OVERVIEW
In the not too distant future, a Seattle DEA agent and veteran of the War in Russia joins a secret CIA program - where an experimental mind control drug is tested on criminals, small-timers, and other seedy types.
This Kickstarter is to help fund issue #2 of the ten issue crime saga.
Standard cover for North Bend #2 by Robert Carey
THE STORY
The U.S. is at war, against Russia, and its own people. The country is on the verge of economic collapse and political revolution. Desperate to regain control, the CIA recruits Seattle DEA Agent Brendan Kruge to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting Americans.
Compelled by his sense of duty to his country, Brendan struggles to keep his life from falling apart as he tries to reconcile his personal beliefs with the security of the nation.
The story is loosely inspired by the true events of MKULTRA - a secret CIA project that took place during the cold war, where experimental drugs (like LSD) and mind control methods were tested on people without their knowledge.
Variant cover for North Bend #2 by Caspar Wijngaard
PREVIOUSLY IN NORTH BEND
In chapter one, Brendan Kruge, an undercover Seattle DEA agent, questions Andrew Park, a drug dealer, about an experimental drug stolen from a research lab.
Sam and Annie, chemists contracted by the CIA to synthesize drugs from exotic plants, run tests on their latest sample. Sam accidentally slices his hand open, causing the drug to spill into his bloodstream.
The city is under constant disruption by the Crusaders, a revolutionary communist party, who are steadily gaining popularity with the public.
Sam wanders the streets in a drug-fueled haze, meeting Fred, a homeless person. Taking note of Sam's impaired state, Fred easily convinces Sam to empty his bank account.
After a visit by CIA Officers Church and Holbrook, Brendan agrees to join a secret program to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting citizens.
  Covers for #1 by Robert Carey and Tula Lotay
COMING UP IN #2
Below we have a six page preview of North Bend #2. This is just a small look at what's to come in the next chapter, which comes in at 32 pages.
Page 1
  Page 2
  Page 9
  Page 10
  Page 14
  Page 23
CHARACTERS
Here's a few of the characters we've met so far. More will follow, including cops, criminals, victims, and everything in between.
THE TEAM
Ryan Ellsworth (writer), Robert Carey (illustrator), Jason Wordie (colorist), and Thomas Mauer (letterer)
Ryan Ellsworth - Ryan currently lives in Utah, where he got a degree in animation from UVU. He loves visual storytelling, from animation, to screenwriting, to comics. He also enjoys writing about himself in the third person. It's the best. Oh, hey. Yep. This is me. I'm writing this. Right now.
Robert Carey - Rob is an illustrator from Dublin, Ireland and co-founder of indie label Lightning Strike. He's known for The Phantom: Scarlet Sapphire, Power Rangers: Aftershock, Ness, and was recently chosen as a winner in the 2017 Mark Millar talent search.
Jason Wordie - Jason is a colorist and illustrator from Canada and has worked on a variety of cool projects. He is currently the colorist on the perpetually sold-out God Country from Image. Past projects include Turncoat, Dawn of the Planet of the Apes, and Johnny Red.
Thomas Mauer - Over the past few years, Thomas has worked as a letterer and designer for a wide variety of publishers including Dark Horse, Image, Oni Press, and Black Mask. He has been involved in a number of Harvey and Eisner Award nominated and winning titles, and his current lettering credits include 4 Kids Walk Into a Bank, Copperhead, and Kid Savage as well as a host of other upcoming titles he can't talk about yet.
WHERE THE MONEY GOES
To help fund chapter two, we are asking for $3,500, all of which goes to our super cool art team. Making North Bend is a bit more expensive than that, but if we can get that much out of the way, I can cover the rest.
REWARDS
If you pledged for a physical item within the first 48 hours, you'll get a bonus art print of your choice.
There are 9 total art prints available -- all 4 comic covers (~7.25" x 11") as well as the 5 Benjamin Mackey designs.
  6.5" x 11" art prints by Benjamin Mackey
  These are also 6.5" x 11" art prints by Benjamin Mackey
The print copies of #1 turned out really nice and we plan on continuing the quality for #2. Art prints are printed on glossy, quality cardstock. Everything will be shipped in sturdy mailers, and comics will be bagged and boarded. 
Shipping stuff inside sturdy stuff holders

Happy new comic book day! 
Just wanted to give you a heads up that there's less than 48 hours to go on our relaunch for North Bend #2! We're pretty close to reaching our goal, but not gonna lie - it'll be a nailbiter. So if you want this comic to exist, now's a real good time to head over and check it out :)

Sup guys!

BAM: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/1776563028/north-bend-1-2

Hey guys! Hope y'all are doing swell.
It is time for that mid-project update! This one will be an update where I vaguely acknowledge the fact that things aren't looking too hot, but also there's a lot of time left, SO YOU NEVER KNOW, and so forth. So...we'll see what happens, but with 10 days to go, and under 40% funded, it's time to figure out where we (I) went wrong.

Hey friends!
Can you believe it's been over a week since we went live on this campaign? That means just 21 days left to go on this thing. Time flies, right? So how bout a quick update? 
We're now at $1077 of our $3500 goal. That's about 30%. I'm cautiously optimistic - it's not quite a sure thing. I'm hoping above all hope we are on track to hit the goal, but since we're a little lacking on the high dollar pledge levels, we're going to need a good number of backers to make up for it. Rich uncle Jimmy isn't going to swoop in at the last second.

What up friends! Just wanted to post a quick update and make an acknowledgement of your awesomeness. 
I think it's safe to say this little project has gotten off to a great start. With 67 backers we are now 27% funded in two days. For sake of comparison, the KS for North Bend #1 had 57 backers and 25% funded in the first 48 hours. I've recognized a lot of people who backed the first comic are back again, which is super cool to see.

 Psst. Hey. You.

Covers by CHEW's Rob Guillory and PREACHER's Glenn Fabry
Plucked from the time-stream by mad scientist Nikola Tesla, six pregnant women accidentally kill a young Hitler -- and unleash a nightmare future! Now, hunted by the Exalted Father and his bloodthirsty Kranken, and with Tesla acting as Charlie to their Angels, they must save the world from a hell of their own creation... before their water breaks!

About you:
You laugh at inappropriate things.
Funerals? They are hilarious.
You like South Park, Adult Swim, Tarantino Films.
Shel Silverstein, Roald Dahl, and Mel Brooks.
We don't care what Twitter says. We know you're a good person.
FRIED is a state of mind.
Are you FRIED?
 "A comic as audacious as its title." 
           - Brian K. Vaughan, Eisner-Winning author of Saga 
"A hugely enjoyable ride that has a truly disturbing villain at the centre of the action. And in Birdie DiSantos, there’s a heroine who’s part Ripley, part Snake Plissken, and all badass. 9/10." 
           - Starburst

Frieda and Fried Staff drawn by Leila del Duca
FRIED Comics is a proud purveyor of offbeat, irreverent pulp fiction since 2013, and a labor of love for Clay Adams and Alexandre O. Philippe (more on them later).
So far, we've released two full books in (handsome!) digital editions--PREGNANT BITCHES OF WAR Vol. 1 and DEADSKINS!--and successfully crowdfunded the first issue of RED XMAS.
 Yes, people actually make this shit.
Clay is best known as a voice actor, with lead roles on TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES: FAST FORWARD, YU-GI-OH GX and 5Ds. His directorial debut, THE BOY SCOUT, was nominated for Best Short at the Golden Egg Film Festival in Los Angeles, and his feature script, THE ECLIPSE, placed second in the horror category of the FADEIn Awards. He has written and directed for television and holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU. When Clay first met Alexandre, he thought: "My, what a sophisticated European." Boy, was he wrong!
Alexandre is Creative Director of Denver-based Exhibit A Pictures and Cinema Vertige. He holds a Masters Degree in Dramatic Writing from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts, and has written and directed numerous award-winning films and documentaries, including THE PEOPLE vs. GEORGE LUCAS, DOC OF THE DEAD, and THE LIFE AND TIMES OF PAUL THE PSYCHIC OCTOPUS. His most recent feature about the iconic shower scene in Alfred Hitchcock’s PSYCHO, titled 78/52, played to great success at Sundance and sold to IFC. When Alexandre first met Clay, he thought, "My, what a stupid American." Boy, was he right!
After blowing us away with art for PBOW #1, Domo was poached by FX Network's ARCHER before moving on to design characters for CHOZEN. Recent work includes DC's Prez, Marvel's Starbrand and Nightmask, and our very own RED XMAS #1.
Tabor makes all our purty logos from his home in the future (AKA Australia). He's performed design and development work for countries on five continents, had photographs published in international travel magazines, and is the Creative Director of Print and Web at Tiny Robots.
A total nerd and otaku, DJ met the gang at San Diego Comic-Con, which she has attended every year since she was 13. She has drawn sketch cards for Marvel and Upper Deck, and you can follow her on tumblr at darke-imp.tumblr.com.
Charles is from Canada, so we imagine he looks like one of those flappy-headed dudes from South Park. He has lettered books for Image, IDW and Top Shelf (among others) and is a founding member of Frozen Beach Studios. As far as we know, Charles has a normal-looking head. 
Besides being a kick-ass artist, Emily has studied martial arts for over a decade, so she can literally kick your ass. She has worked as a colorist for Action Lab and Coverage, Inc., as well as PBOW and RED XMAS.
The less said, the better. But she's really not so bad once you get to know her. Don't make eye contact, and just be glad the coffee isn't too hot.
  She's not gonna die in a tiny, metal penis.
  Didn't you finish this book two years ago? So, what the %&*# are you Kickstarting?
Yep, this book is 100% complete. 
But we've never collected it into an affordable trade paperback. And now we want to reward our readers with a print copy. 
More than that, though, we thought there might be a new audience for it. 
We dunno. Six diverse women trapped in a word run by a crazy, racist dictator just seemed timely somehow. 
But why Kickstarter?
Because you people are awesome!
We love comic shops, and comiXology is one of our most-used apps. 
But nothing lets you interact with readers the way Kickstarter does. It's like a month-long book tour where you get to meet a bunch of fantastic people.
We successfully Kickstarted RED XMAS #1 on this platform, so why wouldn't we come back to the scene of the crime?
OK... But where will all the money go?
We're not asking for a million dollars. 
Not asking for this. (Photo: (c) Can Stock Photo / pressmaster)
We paid all artists out of our own pockets. 
We're not even looking to get paid back.
We only want enough money to fund a small print run as a reward to the loyal readers who like the book.
Of course, a portion of our funds will go towards Kickstarter fees and taxes (on the project. Not, like, our personal stuff).
And if we're fortunate enough to raise more than our goal, we'll make more comics. 
Hoo-ray! Win-win.
Still not sure? Download the first issue FREE.
We know asking you to fork over your hard-earned money is a big deal. So we're asking Frieda to fork over hers instead. 
Yep. Ol' Frieda has generously agreed to buy you the first issues of PBOW, DEADSKINS!, and RED XMAS so you can be sure this comic is for you.
That's a $6.00 value, and a whole week's paycheck for Frieda. 
See how excited she is?
      CLICK HERE TO DOWNLOAD PBOW #1 + TWO BONUS COMICS

The Kickstarter Campaign: 4 Weeks (March 28-April 28) 
Digital Rewards Released: early May
Kickstarter Funds Released: ~May 14
Book Goes to Printer: ~Week of May 14

Expected delivery to US backers - 2 Weeks (Early September)
Expected delivery for International Backers - 4 Weeks (late September) 
So long, and thanks for all the fish!
Again, we're not asking for a million dollars. 
We just want to put this book in the hands of anyone who wants a copy.
So find a pledge level you like and pre-order. We'll make more comics.
And if you leave a comment on our Kickstarter page that says, "Frieda sent me," we'll send you an extra-special gift.
Oh! And finally...
We heard somewhere that Kickstarter campaigns do better when they have pictures of cats on the page. So, here's a picture of Frieda's cat, Asshole.
If you don't buy a copy for yourself, buy one for Asshole.
Thanks for supporting, and remember...

campaign.story:
Our world's history is under attack by demons intent on sowing chaos. Tart Acid uses her keen investigative instincts, occult knowledge and otherworldly talents to protect as many people as possible from suffering a fate similar to her own. This is the story of a young woman lost, and the hero she found in herself.
The most frequent question we hear at conventions about Tart is "Can I buy the first issue?" When this campaign is funded, we can finally answer "YES!"
This introduction to our series will be 32 pages long. Along with the entire Tart #1, you'll get a preview of the fully painted Tart #2 and beautiful pinups by Shawn Langley and Shane Savanapridi!
San Diego Comic Con attendees can pre-order their copy and pick it up at the show to save shipping costs!
THE CREATORS
   What People are Saying About Tart!
"Tart is F*&cking amazing... If it was legal to date a comic book, I'd date Tart." Ming Chen - AMC's Comic Book Men
"You'll want to take in every glorious frame of this new classic."  Daniel Wilburn - Three Time Backer
"A supernatural Quantum Leap with an imaginative story packed with heart."  James Ferguson - Horror Talk Podcast
"Tart is in a league all by itself. I fell in love with the characters as much as I fell in love with the story and the artwork. It was everything I never knew I wanted." - Derek Becker - ComicProsAndCons.com 
"Tart is the most scrumptious of eye candy, a beautiful pastel daydream of time-traveling adventure." Jason Clark - An Elegant Weapon Podcast 
Why Print Tart #1 as a Single Issue?
While we love the elegance of the Tart Vol 1 Trade Paperback (collecting issues 1-3), we feel it would benefit everyone to have the option of a single issue entry point to our series. 
Especially beneficial for the Hawkpeople of the world.
We returned to Kickstarter for our fifth campaign as much to raise printing costs as to reconnect with, and meet more of, the Kickstarter Community. Our backers have been the lifeblood of our series and we're jazzed to meet new readers with this campaign.  
You can pledge $1 and read the first three issues digitally to see if it's for you, but honestly you don't even have to do that. Click here:
kechalcomics.com/freecomics
and you can download them for free. We believe once you've read Tart you'll want a copy for yourself. And we're willing to let you read them free to see. 
The Rewards
            Thank you, again. With you in Tart's corner, even the King of Hell doesn't stand a chance!
  The king of what now?

This is our fifth campaign and we have never delivered late. This campaign should be no different, because we never launch a Kickstarter campaign until the art is 100% completed.

We're in constant communication with our printers with the goal to print as soon as the Kickstarter funds are transferred to us (usually about two weeks after the campaign is complete).

That said, printing overseas always presents the possibility of problems in transit. We promise to communicate clearly and immediately if any situation occurs.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: What would have happened if we didn’t land with Scout Comics?
updates.update_content: The possibility of bringing Tart to Scout Comics started to come into view about two years ago.   It was right about the time Tart 6 or 7 was in production.

If you receive multiple messages from me, I want to thank you and apologize. It means you have supported Tart Kickstarters multiple times in the past. Kickstarter is making some really nice changes, but so far they won't let us combine our past campaign backer list into one update.
As my roommate used to say, No good deed goes unpunished.
Any way. If you've read this update already, you can ignore it.

updates.update_userinfo: The Tart 7 Kickstarter campaign is officially underway!
updates.update_content: Please visit kechalcomics.com/kickstartmytart today to help us start fast, and assure yourself a copy of the free first day print.

I received an email last week asking for the pdf of Tart #6 which was a digital reward for all backers of the Tart #! Convention campaign.
I sent an email back with the pdf and realized there was a good chance I had forgotten to send this out to you. 
I am so sorry.
The campaign to fund a beautiful offset printing of Tart #6 launched this morning and...

It can be hard to juggle Kickstarter delivery properly. This update probably should have come Thursday evening.
That's because Thursday morning I drove about an hour south to Miami to pick up the Kickstarter packages. They looked a whole lot like this:

This is going to be a quick one. At least, I'm going to try to make it a quick one. 
This Kickstarter is the first time I've experimented with letting some of our rewards ship straight from the printer. Which means some of you ($9 and $15 tiers) should be receiving your rewards very soon.
I try to pretend I'm not a control freak, but when it comes to Kickstarter delivery I get a little precious. What that means is that I'm asking you to contact me if ANYTHING happens with your rewards. Did you pay for the SDCC cover? Please open the package up and make certain it is there. Is there a nick on the corner of your comic? Contact me and I'll make it right.

updates.update_userinfo: Updating on a mental health day
updates.update_content:
Today is a first for me. I have never tapped out of a convention for an entire day (I've left an hour early or popped out for lunch or a nap). But when my UnderWars collaborator Chris Brennan said his fiancee could come in on Saturday and I could take a day off I thought it might be a good idea.
When I woke up this morning (3 minutes before I would have had to be working the con) I realized it wasn't a good idea, it was a necessary one. 5 days at San Diego Comic Con and two at SuperCon out of 10 calendar days have me gassed : )

Doors open for San Diego Comic Con at 6pm Pacific time. I will be here in booth 2306 to experience it.
Without you, this isn't possible.
This isn't a long update, but I want you to savor it.
Thank you for getting me here. And for sending me with 175 (or more if I go full Oprah) copies of Tart #1

campaign.story:
This is an adult comic with graphic language, graphic violence, murder and suggestive themes.
In 2110 the sin that has gripped man's heart throughout the ages has finally dug it's claws in irreversibly deep. People indulging to deeply are possessed and left under the control of the demon's from within. These beings spread like wild fire through society wrecking lives, ruining reputations, and infecting innocence with chaos.
Those with true sight, better known as "The Lion's Eye", are the only people who can see these demon's true form. And after they've seen the true nature of the world they either fight, or die. Fight long enough and they may be so  lucky as to be invited to join the Lion's Eye Clan.
But before anyone can join, they have to survive the "Trials of Cleansing". 
Issue #2 will be a 32 page comic! 
Here's a preview of issue #2!
            What's the funding for?
My team! 
30% will be used for printing the comics, the posters, and the t-shirts!
10% will be used for packing and shipping.
40% will be used to pay our art team to finish up our second issue.
10% will be used to upgrade our online storage capabilities so we can transfer our files without losing any quality. That way you get the best possible results!
And the final 10% will pay for processing fees for Kickstarter!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We learned so much from issue #1 that we're ready to face issue #2 with a healthy respect for unexpected challenges. But after losing a color artist, changing our printer, QC'ing 1000+ comics, and drawing 75 custom drawings we still made issue #1 happen. We're very confident going in to issue #2!

However, time management is our biggest concern for this issue. We want to complete this issue within out time frame and start producing monthly issues ASAP!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey FIRST ARC! 
Thank you so much for taking the time to check out my kickstarter campaign! This is your chance to help me complete the FIRST ARC of my comic book series ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey! EVERY pledge level includes digital copies of the zero issue and the first issue which were successfully kickstarted in 2016! This kickstarter is to fund the printing of the continuing story of Era Nalyd and Tachi as they fight for survival in the caves of New Selenia! 
This comic book is done. I've written, penciled, inked, and lettered this issue. I need your help to get it printed! Once the goal for this campaign is hit, we go to print, and you get your rewards!
ARCHIVE The WarHood Odyssey is the Walking Dead meets Star Wars. It's a 22 page black and white 90s style comic that takes place on New Selenia! Starring an exciting cast of original characters! 
Era Nalyd: Who currently has possession of the WarHood. Or does it possess him? 
Tachi: The silent ninja who has been stranded with Era.
Lock: The tough as nails leader of the gang.
Yari: The razor sharp assassin. 
WHY COMICS? I believe that comics are an important part of our culture and have the power to change the world. That's why I started Batlantic Studios, where comics matter. I'm so proud of this work, thank you so much for joining me as I continue on this journey!

This book is a 90’s style sci-fi horror comic. The story takes place on the post apocalyptic planet of New Selenia. In this newest issue we follow the main character, Era as he tries to survive with a ninja warrior named Tachi.
It's like The Walking Dead meets Star Wars created in the style of a 90's style comic book!

My name is Dylan Andrews, I have been working professionally as a designer and artist for almost 20 years. Why do I make comics? I believe that comics are an important part of our culture and have the power to change the world. That's why I started Batlantic Studios, where comics matter. The importance of mythology and the concept of the hero's journey are themes that empower and connect us all. I love comic books and I want to find people that love what I'm doing and want to support it.

campaign.story:
Stretch Goal Achieved!
Click to learn more about this stretch goal.
  Welcome (back) to Morgan's Organs, a comedy comic book series like Pixar's Inside Out but for grown-ups. Are you ready to see what might really be going on inside our insides?
In February 2016, we introduced Kickstarter and the world to Book 1 of our quirky concept. Now, we've returned to continue the adventures of college student Morgan as his body parts struggle to keep him alive, find purpose in life, and work together as a community. The great thing about this series is each book is a stand-alone story. You don't have to read Book 1 to understand what's going on in Book 2!
In Book 1 (40 pages of story), we saw Morgan's brain operator, Bran, and penis operator, Pepe, go head-to-head for control of Morgan's decision-making, all while Morgan battled the pressure to end a dry spell. You can enjoy a 15-page preview of Book 1 here!
In Book 2 (also 40 pages of story), things remain equally embarrassing, hilarious and awkward for Morgan. Except this time, we're exploring different body elements. Check out the Book 2 preview below! And make sure to check out our rewards options.
            That's right, Morgan is in a sticky situation yet again. And if you've read Book 1, you know we'll deliver on that promise. Here's a couple more pages in progress.
    Morgan's Organs is the wild brain child of me - Daniel Brodie - AKA Canadian #1. I'm excited to continue to partner with the incredibly talented artist, Robert Jennex - AKA Canadian #2 - who's handling all art for the book. We're a small team, but we've done it before, and we're ready to do it again.

This series focuses on Morgan as he navigates everyday college life, which is made difficult by the fact that he isn't completely "human". Inside his body lives a variety of organ-like characters (called organauts) who control his various body systems and ultimately, are keeping him alive. The problem is these organauts don't always operate with the best interests of their host in mind.
The stories take place on two levels. Outside, we follow Morgan and his group of friends as they navigate college life. Zoom into his insides and we see how Morgan's struggles are made worse by a group of organ operators who bicker, lie, cheat, argue, act selfish, and generally, don't work together as one community.

  I believe in complete transparency because I don't see this as a business - not yet, at least. These campaigns are part of my long-term vision to have Morgan's Organs picked up by a publisher, and eventually made as a television series. All of my rewards are priced appropriately to cover exactly what I need to support this vision. That means covering artist salary, production (including printing), and packaging/shipping.
In the KS campaign for Book 1, we raised ~$5,500 from over 175 backers (140% of funding goal). As I committed to spending up to $1,000 CAD of my own money on this project (if needed), I invested in a larger print run of Book 1 which drove down the per-unit-cost and created the opportunity to grow readership. I also invested in an Artist Alley booth at Toronto's Fan Expo 2016, where I was able to bring in many more interested fans. Overall, my personal spending on Book 1 was about $700 CAD.
I pay my artist what I am able, but we both have a mutual understanding this is a partnership and we're investing in a long-term vision. For Book 1, Rob received about $3,700 for all project work. This included a bonus payment for all his hard work after the entire project was done, based on what I could afford.
For this book, Rob will be receiving about $4,000, and if we're able to exceed our campaign goal by enough, I hope to increase his page rate further. I will invest up to $1,250 CAD of my own money into this project above what is raised, whether it goes towards printing, artist costs, or having a booth at an upcoming event.
Our Kickstarter goal of $4,000 CAD supports the below:
60% = artist salary
30% = the 4P's - printing / production / packaging / parceling (shipping)
10% = Kickstarter fees
Everything raised above this goal will go to a combination of:
Additional printing (further driving down per-unit-cost and creating opportunity to invest in our stretch goal rewards)
Increasing artist salary
Convention booths at 2017 Toronto Fan Expo and perhaps more!
This isn't just another comic book; it's a long-term vision. I have over 15 future stories planned (and counting), plus spin-off versions of the concept. The end goal is to produce Morgan's Organs as a television show, but until then, we'll continue to make great books, grow our audience, and look at the human body in weird, wacky ways! Thank you for helping us achieve our dream!

campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have the experience from running a Kickstarter campaign for Book 1 to know how to deliver on our promise. In our first campaign, we were less than one month delayed in fulfilling rewards to our backers, which I'm happy about given that most campaigns are delayed even longer.

For this campaign, we've completed even more art pages going into the launch than before, and we have production and fulfillment down to a T so the process going forward should be even smoother.

Given that the art is not fully complete yet for Book 2, there's always the risk that our artist, Rob, is:
- crushed by a meteorite while chasing a seagull,
- poisoned by a rare Amazonian tree frog species that somehow makes its way to the coast of Nova Scotia, or
- selected as one of the first humans to colonize Mars (though if they can set-up electricity and Wi-Fi quickly, he should still be able to deliver).

What I mean to say is we expect minimal challenges in delivering on our promise within a reasonable time frame.

campaign.story:
What is Prospects? 
Prospects is a new sci-fi comic from writer Max Majernik and artist Jean Franco. The Kickstarter is for the 1st volume (Issues #1-#3) of the mini-series. The comic is the perfect balance of 50's sci-fi, 80's action, and everyday life. The story may begin with a slow burn, full of character moments a la Shaun of the Dead, but by the 7th issue there are giant kaiju creatures fighting through Ridgeville with armies, cyborgs, and zombies lining the streets. Below, we have 3 different previews and more information about the rewards.
The first Kickstarter for Prospects #issue 1 was a Kickstarter staff pick and funded in just 100 hours.
Story:
The town of Ridgeville has been stuck in the middle of a 150 year old battle between two mad scientists, and former colleagues, Edwin Grabowski and Victor Farsimov. Both claim to have figured out the secret of immortality and created armies of zombies and cyborgs using their respective methods. The scientists have waged a war for so long within the town that the townspeople now consider it an honor to be abducted by one of the mad scientists in their quest for glory. Anyone who shows any bit of potential, be it brains, brawn, or anything in between, will be captured by one of the scientists by the time they are 25 years old.
On the outside looking in is 30 year old Colin Bates, who isn’t one of the prospects. He has been selected by no one, not by scientists, girls, or even friends. He spends most of his days watching TV in his basement where he avoids doing odd jobs for his Grandma and her friends. Everything changes when a notorious terrorist intent on destroying both scientists appears in Colin’s basement begging Colin to take over his legacy.
On the inside looking out is 18 year Andrew Russell. Andrew has it all, the brains, brawn, and looks to be whatever he wants. The ultimate 5 tool prospect. The problem is that the whole community wants him to be a soldier for one of the scientists, while he just wants a normal 18 year old life. He has to deal with the pressure of the town, especially his mom, about every aspect of his day, AND the thought that he can be abducted by one of the scientists at any moment.
Reviews of Prospects #1
"...a self aware and fiendeshly creative series. It delivers on every concievable front..."  -thegreengorcrow.com
"...feels refreshing and opts away from being too serious, instead deliverying an entertaining experience that leaves you asking questions and wanting more..."  -Ap2Hyc.com
"...the characters are real and charming, the story ominuous and compelling and yet surreal and absurd and great stylized art by Jean Franco..."  -Culturegecko.com
"The story was well executed, the characters were relateable, and more importantly, I had fun reading it..." -Geeknerdrepeat.com
PREVIEW
Pages 1 and 2 of Issue #1
  Pages 18-21 of Issue #1
       Pages 9-11 of Prospects #2
      Meet the Team
Max Majernik (Writer) @SnowballMax I currently reside in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. I have a passion for writing and took classes such as dramatic and theater writing in college in hopes of getting a dramatic writing degree. Over the past few years, I have written reviews, articles, and interviews for various comic blogs. The blog I have dedicated most of my time to is comicosity.com, where I had the pleasure of reviewing a wide range of comics and interviewing many industry regulars. This past year, I felt compelled to go back to my creative writing background and to focus my free time on writing an original idea. As my first venture into the world of comic writing, I put together a small miniseries that I hope people who love comics, or people who enjoy a fun story, can enjoy. campaign.story:
Scout, the last scientist, returns to her ancestral home of Earth to find it in a state of wilderness. A story about the value of science & skepticism, and their conflict with religion and narrative-based thinking. After the Gold Rush is a return to optimistic Science Fiction - the idea that the world can be better. 
This Kickstarter aims to print the second chapter in the saga. Each issue is 22 pages long, with extra features such as web comic pages, a scientist of the issue section, write-in science corrections, etc. 
We ran a Kickstarter last year to start After the Gold Rush, and thanks to all of our awesome backers we have enough to keep the story going for 4 issues! However, the plan was to keep them digital. Due to popular demand we are planning to print them now. And that is why we are back on Kickstarter. 
See the cover for ATGR #2 close up.
    This image will also be the logo on the T-Shirts!
It is good to have warnings, but it is better to have goals. Science Fiction is full of important stories warning us about the dangers of our hubris. That is a useful lesson, but it shouldn't be all we use the genre for. I grew up watching Star Trek, a show about exploration, progress, and ethics. While it didn't always nail the details, it cared about science and reason. After the Gold Rush is my small attempt to return some of those ideas to modern Science-Fiction.
   This comic is also about the value of skepticism, and explaining what that means. Too often skeptics are synonymous with cynics. I want to show what skepticism is really about - caring about what's true. 
If you want to know more, check out the episode of Skeptics Guide to the Universe I was on. I go over my aspirations for the book in more depth. 
  Isaac La Russa & Miles Greb
Miles Greb - Creator & Writer - Former Bob Dylan impersonator whose obsession with Star Trek is annoying to everyone.
Isaac La Russa - Lead Artist & Concept Artist -Based in Illinois, he wears motley flannels and owns two ungrateful cats.
Adrian Geller - Colorist - Like Mario Paint for the SNES, but with nearly twice the personality
Andrew Pierce - Editor - Lovable goof. Escaped Kipling protagonist.
Jamie Me - Lettering - Letterer who spends his time wearing pajamas called a 'gi' while learning the art of Brazilian jiu-jitsu.
Barry Blankenship -Cover Artist & Logo Design - Amateur cursing cat ventriloquist.
Lauren Uhde - Science Adviser - PhD student and all-around Biology Babe.
Ben Rodgers - Assistant Editor - Historian of historical biographies, at least he was historically. 
 Poster Team - David Hovey ,Natasha Alterici, Chris Lewis Lee. 
 You can follow the project closer at - @Goldrushcomic. 
 Some of the characters and technology you will find in After the Gold Rush. I have some more concept art to show from things to come in future issues - see the stretch goals for more details!

 This print will be available as an 11" X 17", but it will also be part of a limited run of variant covers for After the Gold Rush #2. There will only be 100 printed. This is your best chance to get one. They will all be signed by Miles Greb.

This reward, the Luna Level, features this one of a kind cover, the variant cover, and a signed copy of ATGR #1. 
The Reward Levels
A Look at the Art Pints
All the prints are 11" x 17" except for "Inspire Science", that is 8 1/2"x11". They are all printed on a high quality glossy card stock, and look great. If you back at a reward level with a large art print, you may choose whatever one you fancy. Here are your options. 
Shirts
They are print on demand, so sizes S to XL are available!!
By popular demand we have included After the Gold Rush T-shirts as reward options! Wear this to show your science-loving comic support around town, and wherever cool comic-people hangout. The T-shirts are print on demand, so sizes should not be an issue. I think they look pretty cool. 
Custom Profile Art, by Isaac La Russa
Want to see yourself in a Cyro suit or a Titan Explorer uniform? There are reward tiers with both a full body commission like the one you see below. or, you can get a profile done that is perfect to use for facebook or twitter. The art will be delivered to you digitally.

Full body art commissions by Aimee Zhou
We also have the amazing storyboard artist Aimee Zhou on staff. The $125 dollar reward level includes a hand drawn commission of you in a Titan Explorer or Cyro suit! And the original art will be delivered to you! Pretty cool. 
Aimee will draw you in a ATGR suit, and you get the actual copy!
 Stretch Goals
If things go really well I would love to be able to continue the ATGR webcomic. It precedes the events of ATGR, and follows Scout as a young girl growing up on Titan. You can check it out here for FREE.
    As some of you know, we ran a Kickstarter last summer to get the whole story started. Thanks to everyone's support we have the funds needed to finish all the art for ATGR #2. We had planned to release it digitally only, not printed. 
    However, demand for a printed copy has been really high, so here is your chance to make it a reality. Most of the budget will go directly into Printing Costs and Shipping. Another small chunk will go into art fees for commissions done especially for this Kickstarter - the variant cover and some new art commissions. Lastly, fees from Kickstarter, taxes, stuff like that.
