campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino, Bryan Valenza, and Nic J Shaw. Skies was launched in on Kickstarter and subsequently releases each new issue on the platform. 
This Kickstarter's goal is to raise funds to print issue #3. Any additional funds will go directly into the production of issue #4 and the reprinting of #1-2. 
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince.
His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
In Issue Two, Captain Pierce enlists the help of the elusive William.
Issue Three follows the pair as they continue assembling the rest of the crew for their mission in the bordertown of Copperhead.
Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. His work can be found in publications from Mythopoeia to Marvel to Boom! He recently moved to Valencia where he now draws full time.  
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects, including Skies of Fire and Aftershock's InSexts. 
Nic J Shaw is a writer, letterer, and graphic designer. His work can be found everywhere - no seriously, Nic seems to know everyone. He lives in Sydney, Australia with his fiancée and their schnauzer, Archer. 
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army.
Pawel Fotek is a self taught artist from Poland who jumped on the art train pretty late, at the age of 21. Since his early years he's always scribbled on the back of his notebooks during most classes. After graduating from high school, Pawel went to study economics at a local university, yet deep inside he felt that it's wasn't something he'd like to pursue in life, and that place was only ensuring him in his beliefs. One cold winter morning he woke up and simply decided to quit the uni and train very hard to become a professional artist. He has not looked back ever since. 
The Skies of Fire team stands by their policy of transparency when it comes to crowdfunding. The funds for this Kickstarter will be used as follows:
Skies of Fire is printed in a beautiful 8x11" oversized format that showcases the incredible talent of our artists. The size harkens to a European aesthetic, reflecting the diverse background of the people working on the project.
 In addition to the story, each issue contains a 3-4 page codex in the back of the book. The codex provides additional background and context to the world much like an old school video game manual or tabletop rulebook.
The Aquilan Calendar by Alex Bucur.
Variant covers give us an opportunity to showcase and collaborate with artists whose work otherwise might not be shown in comics. For issue two, our variant cover is done by the extremely talented Pawel Fotek with letters by Alex Bucur.
Get your poster copy of the variant with the "I want you in royal blue" slogan!
We mail our comics bagged and boarded in sturdy chipboard mailers. Chipboard mailers are incredibly durable and almost impossible to bend. They'll keep the comics safe as they're in transit to you while the bags and boards will ensure they'll continue to remain in mint condition for years to come.
The rest of our of packaging includes three inch diameter cardboard tubes for posters and cardboard parcel packages for large orders, along with bubble wrap.
 See a closeup of our Poster Prints here. 
To purchase Add-Ons, simply add the amount in red to your order. Additionally, you may also wait until the end of the campaign and purchase add-ons through BackerKit, where you will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information.
Show your allegiance with a KICKSTARTER EXCLUSIVE wax seal on your issue today!
If you are adding-on a poster print and are based outside of the US, please add the following amount for shipping ONLY IF you do not have any other posters included in your backer reward:
Canada / Mexico: $10
United Kingdom / EU: $6
Rest of World: $14
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This will be our 3rd Kickstarter project and at this point we have a good idea of what to expect before, during, and after the campaign. The main challenge we've faced in our past two is delivery - we strive always to deliver rewards to our backers in a timely manner, and though we've gotten faster each time, there is still room for improvement. 

For this campaign we plan on ordering the books as soon as we have a good guess about the demand, potentially 1-2 weeks in. We also plan on streamlining the logistics for some of our higher-end reward tiers, and are looking into the possibility of a fulfillment service if the demand is great enough. 

The production of issue three is completely done, so the timeline is all about printing and shipping the books.

Welcome to Morgan’s Organs: a comedy comic book series set inside our insides. The premise is simple - imagine that micro-beings live within the human body who are responsible for the functioning of our organs. They influence our thoughts, our actions, and our urges. It's like Inside Out for grown-ups! 
With your help, I'll be able to complete the design and printing of the first issue (40 pages) of the series.
Check out the cover and preview pages of Issue #1 below!
page 5 - first draft in production
page 6 - first draft in production
My name is Daniel Brodie, and I've been working on my concept for over 2 years. I am pleased to partner with the talented artist, Robert Jennex, from Nova Scotia, to build my comic. We are both excited to bring this story to life.
Left - Daniel, Right - Rob
With your help, we can build the next great comedy series as we discover what might really be going on within each of us.
Morgan's Organs follows university student Morgan as he navigates growing up, while the operators of his internal organs learn to work together to help him tackle all aspects of life.
The comic transitions back-and-forth between Morgan's world and the world that exists within his body. On the exterior, Morgan is your average college student learning to make sense of the world. 
Zoom in to his body and we see why life is so difficult for him. His body is host to a variety of characters, each with their own desires and their own flaws. One thing is guaranteed - it's no wonder Morgan is so unsure of what he wants when his body parts can barely work together.
In this first issue, Morgan faces conflicting pressures to break a dry spell. Meanwhile, within his body, his organ operators go head-to-head for central influence over Morgan's decision-making. 
The story will tackle many questions. Who should we listen to? What does it mean to be a community? And, why does our body embarrass us at the worst possible moments?! I might not always have answers, but I do have plenty of ideas.
Featuring inappropriate dreams, elevator embarrassments, carnival erotica games, and the smartest appendix you've ever met - I believe you're in for a thrilling journey as we explore who, or what, might really be in control of us.
Let's meet Morgan and some of the organ operators, AKA "organauts", living in his body...
Bran the brain is the leader of Morgan's group of organauts. He tries to balance what's best for Morgan with what his body wants, but it's tough when Morgan doesn't always listen to logic.
Pepe the penis is the talking genitalia we've been waiting to see. His impulsive nature leads him to butt heads with Bran's rational approach. You can't blame the little guy for just wanting to have some fun.
Hugo the heart has an even bigger heart himself. He is caring to the emotions of others and is an advocate for "true love". Sometimes he just wears his heart too much on his sleeve. 
There's plenty more organauts ready to come to life with your help. Kidneys, appendixes, livers, butts, and more! Plus, Morgan's friends, and even a potential romantic interest. We'll learn more about the various micro-beings within Morgan's body in this first issue, and hopefully, in future editions too!
(top to bottom, left to right) - Morgan, Meats the stomach, Lou the lungs, Pepe the penis, Bran the brain, Hugo the heart

START AGAIN is a superhero boy meets girl story that is EXPLICITLY (read NSFW) British. The story follows AJAY, the British national superhero, and NATALIE as they have a chance encounter in a nightclub in Leeds city centre. It will explore themes of anxiety, social pressure and interracial relationships based on some of creator Jamie Me's life experiences. Inspirations for the new project come from modern British comedies such as Peep Show and Catastrophe (technically Brit-American) while taking on the superhero genre by infusing unfamiliar settings, elements and characters.
Limited edition "THEY" variant cover
Queen is a country changing British political thriller by START AGAIN creator Jamie Me (art by Bernard Gita, and with colours by Sean Callahan). Who killed Prime Minister Daniel Camden?
Queen issue #1 is available in most of the tiers digitally, and physically in select ones. The comic itself features 21 story pages, and is currently only available via this Kickstarter.

Risks and challenges
Every Kickstarter can run into difficulties outside of the creators control, but here is some information about how I would handle them, and about my last Kickstarter:

I ran a successful Kickstarter in 2015 called Queen Part One: Nidus. That project is completed, and was shipped out to backers all over the world.

My local comic book store, Inter-Comics.com, have agreed to help out with shipping like they did for Queen. This means that all the packaging will be to the standard you'd expect to receive from a market leading website.

Potential problems, and how I'd handle them:

The only reason for a delay on the art front would be if Toni or Sean were to suffer injury or sickness. If there are any delays to the project you will be kept in the loop. For my last project I sent out updates twice a month until completion. Your support and money is granting me a position of trust, and that is something I take seriously.

Another potential delay would be if the Kickstarter far out performed its original goal and that would require additional packaging. To deal with this potential issue I have friends and family ready to help. As mentioned I'll also be helped by Inter-Comics, and this resulted in my last project having everything sent out in around one week once it was ready to ship.

Adapting Shakespeare. It’s something every community theater and big time Hollywood producer does. “King Lear, but during the Tokugawa era” or “Hamlet, but this time he’s a lion.” Not entirely bold moves, but ever since freshman English, we’ve had it drilled into us that these stories are timeless. You can set Twelfth Night or Taming of the Shrew in high school until the cows come home, but it might leave you feeling like it’s missing some of that Real Shakespeare Flavor ®. 
That’s why I thought it’s time for Ol’ Billy Shakes himself to get adapted. Now I know what you’re saying, “Shakespeare in Love won best picture in 1999, that was about Shakespeare.” Yeah, but was he a superhero? I didn’t think so. Shakespeare is timeless, but better than that, the man’s been dead for 400 years, he’s totally in the public domain. I can make him a silly masked detective for all he cares… 
No Holds Bard is a 5-Act comic about Shakespeare fighting crime in Elizabethan England, written (mostly) in iambic pentameter. Featuring some of the hottest artists working in comics today, including Erica Henderson, Logan Faerber, Cara McGee, James Callahan, and Aaron Conley, with a cover by Dave Kloc and pin-ups from Sina Grace, Bobby Rubio and Ashlyn Anstee. No Holds Bard will feed your eyes and get all four humors moving. It won’t make you dumber, but you will fail your literature test. 
The Story
Nice queen you got there. Shame if something were to happen to her.
While writing yet another one of his masterpieces, Shakespeare receives a call from his trusty page, Page, with most disturbing news—The Queen has been stolen! From there, the Dramatic Duo of The Bard and Page set off in a series of rollicking misadventures that lead to the highest echelons of Renaissance power. He'll cross paths with weirdos of all shapes and sizes. You might even recognize a few of them from someone's most famous plays (but then, I don't want to spoil all the fun).
Who is the shadowy figure responsible for the Queen’s disappearance? Will Will ever get rid of his pesky writer’s block? Why can nobody tell The Bard is Shakespeare? I mean clearly… 
Find out the answers to these questions and to more you didn’t even know you had when you read No Holds Bard SOON! 
Artists
No Holds Bard features illustrations from some of the top new artists working in comics today. Check it:
Erica Henderson - Act I
Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead?!
One of comics' rising stars, her credits include Marvel's Unbeatable Squirrel Girl with Ryan North and Archie Comics' Jughead with Chip Zdarsky. A graduate of Rhode Island School of Design, she currently lives in Boston.
Logan Faerber - Act II
And that's for Gnomeo & Juliet!
Logan was always a quiet child: one who kept to himself and played outside as frequently as he could. He could relate to cartoons and animals more than most people. On his 7th birthday, Logan’s brother passed down his long boxes of comics, granting access to Marvel and DC stories from the 70s onward. This imaginary landscape helped to fuel Logan’s desire to become an artist and drove him to pursue illustration and design at Montserrat College of Art. Now, as an adult, Logan still finds joy in playing games, reading books and drawing pictures, keeping himself young at heart forever.
Cara McGee - Act III
What the hell am I going to eat for lunch?
Cara McGee is an Atlanta-based comic book artist and tea connoisseur. You can find her covers on Lumberjanes and follow her wildly popular tumblr at http://areyoutryingtodeduceme.tumblr.com/.
James Callahan - Act IV
Remember when I said Rosencrantz and Guildenstern are dead? Well not yet they're not.
James Callahan is a writer and illustrator, working on the east coast of the U.S., often under the less innocuous moniker, Barf Comics. He has illustrated hundreds of comic pages, and worked on scores record covers, skate decks, and t-shirt designs with clients ranging from Marvel, Oni, and Image Comics to Creature Skateboards and Thrasher Magazine, to bands like Municipal Waste, Mastodon, the Hold Steady, the Black Dahlia Murder, and many more.
Aaron Conley - Act V
If it be a sin to kick lots of butts, I am the most offending soul alive.
Aaron Conley is the co-creator and artist of Sabertooth Swordsman. He has worked for Marvel, Dark Horse, Image, Boom Studios and Ghost Face Killah. He is also the winner of the 2014 Russ Manning Award for Most Outstanding Newcomer. His favorite kind of dog is a Boston terrier.
Dave Kloc - Cover
Dave Kloc is an illustrator and printmaker living in Los Angeles. He has designed and hand printed a weekly poster for The Meltdown with Jonah and Kumail (now in its 3rd season on Comedy Central.) Kloc has also illustrated and printed posters for comedians such as John Mulaney and Jim Gaffigan and bands like Passion Pit, La Dispute, Childish Gambino and more!
Bobby Rubio - Pin-up
Bobby Rubio worked nine years with Walt Disney Feature Animation as a traditional animator and storyboard artist on several films including “Tarzan” and “Treasure Planet.” After Disney, he worked as an assitant director/storyboard artist for Nickelodeon Animation Studios on the series “Avatar: The Last Airbender”. Currently, Bobby is a story artist for Pixar Animation Studios and has worked on feature animated movies “Up”,“Brave” and "Inside Out".
After work hours, he works on his creator-owned and independent comic series, “Alcatraz High”, “ENFORCEMEN” and “4 Gun Conclusion.” And from time to time, he has freelanced for Marvel Comics as a cover artist.
Sina Grace - Pin-up
Sina Grace is an Image Comics writer and artist, known for his memoir material (Self-Obsessed, Not My Bag), and illustration work (Li'l Depressed Boy, Burn the Orphanage, Penny Dora). On all relevant social media @SinaGrace
Ashlyn Anstee - Pin-up
Ashlyn Anstee grew up in a rainy city, moved to a snowy city, and then settled in a sunny city, where she writes and draws for animation and children's books. You can find her art and other fun stuff at www.ashlyna.com
Frank Cvetkovic - Letterer
Wait til you see this in context.
Frank Cvetkovic is a comic book letterer whose work has appeared in ARTFUL DAGGERS, DRIVE, Jamal Igle’s MOLLY DANGER, and THE BIGGER BANG. He currently lives in Cleveland, OH, where the home teams never win and the rivers occasionally catch fire.
Why Shakespeare?
I love Shakespeare (the pomp of it all!), and I know for a fact STAN LEE co-creator of Spider-Man, does too. So there has to be a fair amount of overlap between Shakespeare fandom and comic fandom, right? Also, he seemed perfect for the style of campy, not-so-serious stories that you'd see in an episode of Batman '66, but with very well illustrated violence. It covers a whole Venn diagram of tastes, and hopefully it appeals to more than just me.
You don't want to know how long it took me to come up with these captions.
What is iambic pentameter?
Bill Shakespeare used this style of verse a lot.
Each line contains ten syllables, no more.
Then further split in stressed and unstressed parts.
It makes things sound much smarter than they are.
Now I'm no Shakespeare, but just like Shakespeare, I didn't use it everywhere, so that's why we're saying it's mostly in iambic pentameter. Sorry English nerds, I'm getting out in front of you. 
The Dramatic Duo Companion EP
To celebrate the launch of No Holds Bard, I've commissioned a digital-only companion EP with an original extra-jazzy theme song from Spencer Owen (Dude Bro Party Massacre III) and a super-sweet love song from Allie Goertz (Rick and Morty Concept Album), available to all backers who pledge $3 or more. It's a hell of a deal, and perfect bed music for when you're getting your thespi-on.
Why donate?
This is something I've been knocking around in my head for a long time, and I'm really passionate about it, so I'm going to need you to lend me your ears (and your wallets, har har). If this thing is ever going to get off the ground, it needs your support. I've been incredibly lucky to work with such talented artists to help realize a story I thought was worth telling. Without you, it's just a stack of "maybe someday" crowding my brainspace, but with you, it could just be your next favorite comic.
Also, there are some pretty tantalizing rewards. Just sayin'.
The Rewards
We've put together a bunch of exciting rewards for No Holds Bard, including stickers, lithographs, domino masks, t-shirts, a companion EP and even a fancy box with a REAL HUMAN SKULL inside.
Not bad for a dollar.
Double your dollar and get sweet prizes.
Three dollars?! What a bargain!
Probably the one you want, unless you're REALLY COOL.
Show the world you care.
Stickers for everything!
If I see you in one of these at a convention, you get a free high five.
You choose which lithograph you get!
Wear a face on your chest
All Four Lithos and a T-Shirt, and all the other stuff. A $190 value for a measly $116
Customized for each individual backer.
I choose which one you get, but they're all awesome.
REAL HUMAN SKULL IN A REAL WOODEN BOX
Where is the money going?
Like many people, artists need food to live, so most of the money goes to paying our artists a professional page rate so that they may live in a modern capitalistic society. Other dollars are going toward Kickstarter for use of their infrastructure and reward fulfillment such as poster printing costs, manufacturing masks, and building that fancy skull box. Even if we reach the initial $10,000 goal, I'll be taking a hit. That's how much I want this to get made.
Artist Fees: $7750 (77.5%)
Kickstater Fees: $800 (8%)
Rewards and Shipping: $2890 (28.9%)
BackerKit ~$200 (2%)
Should I have set the goal to $11,640? Probably, but I suffer for my art.
Stretch Goals 
The more we make, the more we can make. I have 6 issues planned out already, and a lot more ideas to come. If there's interest, there's more content for you, so I hope you're feeling generous.
At $22,000, we're funding a SECOND ISSUE with more great artists and everything. 
About the Creator
Eric Gladstone is a writer and native-born son of Los Angeles. He is the Senior Dialogue Writer for Marvel Heroes 2016 and he works as a researcher, video editor and writer at Stan Lee's POW! Entertainment offices. POW! in no way endorses the comic. 
No Holds Bard marks his first public foray into the world of published narrative comics, he put a lot of work into it and thinks it’s going to be good, so you’d better like it. 
He also likes dogs, cats, rats, pigs, bad puns, professional wrestling, and riddles.

WE'RE FUNDED!
Yeah, we're making this thing! Awesome! You know what that means...stretch goal time!
STRETCH GOAL 1 - $5,500 - UNLOCKED
We hit $5500, so everyone who pledges $5 or more is getting a North Bend: Behind the Scenes PDF! Take a look at the process of creating North Bend, with concept art, the full issue one script with notes & commentary, process art, and more! We've also added a new $5 level for this if you're at the $3 level and want to upgrade.
STRETCH GOAL 2 - $6,500 - UNLOCKED
We're working with Benjamin Mackey to create a set of 5 North Bend character cards! They'll be 2.75 x 4.75", similar to his mind-blowing Twin Peaks tarot cards - check them out here:  
http://www.benjaminmackey.com/twinpeakstarot
Summon arcane spirits or use them as a bookmark! We'll be throwing in random cards with each shipped order ($9 level and up). Here's how it'll work.
Pledge at the $9 or $15 reward level - get 1 card
$20 or $25 - 2 cards
$30 or $35 - 3 cards
$70 and up - all 5 cards!
OVERVIEW
North Bend is a crime saga set in Washington state. In the not too distant future, a DEA agent and veteran of the War in Russia joins a secret CIA program - where an experimental mind control drug is tested on criminals, small-timers, and other seedy types.
This Kickstarter is to help fund issue #1 (which is 32 pages) of the ten issue series.
Standard cover for North Bend #1 by Robert Carey (a few more design elements left to add)
THE STORY
In the not too distant future, the US is at war, against Russia and its own people. The country is on the verge of economic collapse and political revolution. Desperate to regain control, the CIA recruits Seattle DEA Agent Brendan Kruge to test an experimental mind control drug on unwitting Americans.
Compelled by his sense of duty to his country, Brendan struggles to keep his life from falling apart as he tries to reconcile his personal beliefs with the security of the nation.
The story is loosely inspired by the true events of MKULTRA - a secret CIA project that took place during the cold war, where experimental drugs (like LSD) and mind control methods were tested on people without their knowledge.
Variant cover for North Bend #1 by Tula Lotay (a few more design elements left to add)
PREVIEW
Below we have an eight page preview of North Bend #1. These first few pages are just a small look at what's to come. The story starts out pretty low-key, and starts to build and escalate from these pages. There’s a lot of story in this issue, at 32 pages and 7-8 panels on average per page. Future issues will have a similar page and panel count.
This preview is recommended for mature readers.

As for what happens in the rest of the issue, without spoiling too much: we’ll see what happens to Sam and find out the effects of the drug he and Annie were testing, see an influential American communist party vying for power and protesting the war, and find out how Brendan comes in contact with the CIA.
The script for issue #1 is complete, and issue #2 is in progress. The overall plot for the series is mapped out and will span 10 issues.
CHARACTERS
These are a few of the characters we meet in our first issue. Many more characters will follow, including cops, criminals, victims, and everything in between.
THE TEAM
Ryan Ellsworth (creator/writer) and Robert Carey (illustrator)
Ryan Ellsworth - Ryan graduated from Utah Valley University with a degree in animation. He loves visual storytelling, from animation, to screenwriting, to comics. He also loves writing about himself in the third person. It's the best. Oh, hey. Yep. This is me. I'm writing this. Right now.
Robert Carey - Rob is an illustrator from Dublin, Ireland and has worked on a variety of projects, including comics published in Lightning Strike anthology, The Life and Adventures of Sherlock Holmes, and Afterworld.
Dee Cunniffe (colorist), Thomas Mauer (letterer), and Steven Forbes (editor)
Dee Cunniffe - Dee is an accomplished colorist and has worked as color assistant to some of the world's top color artists - if you read indie comics, chances are you've read something Dee's had a hand in. Some you may recognize: The Wicked + The Divine, ODY-C, Mayday, and a ton more.
Thomas Mauer - Over the past few years, Thomas has worked as a letterer, designer, art director, and editor for a wide variety of publishers including Dark Horse, Image, Oni Press, and Black Mask. He has been involved in a number of Harvey and Eisner Award nominated and winning titles, and his current lettering credits include Copperhead, Four Eyes, and Hellbent for Image Comics as well as a host of other upcoming titles he can't talk about yet.
Steven Forbes - Steven is an editor/writer with such credits as Fallen Justice, the award nominated The Standard, and Bullet Time under his belt, as well as work published by DC Comics. Steven is also the editor in chief and co-creator of ComixTribe, whose mission statement is Creators Helping Creators Make Better Comics.
BUDGET
We are asking for $4,500 to fund issue #1. Here's how it breaks down:
$2800 - production - illustration, coloring, and lettering for the remaining 24 pages (out of 32 total.)
$1200 - publishing/rewards
$450 - Kickstarter fees
Anything extra over our goal will go towards future issues and coming up with some awesome stretch goals! 
After the release of issue #1, aside from working hard on the next issues, we'll be hitting conventions, and hope to build an audience that will allow us to more easily fund the next issues and hopefully get picked up by a publisher.
REWARDS
Sample commissions by Robert Carey
More sample commissions
For our rewards, everything will be shipped in sturdy mailers to minimize damage as much as possible. Posters will be printed on glossy, quality cardstock, and have a white border for sweet framing action! Yeah borders!

http://www.northbendcomic.com

As seen on Bleeding Cool 
http://www.bleedingcool.com/2015/10/18/kicking-ass-at-kickstarter-replicator/ 
Man Or Monster?
"How do you take over a country? You release a virus that kills nine million people and then pick up the pieces"
An action thriller that intertwines enhanced humans and cutting edge technology set in a plague ravaged England - Ghost in the Shell meets X-Men and Contagion.
Set in England 10 years from now after an epidemic known as the Red Death has brought the country to its knees, a scientist heralded as its savior goes missing.  Her husband is blamed for her death, jailed and begins to lose his mind.  Due to lack of evidence he is released and starts to investigate his wife’s disappearance.  He finds the partially completed cure, a miracle drug she was developing before she disappeared, the proof that could clear him.  However, his distrust of the world he lives in convinces him he has only one option, he injects himself with the serum she created.  He gains strange and unique powers and will stop at nothing until he finds his wife and uncovers the truth.  With the whole world still wanting nothing more than the end of his existence.  The closer to the truth, the deeper his insanity.
I'm one of those people that sits down and watches a movie or a tv show and can tell you who the bad guy is within the first couple of minutes, it's gotten so bad I have just had to switch my brain off.
I'm sure I'm not the only one.  It shouldn't be like this and I hope Replicator allows you to have your brain on all the time :)
Another reason is that I find it hard to relate to a lot of superheroes these days, often the crux of their problems comes down to a moral right or wrong question as well as balancing their secret identities with their superhero lifestyles.  Personally that doesn't mirror my life at all, does it yours?
They are great at inspiring people but that isn't always what people need, I have had depression and chronic pain for around 10 years now and sometimes I just need to know that there are other people out there going through the same or similar shit.
So what's better than the main character going in"f*cking"sane during the story - and as an added benefit the more he loses his sanity the more powerful he becomes.
I want to watch/read something where the bad guys are good at their jobs.  You know shooting people, being bad guys, not shooting 50 bullets without hitting anyone.  So in order to beat the bad guys the good guys have to be awesome.
Finally I want you to question who is good and who is bad, how far can someone go before you stop cheering them on?

campaign.story:
Aporkalypse is the comedic tale of a down-on-its-luck Strip Mall that has a fortunate turn when it manages to dodge the apocalyptic destruction of the end of the world.  
Now the shop owners must learn to tolerate each other or run the risk of facing the end of days alone under the shadow of The World's Largest Pig statue.
Their humorous adventures are cooked up by over 35 indie comic creators from all over the globe. Each creative team adds their own flavor and spice to the story.
 The 125 page collection will be printed in a square-shaped format. It is available as a standard trade paperback or as a Kickstarter exclusive hardcover.
Standard Paperback Edition ($25 pledge tier)
Kickstarter Exclusive Hardcover Edition ($40 pledge tier)
It will feature a scrumptious spread of short stories, comic strips and plenty of bonus content not seen before online or anywhere!   
The cover (below) is illustrated by french artist, Vincent Dubourg, who also provided two featured stories.
Standard edition paperback cover, drawn by Vincent Dubourg
Each character began with a basic personality (hippie, geek, traveler, etc.) and a design model for clothing, body type, appearance, etc. The creative teams then fleshed out the world and characters with personality, backstory, and unique art styles.  
Here is a basic rundown of the Pig Plaza shopkeepers:
(From Left to Right: Randy, The Chip, Kobuta, Harold, Mrs. Johnson, Fern, Pickles, Bryan)
Kalua (Randy)  The Loveable Samoan BBQ Aficionado

His Hawaiian birth certificate says Kalua, but everyone began calling him Randy after he bought Randy’s Riblet Ranch. The big Samoan is the emotional anchor to the strip-mall. If you got issues, he’s got a listening ear and a riblets because, in his opinion, there's nothing that tasty BBQ can’t help.
The Chip The Tech-Obsessed Village Idiot

He goes by the name of “the Chip” and works at Everything$ Expen$ive, the one stop shop for all the latest, greatest, and, (after the apocalypse) pretty useless electronics. The Chip is a tech-obsessed jerk that suddenly finds himself thrust into the real world after the demise of the Internet. The Chip had thousands of “friends” on the Internet, in the real world he has zero. #awkward
Kobuta The Semi-Professional Cosplay Geek 
Kobuta-Chan works at The Pig Bang, the strip’s comic and game shop. She’s the only one among the survivors that has changes of clothes, even if they’re all costumes. She’s a smart, self-proclaimed geek that is obsessed with Japanese culture. The youngest of the survivors, Kobuta brings a quirky energy, even if they don’t always understand her.
Harold The Grumpy Old Lawn Lover.
Harold a tough old codger that bought the pawn shop, Piggy Bank, to go into the pawn business to add to his junk collection. In a destroyed world where even an old 8-track tape player is valuable, The Piggy Bank is a gold mine.
Mrs. Johnson The (Probably) Chinese wife. 
Harold may own The Piggy Bank pawn shop but his foreign wife, Mrs. Johnson, runs the place and her husband. Mrs. Johnson is shrewd and continually annoys Harold by selling her husband’s accumulated treasures behind his back. Mrs. Johnson doesn't speak a lick of English.  
Fern The Vegan Flower Child.
Fern has two loves: organic gardening, and her pet pig, Pickles. Strictly vegan, Fern opened her earth friendly shop, Hogs and Kisses, to promote green living and meat-free eating. When she’s not trying to bring the decimated landscape around the Plaza to life, Fern can be found protesting the Riblet Ranch.
Professor Pickles The Pig. 
 Fern's lovable pet. Pickles is a pig. A cute, cuddly pig. 
Bryan The Unfortunate British Vagabond. 
Last customer on earth. Bryan is backpacker from England. He set out to see and experience the best the world has to offer. His first (and last) stop is the “World’s Largest Pig”, a kitschy American landmark. The young traveler is in the wrong place at the right time when the apocalypse hits and only the Pig Plaza remains. The backpacked wanted to see the world, but now is stranded in the least exciting place in it.
The book will collect the 50+ comic strips that were originally featured in a weekly St. Louis area newspaper. The book will also contain exclusive never before seen short stories, created by independent comic book creators from all over the globe JUST for this book!  
Here are a few previews of the strips and shorts served up by Aporkalypse.

campaign.story:
What is Prospects?
Prospects is a new sci-fi comic from writer Max Majernik and artist Jean Franco. The kickstarter is for the 1st issue of the mini-series. The comic is the perfect balance of 50's sci-fi, 80's action, and everyday life. The story may begin with a slow burn, full of character moments a la Shaun of the Dead, but by the 7th issue there are giant kaiju creatures fighting through Ridgeville with armies, cyborgs, and zombies lining the streets.
Below, we have 2 different previews (page 1&2 and pages 18-21) and more information about the rewards. 
Story:
The town of Ridgeville has been stuck in the middle of a 150 year old battle between two mad scientists, and former colleagues, Edwin Grabowski and Victor Farsimov. Both claim to have figured out the secret of immortality and created armies of zombies and cyborgs using their respective methods. The scientists have waged a war for so long within the town that the townspeople now consider it an honor to be abducted by one of the mad scientists in their quest for glory. Anyone who shows any bit of potential, be it brains, brawn, or anything in between, will be captured by one of the scientists by the time they are 25 years old.
This brings us to 30 year old Colin Bates who isn’t one of the prospects. He has been selected by no one, not by scientists, girls, or even friends. He spends most of his days watching TV in his basement where he avoids doing odd jobs for his Grandma and her friends. Everything changes when a notorious terrorist intent on destroying both scientists appears in Colin’s basement begging Colin to take over his legacy.  
Preview
Page 1 and 2
 Pages 18-21
 Meet the Team
 Max Majernik (Writer) @SnowballMax
I currently reside in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. I have a passion for writing and took classes such as dramatic and theater writing in college in hopes of getting a dramatic writing degree. Over the past few years, I have written reviews, articles, and interviews for various comic blogs. The blog I have dedicated most of my time to is comicosity.com, where I had the pleasure of reviewing a wide range of comics and interviewing many industry regulars. 
This past year, I felt compelled to go back to my creative writing background and to focus my free time on writing an original idea. As my first venture into the world of comic writing, I put together a small miniseries that I hope people who love comics, or people who enjoy a fun story, can enjoy. 
 Thank you for the opportunity and for taking time out of your day to read what I have begun to put together!
 Jean Franco (Pencils, inks, colors, lettering...aka the whole art department) SITE
Jean is an Argentinian comic artist and a graphic designer. He started drawing as a kid inspired by the work of John Kricfalusi and Genndy Tartakovsky,among others. He works as a teacher of both professions and his recent work projects include “Monty the Dinosaur” by Loophole Comics, as a letterer in the spanish edition of “27” by Image Comics, and “Prospects", of course. He's always working on personal projects, mostly humor comics. Jean loves beer, pizza, animated movies, and all kind of comics.

We saw the sun rise, and called it God. We saw it move, and called us Center. Then stories, and myths, and happy little comforts- but they held us. Bound and in stupor we crept. Until, we learned the beauty of being wrong. It swept away the spell of firmament, until we finally gazed down upon our suspended world. We moved far, building, and changing other worlds. Slowly, did we do this, for the oceans and valleys of our world ill prepared us for the utter cold and licking heat of Space. And the dull, chill, quiet .   
     But still longing for a voice, the old melodies rang like brass bells in the minds of the lonely few. Contact made, a deal struck, and the lonely would return to their myths. Calamity and Choir. And so ended science, and the love of being wrong..  
     But such a legacy was not without its artifacts. A child was born on a satellite - our furthest reach from home. Ignorant to the dire transaction the world had made, she returns sleeping in her capsule. Science, meet the Choir.
Scout, first born of Titan.
Too cryptic? OK, I'll give away a bit more. After the Gold Rush tells the story of the Titan-born Scout, as she returns to her ancestral home of Earth. The first issue is a little more Twilight Zone than the rest of the series. But, like science, After the Gold Rush starts with a mystery. So that's all for now! 
As we have it planned, the story unfolds over twenty five issues. ATGR #1 will be 22 pages, for the main story. With several pages of special features. We plan on doing a series of paper issues, digital issues, and trade paper backs later on. But, this Kickstarter is to get that all rolling!   
Isaac La Russa, Miles Greb, and Michael Shephard

Scout, Biology nerd.
    After the Gold Rush has three major goals. The first is to tell a good story, that will matter. None of our other aspirations will manifest without a rich narrative. The motivations for ATGR are much more - but they are nothing without a rich narrative. 
    At a con last year, I saw some wonderful and a few worrying trends in comics. The wonderful was the focus on perspectives from many different sub-cultures. I am a huge fan of Silver Age books; the early Marvel books created the artistic dialect for most the medium. The good of this precedent is the optimistic Sci-Fi expansionism, heroic deeds, and fantastic ideas. The bad, was that these wonderful stages lack diversity in their actors. This is now changing in Comics. But while I saw this inclusion for so many groups, I did not see a single book that was openly created by or for atheists, skeptics, and the hard science crowd.
    The worrying trend is fear. Science has been playing the role of the atom bomb again, instead of the moon-lander. Tomorrow will be dark, there will be zombies, the buildings around you will be empty, you will be scavenging, the robots are coming, there is no help, the future will crush us, technology will twist and defame us – The end is now. No! This is not how it’s going to be. I grew up watching Cosmos and Star Trek, and that’s the future I see. That is what I want to bring back.

campaign.story:
The Land of Heroes storyline is something that is incredibly important to us. We are all fans of movies, TV shows, and literature which have one plot twist after another. Land of Heroes also has a fast paced storyline, except that, in Land of Heroes, YOU get to live the experience of becoming a hero. After learning of the long forgotten secrets of your ancestors, you gain supernatural powers and the ability to upgrade those powers until they have reached their full potential. You are then able to use these powers when battling opponents in the real world.
 Our storyline starts when a truck of radioactive GOO turns over. The GOO starts running downhill and into a nearby cemetery.
The GOO seeps into the ground. It gives rise to the Zombies, as they start climbing out of their graves.
 A group of people are waiting at the bus stop. They watch in horror as the zombies emerge from their graves and begin staggering across the road. The humans start freaking out when a group of zombies picks up the bus and carries it away, kidnapping all the people on the bus.
 A mob of humans are enraged by the kidnapping and retaliate against the zombies. The mob traps a group of zombies.
Throughout the game, human and zombie teams battle through a series of levels to save the kidnapped characters. Each time a level is won, another character is returned to them. As you progress through the game, you unlock new characters, develop new powers, and learn that you were always meant for greater things.
Players can find each other using the mapscreen. When they're close enough to each other, they can battle in one of three ways. The first way is to use buttons. There is a standard attack button and a second one for your power. Your power does more damage but also consumes more energy.
The second way to battle each other is by dueling. When dueling, players can swing their phone like a Wii remote to battle each other. Players who duel have both a standard attack or power to inflict damage.
The third way to battle players is using your goblin army. Armies can be sent players who are close by.
 In Land of Heroes, you become a moving base with your own support, defense, and army. However, instead of buildings you get your support, defense, and army from three different classes of magic creatures which stay with you everywhere you go.
Gnomes are your support. They collect gold and other resources, give you new abilities, make you stronger, and give you new powers.
Your Goblin Army can be sent to other players, but first they need to make it through an opponent's guardians. Goblins can be leveled up to increase their stats.
Your Guardians, can be placed to form a defensive perimeter around you. They walk with you everywhere you go.
The drive to create a new gaming experience hasn't taken the focus off of the fact that we are creating games for gaming fans. Our favorite games also had places for the community to go and build upon the gaming experience by talking about the game, bragging about our latest conquer or stats...and yes, even getting into the odd heated debate.
Our Kickstarter campaign will be the launch of our community. We are starting with lots of ways for people to get involved and learn more about the game. Check our social media accounts for lots of events and news. In our first event, we will be releasing a piece of character art everyday and letting the community guess what the character's name and role in the game is. There are several other events going on and other ways to get involved.
MAKE IT YOUR OWN!!!
We worked hard to create some awesome rewards and offer them at a low tier. However, the point of the Kickstarter campaign is to raise enough funds to make Land of Heroes. It is because of the desire to offer unique, and in some cases, hand built and numbered rewards that we are asking our backers to cover the cost of shipping for tiers that include a physical reward.
We have gone to Kickstarter because it's a place that values creators and indie game studios. Kickstarter will allow us to keep our creative freedom and not make us compromise on the vision for Land of Heroes. The money raised will allow us to create a game that has the uncompromising principle of creating the most meaningful experience possible for a player.
We have already created the technology behind Land of Heroes. We need your help to finish working on the in-game art. Your money will go towards creating new characters, upgraded versions of each character, animations, and a greater number of avatar features. You will be able to fully customize your avatar. Your support will also allow us to support both Android and iOS platforms.
Our stretch goals will allow us to increase the scope of the game by including new features, adding more levels, and supporting additional platforms.
We're an indie game studio that came together because of our passion for real-time strategy games. Our late 1990's were devoted to playing Command & Conquer and StarCraft. Since then strategy games have become much simpler, removing the control that players have over their troops and losing a lot of the strategy involved in a strategy game. Our passion for classic RTS games lead us to a question. What if a player could become a base with their own defense, support, and army which followed them everywhere they go, allowing them to find and battle other players? This question and passion snowballed and eventually became Land of Heroes. A game which modernizes the game mechanics, strategy, challenge and fun of 1990's RTS games by turning players into a moving bases.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Video games are a complicated art form which require a variety of creative people to work towards the same goal. However, we already have a prototype of our mobile game built. While console and PC games take years of development time, most of the problem solving has already been done on the mobile versions. We already have a working prototype that we were able to demo.

The more significant undertaking is the support of augmented reality headsets. This is a new technology that we hope to support upon reaching our stretch goals. There are inherent risks with new technology. This is why an experienced team is as important as a project itself. We have a team of accomplished experts, and while there are risks in supporting any project on Kickstarter, they are minimized when supporting a team like this one.

campaign.story:
OUR STORY
A young woman in modern-day New York is pulled into the clandestine world of the 'Paths when her Quantum Leap-like ability to experience the life of a 13th century Japanese warrior begins to manifest, launching her on a global race across time to unravel an ancient mystery before mankind is consumed by darkness.
What makes PATHS unique is that it's a hero's journey told two ways, simultaneously: in the past, with KAZE on a traditional hero's journey, and in the present, with KIMA on a separate-yet-linked heroine's journey of her own.
Thematically, PATHS examines why history repeats itself and the dual narrative allows us to explore the concepts of Joseph Campbell's Monomyth theory while challenging the roles women typically play in hero's journeys.
Themes aside, PATHS is an epic supernatural action/adventure comic series brimming with intrigue. It will take readers on a fantastical journey around the world and across time with a diverse cast of memorable characters in a tale that's part Quantum Leap, part X-Men and The Matrix.

January is a bullied teenager who finds solace in the embrace of synthetic-being Rho. Her friends and family are unready to accept this, but when January takes a stand against the prejudice of the law, no-one is prepared for what happens next...
Silicon Heart is a 120 page graphic novel, made up of four 30 page issues, written by Sam Roads and illustrated by Kat Nicholson.
Having won a prestigious Literature Wales grant in 2014 to help complete issue 1 of Silicon Heart ('A Better Tomorrow'), we launched it in April at the Egbaston Comic Festival, to excellent reviews. (See below)
Our aim with this Kickstarter project is to raise additional funds towards the completion and quarterly publication of the remaining three parts of Silicon Heart.

"Roads' and Nicholson's touching, heartfelt tale of teenage love and alienation starts out with the particular and becomes universal." - Mike Carey (X-Men, Hellblazer)
"Evoking classic outsider stories, whether marked by class, race or colour, Sam and Kat give us a heartbeat-away future where synthetic humans (though still overtly robotic) live amongst us.
There's a back story, hinted at but as yet unrevealed, suggesting a bigger, grimmer aspect to this world- what exactly IS the New Model Army, and why was it needed?- and the casual racism (cog-ism?) goes unquestioned and unremarked. It's as normal as the driverless cars.
Kat's sweet, warmly rendered art illuminates a charming tale of the girl-who-doesn't-fit, where all the humans are self-deluded and the only self-aware character is mechanical. Her style cleverly distracts us from the dark, hidden truths.

- Cover for European Comics Journal #02 (art by Teresa Marzia) - 
Seven weeks ago we launched the European Comics Journal at the LSCC and we are now ready to give a few hints about the second issue, due for release this June/July. We have decided to look at comics from a very particular angle in this second issue, proving that comics are indeed a universal means, open to both subjects and readers of all types. In issue one we talked about crime, mystery, alien abductions and high fantasy. In the second issue we will look at diversity, homosexuality and LGBT themes in European comic books, and how various authors have covered the topic in their works.
In recent years, openly gay characters have made their appearance in a variety of comics, and they are no longer a taboo to be found only in underground and niche comics. Although Europe, compared to the United States, has been more open to the subject, most publishers had a conservative profile and avoided openly gay characters in their titles. There have been a few exceptions, mostly in France where the American cartoonists Drake and Starr choose to publish so that they can avoid the reach of USA censorship. In Italy, Luca Enoch used gay characters in his comics and was often open about the sexuality of his female protagonists whilst we also have German Ralf Koning, and 2000AD in Great Britain published Devlin Waugh by Sean Smith and Sean Phillips. And that is only a few of those we will cover. 
Confirmed interviews: Luca Enoch, Ralf Koning. 
I have to admit that the recent buzz about the Indiana bill, emblematic of the discriminatory feeling still dominant across the world, forcing many gay people to move to less oppressive areas, has motivated the decision to dedicate the second issue of European Comics Journal to the topic. I believe as a publisher that comics should feed the minds of their readers, helping to show the world and society as it is, with diversity in all of its glory. There are authors that do it with humour, others who do it with drama - you cannot stop someone’s creativity from following its own path and that is exactly why we need to bring light to freedom of expression in comics. 
WE NEED YOUR HELP TO PRODUCE THIS AWESOME SECOND ISSUE OF EUROPEAN COMICS JOURNAL! HIT THE GREEN BUTTON NOW!

Diego Comics Publishing is a family run business with limited resources, our titles aren't distributed in book retailers, we sell at conventions and through our website, working hard to raise awareness around our amazing titles.

campaign.story:
This is an adult comic with graphic language, graphic violence, murder and suggestive themes.
What's the story?
Everyone, except for the mega rich, are fighting trying times. Politicians are bought out by corporations. Corporations own all the land and use it for processing. And the general public? Well, they've become nothing more than numbers in a CEO's book.
Sound familiar?
In the year 2071, many trials that seem daunting and almost mythical today have become the norm. There's no secrecy behind the corruption, because there's no more will or hope to fight it. But as with any looming despair there are always those willing to stand in the face of adversity. Even if the odds are physically, mentally, economically, and supernaturally stacked against them.
Enter the mysterious cabal of shadow warriors who wear animal masks and fight with weapons made of bone. Will they accept Mateus as one of his own, or will they see the darkness in his heart?
This is the first issue of American Oni. It'll be a 36 page comic, featuring 32 pages of story telling, a couple pages of concept art, fan art and a page with gracious thanks to our backers!
Here's a preview of issue #1!
And preview from issue #14!
Where did this idea come from?
This project has been in development for 5 years and was the result of growing up in the 90s and learning about conspiracy theories. It is our chance to prove our capabilities as a budding studio, and to give you an epic adventure to embark on. If the project is successful we will follow up with a collection of three books, covering Mateus’s journey into New York and the wild network of conspiracies he must face to hunt his prey. 
Are you ready to see the darker side of the world?
What's the funding for?
My team! Carl has been covering all the costs up to this point, and now it's "above his pay grade." He's hoping that all his effort in writing, producing and directing will inspire Kickstarter patrons to help finish this project!
30% will be used for printing the comics, the posters, and the pendants! 
10% will be used for packing and shipping.
40% will be used to pay our art team to finish up our first issue.
10% will be used to upgrade our online storage capabilities so we can transfer our files without losing any quality. That way you get the best possible results!
And the final 10% will pay for processing fees for Kickstarter!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are a varying amounts of risks that could arise. We're all scattered across the globe, so communication is definitely one of the challenges we've been overcoming on a daily process. 

Through DropBox, Skype, and E-mail we've been able to maintain communication rather easily. Part of the funding will be used to expand our abilities to communicate and bolster our online storage for transferring files to ensure no quality is lost between transfers.

The biggest challenge I foresee is packaging and mailing all the rewards. Packaging takes a long time! We're seeking a "fulfillment" partner, but I've been preparing the apartment for an influx of potentially hundreds of envelopes needing to be packed. I've got a station prepared and friends waiting with the promise of pizza, just need the rewards to ship out!

            A year ago,THE CHAIR was just a graphic novel and a script...
A cast and crew didn't breathe life into it yet, there was no film, no set, no wardrobe - nothing.
I had created the comic in 2006 as a six-part mini-series that was later compiled in 2008 as a graphic novel. Kevin Christensen's art and Erin Kohut's editing helped to create one of the flagship titles at Alterna Comics and seven years later, here we are. When we held a Kickstarter campaign last year to raise money for pre-production development on the film - all of that changed.
Our first campaign didn't reach its $300K goal, but we made it almost half-way there and managed to pick up investor interest, distributor interest, and build awareness for our film. When we relaunched with a smaller goal of $40K, we had some ups and downs but in the end, 499 backers came together to make filming possible!
We went through some casting and production crew changes since then but on February 9th, 2015 - cameras began rolling. We wrapped principal photography about two weeks later and are now at a point in post-production where it's time to start taking the last steps to tie up any loose ends on the film.
from left to right: Noah Hathaway, Derrick Damions, Roddy Piper, Kyle Hester, Zach Galligan star as the Warden's sadistic group of PRISON GUARDS; center: Ezra Buzzington stars as the crazed inmate TUDLEY
To do this, we need funds to edit, correct and enhance the color and sound, hire a composer to create a chilling soundtrack - basically everything that needs to be done to turn a hundred hours of raw footage into a great movie.
Here's a quick breakdown of our budget and the funds needed to complete the film:
Editing - $7000
Color and Sound - $6000
Composer - $4000
Reward Creation - $2000
Kickstarter fees - ~$1000
Total - $20,000
If we raise more than what we're asking for, these funds will go towards submitting to film festivals and comic and horror conventions.
Richard Sullivan (Tim Muskatell) is an innocent man struggling to escape his fate on death row...
Witnessing the brutal killings of his fellow inmates (played by Ezra Buzzington, Jacob Banser, and John Siciliano) at the hands of the prison's sadistic and psychotic Warden (Bill Oberst Jr.) and his crew of guards (played by Roddy Piper, Noah Hathaway, Zach Galligan, Derrick Damions, and Kyle Hester), Sullivan decides that the only way to survive is to fight back. campaign.story:
Stretch Goal #1 £1700 funded. 
Queen: Uprising Uncoloured Preview:  An uncoloured, but fully lettered, preview of pages 1-6 of Queen: Uprising (part 2). All backers will be sent a digital preview of these 'fierce' pages.  
Stretch Goal #2 £1800 funded.
Queen: Uprising Coloured Preview:  The complete digital preview of pages 1-6 of Queen: Uprising. Believe me when I say this... testing times are coming for Emily Green.  
You will be the first in the world to read 6 pages of Part Two way ahead of everyone else. These stretch goals will be available to all backers.
In 2013 I began therapy for an anxiety disorder called Obsessive Compulsive Disorder. One of my coping mechanisms was to come up with stories about confronting some of the things I was afraid of like corruption, inequality and the consequences of actions. After gaining confidence, making steps towards stability in my life, I began to want to develop what I had daydreamed about for so long. This is the result of my journey from struggling to leave my home, washing my hands up to 25 plus times a day, to attempting to live out a life long goal of creating stories.
What is Queen?
Queen is a political thriller starring Emily Green, the Deputy Prime Minister, in a United Kingdom set in an alternate universe. The mother of one is beginning to question the choices she has made in life, and her role in the Conservation party.
It's 2015 and Britain is nearing a general election, tempers are flaring and the country cannot shake off the feeling that Prime Minister Daniel Camden isn't the honest character he would have you believe. Continued rumors of corruption, plans to privatize the Nominated Health Service (NHS) and difficulties connecting with the people of his country are not helping his case for a second term in power. All of this eventually leads to a tragedy that will shape the country's political landscape for generations. The question everyone wants to know is 'who killed Camden?'
The Kickstarter is carefully planned for a first time creator, but as a result Queen Part One will be an extremely limited print.
Queen will be a 24-page comic (including the outer) if this Kickstarter is successful. Here is the cover design and six fully completed pages to preview:
Jamie Me is the creator, writer and letterist of Queen. In his spare time he enjoys reading comics, submission wrestling and is a huge fan of open world survival games.
You can keep up with Jamie on Twitter and Facebook.
Bernadinus "Bernard" Gita is the artist of Queen. He loves listening to any type of music except country, watching movies, reading comics, drawing, watching sports, playing video games and culinary.
If you want to see more art by Bernadinus you can take a look at his Deviant Art page.
Sean Callahan is the colorist of the group. He recently won 'Best Colorist' in a Reddit competition.. He has been coloring for a few years now and over the last couple months has been seriously pursuing it as a career. He has a great passion for comics, digital art, and story telling and has found coloring to be a natural fit.

To look at more work by Sean you can visit his website here: www.callahancolors.com
The trio when not producing comics often converse on Google Hangouts, and have found out some very interesting facts about each other. For example:
- Jamie and Bernadinus share a common interest in Mixed Martial Arts.
- Bernadinus was on his high schools basketball team, and he even broke his wrist during a game.
- Sean & Jamie competed on opposing teams against each other in a Reddit comic competition.
 The Queen reward tiers are carefully designed to allow backers to easily understand what they will be getting.
 The 'Red Line' Collectors Edition is an extremely limited Kickstarter exclusive, features no logos on the front, and is hand signed and numbered.
Tier 16 Explained:
Bernadinus Gita will draw you in the 'Queen' style. You will receive an A4 heavyweight print with multiple face angles and two angles of your full body. You will also receive the 'Treasury Bundle,'
This bundle includes:
1x DRM-Free PDF copy of Queen Part One. You will be able to open this on most modern devices.
1x DRM-Free PDF copy of the Evolution of Emily development diary. This includes in-depth diary entries about creating comics with OCD from the creators perspective, creating them in general and all the uncoloured, rough sketches and everything else in between.
1x 'The Big Three' digital wallpaper for your computer.
This bundle includes:
1x first edition print of the Queen Part One comic.
1x A4 poster featuring Queen cover art. This poster doesn't have any logos or text on it.
1x ‘I Backed Green’ postcard thanking you personally. All uniquely written by the creator.
1x Bookmark featuring artwork and 'we are all to blame' text.
This bundle also includes all the digital only 'Digital Deluxe Edition' items.
Any money left over in the 'room for error' category will be used to improve the printing quality of the comic, or to improve shipping.
Lettering won't be factored into the cost as Jamie Me, the creator, is also lettering the project.
Music used is royalty free courtesy of musopen.org.

Here are some of the challenges the project may face:

- Delays in the production of artwork due to unforeseen circumstances. For example: sickness, injury and other acts out of reasonable control.

In any of the above circumstances I will keep in constant contact with backers, search for solutions quickly and be open about any problems faced. You can view 6 pages already fully developed as an example of the teams work ethic.

campaign.story:
Skies of Fire is a limited comic series by Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou, with art by Pablo Peppino, Bryan Valenza, and Nic J Shaw. Skies was launched last year on Kickstarter with the generous support of 525 backers, and since then has been named one of the best graphic novels of 2014 by the Village Voice.
This Kickstarter's goal is to raise funds to print issue #2 and reprint issue #1. Between our original backers and the conventions we attended in 2014-2015, Skies managed to sell all 1,150 first edition copies of issue #1! 
The books printed from this run will have an updated cover logo and design which will be used for the series going forward. 
UPDATE: Thank you all so much for your support in making this possible! We have some awesome stretch goals to continue the adventure of Skies of Fire into Issue #3! Please share and support!
Skies of Fire takes place in the Aquilan Empire, a kingdom where airship travel has become the dominant means of transportation, commerce, and war. In the center of the Empire lies a monstrous, never-ending storm called The Expanse.
In Issue One, the raider Delmonte orchestrates a surprise attack on the key trade outpost, Port Prince. 
His actions prompt Royal Guard Captain Helen Pierce to volunteer for an expedition to bring him to justice.
Issue Two follows Captain Pierce as she begins her pursuit by recruiting a key ally, the elusive William.
Vincenzo Ferriero and Ray Chou have been creating stories together since 2008. They met in college and continue to collaborate despite being 5,437 miles apart.
Pablo Peppino is a an illustrator from Argentina with a focus on sequential art. His work can be found in publications from Mythopoeia to Marvel to Boom! He recently moved to Valencia where he now draws full time.   
Bryan Valenza is an artist based in Jakarta, Indonesia. He currently occupies his time coloring various projects while attending university.
Nic J Shaw is a writer, letterer, and graphic designer. His work can be found everywhere - no seriously, Nic seems to know everyone. He lives in Sydney, Australia with his fiancée and their schnauzer, Archer. 
Josephe Vandel is a German cartographer and graphic designer with a love for RPGs and creating fictional worlds.
Alexandur Bucur is an architect and illustrator with an interest in history and military hardware of all kinds. When not at his drawing table he can be found either standing at attention in a swanky uniform for the benefit of the Military Traditions branch of the Romanian Army. 
Minobu Sato is a Japanese-born, American artist with a focus on Sumi-e, or Ink Wash Art. She grew up with lots of Japanese comic books and sci-fi reading and actually majored in fine arts during her college days at Boston University. 
The Skies of Fire team stands by their policy of transparency when it comes to crowdfunding. The funds for this Kickstarter will be used as follows:
Skies of Fire is printed in a beautiful 8x11" oversized format that showcases the incredible talent of our artists. The size harkens to a European aesthetic, reflecting the diverse background of the people working on the project.
In addition to the story, each issue contains a 3-4 page codex in the back of the book. The codex provides additional background and context to the world much like an old school video game manual or tabletop rulebook. 
Ships of the World by Alexandur Bucur, part of the codex for issue two. Also available as a poster print.
Variant covers give us an opportunity to showcase and collaborate with artists whose work otherwise might not be shown in comics. For issue two, our variant cover is done by the extremely talented sumie artist and calligrapher Minobu Sato of Studio MyCKs. 
Hand painted by Minobu Sato. Variant includes Mythopoeia Logo on the back!
 The variant features a recreation of a key scene from issue two:
All of our variant issues are Kickstarter exclusive and limited by demand based on the campaign. What you order is what we print.  
We listened to feedback from backers of our first Kickstarter, and one of the major areas we felt we could improve was in our packaging. This time around all comics will be bagged and boarded before being shipped with rigid chipboard mailers. 
Mailed with sturdy chipboard mailers, bagged and boarded. Issue #1 First Print and Variant shown.
Chipboard mailers are incredibly durable and almost impossible to bend. They'll keep the comics safe as they're in transit to you while the bags and boards will ensure they'll continue to remain in mint condition for years to come. 
The rest of our of packaging includes three inch diameter cardboard tubes for posters and cardboard parcel packages for large orders, along with bubble wrap.  
Add-Ons will be handled post campaign by our partners, Backerkit. You will be able to select additional a la carte items for purchase after you confirm your shipping information. Funds in excess of your chosen reward tier can also be used to purchase add-ons in Backerkit. If you have a specific question about an add-on, please don't hesitate to directly message us.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We learned a lot from our first Kickstarter. Even though we did our best to ship our rewards out on time, in the end we were a little late when it came to delivery. A large part of that came from underestimating the time needed to produce high quality art, but the other half came from having to learn from scratch the production and printing process.

This time around we’re very confident that we’ll hit our timeline for one major reason: production of the book is complete. We’ve given ourselves three months to ship the books, which is a generous estimation. Of course, delays are still possible -- there is an ongoing dock dispute at Long Beach, our shipment might get lost, or an unforeseen Chinese holiday might be delay printing -- but overall we feel confident that we can hit our projected timeline. 

With every project we learn and grow. We will always do our best to communicate how the project is going, something our previous backers can hopefully attest.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

My name is Ben Bishop, I'm a comic creator from Maine. My first book, Nathan The Caveman, was a 300-page graphic novel, self-published in 2008.This was followed by several other projects including, the award-winning, Lost Trail, Nine Days Alone in the Wilderness, published by Downeast books. More recently I had a short story in Archaia's, The Reason for Dragons, as well as cover artwork for IDW's, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series. This will be my sixth self-published book, but the FIRST with help from YOU.
Artist originals and prints will be revealed and become available throughout the campaign. If you select a print reward, you don't have to choose which prints you want until it's time to ship.

- THE SHAPE OF SOUND VOLUME 2. A 300 page full color sketchbook including just about everything I've drawn between 2009 and 2014, including a full 45 page preview of another book of mine, SOMETHING LIKE FALLING. ( PDF only )

I have been making comics since I was 11 and self publishing since I was 18. I am no stranger to large comic projects, deadlines or shipping costs.
